For example, the first two moves for white in the Sicilian are written as “e2-e4” and “Ng1-f3.”  I found this horribly annoying and distracting, sometimes making the wrong piece moves on the board or in my head, because I tend to glance at the book to determine move orders. I imagine that they’ve done this to better serve the beginner, causal, and weaker club players, because the cost of the extra ink must have been noticeable in their bottom line.In short, the set is a good companion for studying openings for USCF/FIDE tournament play, but it could be a good one-stop-shop for beginners and casual players who seek less explanation than upper-level club and advanced players desire.

I really teetered between four and five stars for this book, and I just can’t give it five.  The deciding factor is that I think Emms is a little bit unclear in his writing in some places, dropping a misplaced pronoun with sentences like “And he’s fine.”  There wasn’t anyone being talked about, in particular, previously, so who is “he.”  I haven’t had this problem with the other “Starting Out” books (Ruy Lopez, Caro-Kann, and Dutch), so it’s certainly not me.  This happens in in a few places in the text, but it isn’t rampant or anything.  The major reason the book pushed me on the side of 4 stars is that I think it is a monumental task to put this book kind of general introduction to the Sicilian together, and it is an achievement just doing so, as John Watson’s blurb says, but it is nearly impossible to do a great job with this project.  I felt some of the lines of discussion that were given on lines was a bit too much and overly complicated for a “Starting Out” book.  Compare this to others in the “Starting Out” series, and I think you’ll come away from each variation with the key ideas, objectives, and popular mentalities that go into plan construction for that variation.  In Emms’ book, my take away was decent, but much vaguer in some cases.  Finally, the minor detraction I haven’t mentioned is that Emms includes games that do not represent the latest in theory, but that are, as he says, some of the funner games.  That’s okay, but the idea of including practical games as concrete examples is to show the execution of ideas mentioned in the body of the chapter.  Therefore, not only are the ideas in a variation sometimes vague in a section or chapter, but the practical games don’t serve as a presentation for the ideas.Aside from these downsides, I think this is a good book to launch yourself into play against the Sicilian or to employ the Sicilian.  Everyman has an excellent recipe in this “Starting Out” series, and they are typical so good as a first introduction to an opening that I think it is nearly a waste of time to habitually remark on all of the positives, but I’ll list a few.  The books in this series, Emms’ included, are well organized, the diagram choices are exceptions, the content is relevant to popularly played club games AND to the international scene, the lightbulb indicators (symbols used in the text) are usually extremely helpful, as are the boldfaced notices for dangers, and the books are reasonably sturdy.  I haven’t found a better first-introduction to the Sicilian, and I trust “Starting Out” by name.

Rachel Goddard has no memories of her past before the age of five. She's always found this strange but any time she brings it up her mother always has an excuse. Rachel's never felt the need to press the issue until an incident at work triggers a strange flashback that leads her to dig deeper. What She finds isn't at all what she expected to find when she began snooping into her family's past.  In fact, it raises even more questions in her mind.  It also leads her to the realization that her mother is harboring a secret, one she will go to great lengths to protect.When Rachel's determination to get to the truth pits her against her mother and sister, she finds an ally in colleague, Dr. Luke Campbell, a fellow veterinarian.  They begin a relationship with one another and while Luke claims to love her, Rachel doesn't feel she can move forward until she solves the mystery of her past.Excellent suspense, major twist at the end, and I'm definitely sold on Rachel.  I would certainly recommend it to others!

I loved this book when it first came out in the nineties and am so glad I was able to purchase it in e-reader form so I could enjoy it all over again.  Jackson Rule spent fifteen years in prison for killing his abusive father. His sister is in a mental facility because of it. Now he's looking to reconnect with her, pick up the pieces of his life, and start over. First he has to find a place to live and get a job. Finding an apartment doesn't take long when it's in a bad part of town.  Employment, on the other hand? No one wants to hire an ex-con.  No one until Rebecca, that is. She needs help with her nursery. Her assistant, Pete, is slowing down, not in the best shape, so when Jackson comes in looking for work she decides to give him a shot. Pete is against it as is Rebecca's father, the Reverand.  Even so,  the fact Jackson served time doesn't bother her as much as the old scars criss-crossing his back. She has a feeling there's more to the story than what he's telling.Their love story was one I thoroughly enjoyed reading and the fact she took time to build the relationship between them made for a refreshing change from some of the books nowadays where the couple is in bed together at the drop of a hat.  This also had a big twist at the end I wasn't expecting the first time I read it and had forgotten about until I read it again.  Love the book!

Jason was attracted to Mara but knew it wouldn't go anywhere once she found out he was the one who'd bought her doll store from her landlord. He did it to keep her safe. The building was in horrible condition and Mara didn't have the money to fix it up.  He was hoping she'd simply relocate. However, he didn't count on her stubbornness or the sentimentality she attached to the place.  When the two of them get involved it complicates things until Mara almost loses her life in a fire. Jason's solution is to move her into his guest house. Now, if he can somehow overcome his past, they might have a future.A good addition to the author's billionaire series. While it wasn't my favorite as far as plots go, I liked the characters and enjoyed catching up with the rest of the Sinclair family.

This book was much better than the last one. Jessyka had me intrigued from the start when she was first introduced.  She was trying to be tough while coping with an abusive ex. In truth she was very vulnerable. Until she found a protector in Benny. He was so wonderful to her and helped her when she really needed help. While parts of the book were somewhat like the others, the author did a good job of mixing it up in this one.

The author has cemented a place in my heart and on my book shelf as I find myself totally engrossed in her work. And she keeps getting better with each new book she writes.To give you a little background, Nan Vining is a detective with the Pasadena Police Department.  A couple of years prior to this story, she was ambushed, stabbed and left to die. She actually flatlined for two minutes before she was revived.  Her attacker was never found.  However, she believes he was the one who sent her a pearl necklace and a card offering his congratulations after she was involved in a high profile shooting.  I won't go into detail here but suffice it to say that she's done some digging on her own and come up with another case similar to hers, also involving a female police officer.  Unlike Nan, however, the other officer didn't survive.That said, when this particular story opens, Nan and her partner, Jim Kissick are in the middle of a lover's' tryst when they're both called out to a homicide. A man dressed as a clown was gunned down while spray painting gangland graffiti on a mosaic at a construction site. The tag reads China Dog 187.  According to California's Penal Code a 187 is a murder so the graffiti would be understood to mean Death to China Dog.  When their gangbanger' s tattoos reveal him to be a former member of the Latin Kings they are puzzled as to why he would be threatening China Dog? As far as they knew the Kings weren't at was with any Chinese gangs.  However, Nan is quick to point out that the writing on the wall looks familiar. It reminds her of her attacker's handwriting, looks the same as the card he sent with the necklace. Was this killing the guy's way of sending a message to Nan? When she mentions it in front of her co-workers they think she's imagining things. Even Kissick seems skeptical so Nan drops it. For one thing, Kissick doesn't know all Nan does about her case. Nor is he aware she obtained information as well as evidence illegally, something that could cost her not only her job but her relationship with him as well.As they settle into the case, Nan is surprised when she is suddenly put in charge. It seems Kissick has a new lead on Nan' s case so he's been assigned to look into it while Nan handles the murder.This one kept my interest from start to finish. I couldn't read fast enough, I so wanted to discover what happened in the end.  And let me tell you, it came as a shock to me! Didn't see it coming at all!  I also enjoyed the way Nan' s relationship with Kissick progressed.  She wants to keep it quiet, he doesn't care who knows so when he goes out of his way to protect her from ridicule by another officer, she gets upset.  She's his partner, yes, but also her lover, and he's having a hard time separating the two.  I also like the fact Nan is tough while on the job yet still plagued privately by insecurity stemming from her attack. Little things, for instance, can trigger a panic attack. The scars on her neck and hand make her oftentimes feel self-conscious.  The author did a great job creating the characters. Even Nan' s daughter, Emily, adds to the appeal of the story having suffered right along with her mother as they tried to pick up the pieces of their lives and move forward after the attack.There's plenty of suspense, action and danger, along with a little romance on the side. Definitely recommend!

Julie loved Chase, had planned to marry him. They were best friends. Chase spent every summer and his winter breaks with his grandmother. Julie lived next door.  It was the ideal set-Up. Until it wasn't. Until everything fell apart.Ten years go by, Julie's alone, her family gone, and Chase' s grandmother has just passed. Now Chase is home, fixing up the house, getting it ready to sell.  Their reunion is bittersweet. Julie still blames him for walking away even though she's the one who gave her heart to another man. But what was she to do?  He'd left her just when she'd needed him most, seldom called, seldom came home. Then when he did he thought they could pick up where they'd left off. Only he'd been wrong.Nice second chance romance. Enjoyed the suspense element to the story.  The author always delivers a good read and this one didn't disappoint.

Kade went to the airport to pick up their new ranch hand. It would be good to have another single guy around. All his brothers had found their soul mates, gotten married and started having babies. And they were constantly razzing him about being the only one yet to find a wife.  He didn't think his chances were very good considering the family ranch was out in the middle of nowhere. The closest town had one blinking light, a gas station convenience store, and not a whole lot else.Ryan worked harder than any man on her family ranch, putting in long hours and loving every minute of it. She's devastated when her father dies and her mother decides to sell.  While Ryan could stay and work for her uncle, she figures she'd be better off elsewhere. So she answers an ad in the paper for a each hand and heads to Texas.Kade is astonished to discover the new hand is a woman. He comes close to refusing to take her home with him and when he does he gives her a hard time at every turn. Mainly because he's attracted to her and has a difficult time keeping his hands to himself.  But Ryan proves herself capable time and time again and they soon begin to grow close. So how does Kade convince her he's interested not because he needs a wife to inherit his share of the ranch, but because he's fallen for her hook, line, and sinker?Love the Dalton boys. Was glad Kade finally got his happily ever after.  Even though he and Ryan were both strong-willed and stubborn, determined to succeed, they were a perfect match for one another.  Great read.

Carter owned his own security firm. When he agrees to do protection detail for Congressman Fuller he doesn't realize he and his firm are being set up.  Until a beautiful party crasher walks up to him and offers him money to pose as her partner for the evening. Two goons are after her and she needs his help. Carter is amused to discover the "goons" are his own men who were guarding the front door and that the woman somehow managed to slip by them.  He runs interference for her, curious as to what she's up to but when he turns around she's gone. He follows her, sure she's no threat to the Congressman, only to find her searching one of the man's offices.  She informs him the Congressman is up to no good and the person whose office she is searching is dead. His car blew up while he was on the phone with her, wanting to blow the whistle on the Congressman's recent activities. She's a reporter and she lets Carter know he and his crew are patsys being set up to take the fall. Carter is skeptical until the bullets start flying.Lots of action, danger, and suspense.  The romance is nice as well. Really enjoyed this. Can't wait to read the next one.

Gillian Tucker shoots her father right before he tosses her out a window.  Hopped up on meth and trying to force her little brother to go with him, her father pulls a gun on her. After being beaten by him for most of her life, she realizes one of them is about to die and it wasn't going to be her.  She was fourteen when her brother was born and when her mother died shortly thereafter, Gillian is the one who's raised him.  She'll protect him at any cost.  After killing her father in self-defense she's in bad shape.  Having suffered numerous injuries in the fall, if she wants to keep Justin, her brother, with her she has no choice but to accept her grandfather's invitation to stay at his ranch in Montana.  She doesn't know the man but promises Justin that if he's anything like their father they won't be staying.Blake Bowden is part owner of Three Peaks Ranch. He manages the place and handles all the paperwork. It's home to him. When Gillian arrives all he has is a sketchy account of what happened. When he sees just how bad she's been hurt, he wants to kill her father all over again.  He's also amazed to discover she brought her brother along. They didn't know the boy existed. Blake can also see all the fear and uncertainty in both of them. He knows they have their work cut out for them, earning their trust and getting them to feel comfortable on the ranch.Gillian finds everything she could possibly want at Three Peaks Ranch.  Love, acceptance, a true home for the first time in her life, and to her astonishment, happiness.  And then there's Blake. She's never met anyone like him. He's always watching over her, making sure she has everything she needs. He plays with Justin, has taught him how to ride, and treats him like his little brother. He also inspires all kinds of feelings she isn't quite sure how to deal with. She's always put Justin first, never stopping to think about her own desires, but for the first time in her life she's thinking about a future - with Blake.A truly enjoyable story. Loved the characters, liked the fact there was also an element of danger involved and that Gillian had some issues from her past to overcome in order to move into the future. Very good read. Definitely recommend!

John used to be a cop but now works as a private investigator due to a call he made that turned out wrong and ultimately cost him his career. It's haunted him ever since. Now he's been asked to look into the murder of a country singer's daughter. The police are calling it a robbery gone bad but John's client is convinced his daughter's no good boyfriend killed her. He wants John to prove it. Once John gets involved, he finds there's a whole lot more going on than what either one of them could have predicted.Loved John with his sarcastic sense of humor and his refusal to give up when the odds are stacked against him. Also loved his sister, the hard-as-nails police chief, and his wife who doesn't put up with any of his crap. A very good read all the way around.

Aroostine and husband Joe, are on a sort of celebratory getaway.  After being separated, on the verge of divorce, Joe was almost killed because of a case Aroostine got involved in because of her job as an assistant United States attorney.  While away, she gets a call from her former boss asking if she can contact a potential witness in an embezzling case. It seems the guy has gotten cold feet about testifying and isn't returning their calls.  Put out because he's contacting her during her time off but knowing it will help her career if she does it , she reluctantly agrees. Joe isn't at all happy when he finds out she's gone to talk to the guy and he's dead!  Once again they are placed in danger and have to run for their lives.What makes these books even more intriguing is Aroostine' s Native American heritage and the culture included in the story.  While she and Joe are on the run, out in the wilderness, she's called upon to use the survival skills her grandfather taught her as a child. A very wise man, she begins to recall things he told her that actually help on her case.I would definitely recommend this book, especially to all mystery and suspense fans who like a bit of a different twist to their stories.

This second book in the Nan Vining series was a good one.  The detective and her partner, Jim Kissick, are called to the scene of a brutal double murder. A local businessman and his girlfriend were the victims.  He was dismembered and her neck was broken, their bodies posed in a macabre fashion.  There's a bloody footprint obviously made by a woman's high heels.  Problem is, the size is more in keeping with what a man would wear. A cross dressing killer?As their investigation progresses, we are also brought up to date on Nan' s attempt to find the man who ambushed her, stabbed her, and left her bleeding out on the kitchen floor.  He sent her a necklace and a note once she'd recovered. The same type of necklace he sent to the husband of another murdered police officer who'd been ambushed. Now the guy is sending her notes about her daughter, tormenting her.  Determined to find him, she's looking on her own and keeping it a secret from her partner. He suspects something is going on and is determined to get to the bottom of it, even as he's doing his best to coax her back in his bed. Lovers before, she'd gotten scared and broke things off when he brought up the 'L' word.I love the characters in this series. Although Nan comes across as this tough as nails cop, she's still struggling with what happened to her.  She's also angry that her husband left her for his hairdresser, a younger woman, after having cheated on her. Now they live in a huge house with a pool, take vacations, and have a couple of kids while Nan struggles to pay the bills. She misses Kissick but is leery about resuming their affair. Kissick is equally interesting. Handsome, down to earth, he can be tough but caring, has a good sense of humor, and assuredly loves Nan.Can't wait to see what they get involved in next and whether Nan will catch up to her attacker.

Fantastic debut! Miranda comes to Christmas, Tennessee, on the trail of a serial killer. Her brother was wrongly convicted of the crimes and is serving the time in prison. Determined to prove his innocence, she goes after the real villain, Father Peter Anatole. She knows he did it, she just has to find enough evidence to convince the police. Sheriff Tucker Ambrose finds Miranda attractive but he's got enough experience under his belt to know when someone is lying and he's sure she isn't telling him her real reason for being in his town.  When she's caught breaking into the Catholic church he demands answers to his questions.  Unfortunately, he's not happy about it, not when a dead body turns up and all the evidence seems to support her suspicions.  Still, it could be a copycat. After all, a jury found Miranda' s brother guilty so the police had enough information to put him away, even though she claims he was framed by Father Anatole!  Tucker promises he'll keep an open mind. If her theory is correct and whoever is doing this is fulfilling the sacraments, then there will be more dead bodies before they are through. And when the killer comes after Miranda, she could end up being dead too!This one kept me turning the pages and had me guessing until the end.  While at first Miranda seemed rather annoying,  I quickly came to like her as she fought to get her brother out of jail.  It was evident the author did her research on police procedure and investigations as she paid close attention to detail and did an excellent job of bringing the book to its satisfactory conclusion.  Highly recommend.

Any time you can get your hands on a Marie Force book, do it! You are guaranteed to enjoy it. Her characters are always engaging, the romance ranges from sweet to sizzling, and there will no doubt be a laugh or two along the way. Her books make you want to revisit them over and over. This one was no different. Highly recommend!

I couldn't get into the characters or the setting at all.  Truthfully, I didn't bother to finish it. I've read the author's work before and enjoyed it so this won't stop me from trying her again. Just didn't care for this one.

Very disappointing. Started out with a bang and I really got into the story but there were a couple scenes of really gruesome violence, one involving children, and the ending seemed trite after everything that happened. Can't say much more without giving something away.
I just couldn't get into this. Thought the beginning was confusing. Didn't connect at all with the character.

If you like your heroes hot, love those take-charge alpha kind of men who laugh in the face of danger and will do whatever necessary to protect the women they love, then this series is for you! These books center around a team of Navy SEALs.  Each book can be read alone but to familiarize yourself with the characters and the gist of what their team is all about, it's better to read them all. There's action and suspense, a sizzling love story, and the relationship between the guys themselves as a team make these books worth reading. I definitely recommend!

Olivia Chandler is starting life over. After being wrongly accused of her ex-husband's murder, she jumps bail, gets a new identity and heads to Alaska to hide from the hit man hired to take her out. After two attempts on her life she's not about to hang around and wait for him to try again.  Now she owns a diner, has a guard dog who's been expertly trained, and is slowly beginning to make friends in her new locale.Rafe Brodie owns a trio of charter boats and makes regular stops at Liv' s diner. All the women have the hots for him in spite of the fact he has no plans to settle down and commit himself to any one person.  Olivia goes out of her way to avoid him. She's attracted to him, yes, but knows he's nothing but trouble given her circumstances. She's just beginning to get her life back together. The last thing she needs is a guy to complicate the situation even further. However, Rafe is a hard man to resist, especially when he wants something and he wants Olivia in the worst way.When a mutual friend is murdered, the two of them work together to try and find the man's killer. What they stumble across in the process puts them both in danger and threatens the very town they've come to love.Once I started this I couldn't put it down. It kept me turning the pages, anxious to find out what happens. There is plenty of action and suspense, a wide variety of characters that you quickly become involved with, and a hot, steamy romance that is sure to satisfy any dedicated reader of the genre. In my opinion, this was the best Brodie book yet.  Kat Martin pulled out all the stops in taking you on a wild ride from the opening murder scene to the end of the book where you are sitting on pins and needles, waiting to see how the author is going to resolve Olivia' s situation once her secrets are exposed.  Highly recommend!

This wasn't nearly long enough but I know, given the context and the fact it was a prequel, makes it impossible to draw it out. Now I'll have to go back and read Fatal Affair again to get the full effect! Great job as always, Marie!

Jessi Brand was all grown up. She'd graduated college, was officially a licensed veterinarian, and ready to make her mark on the world. She was also in love with Lash Monroe. He was a drifter helping her brothers  on their ranch.  While Lash finds her tempting as all get out, there's no way he's getting involved. She's his boss's sister for one thing and while Garrett could be a formidable foe, he's got four brothers to back him up.  They'd probably kill him and feed his body to the wolves if they found out he'd been eyeing their baby sister. Even so, when Jessi insists on throwing herself at him, Lash finds it impossible to say no.  When he finds out she's a virgin and he was her first, he feels so guilty he tells her they need to get married.  Only he m akes it sound like marrying her was a punishment for his sins!  It seems like things can't get any worse when someone from Lash' s past puts Jessi's life in danger.  That's when it really gets interesting. A very enjoyable read. I enjoyed revisiting the Brands and reading Jessi' s story.

I really enjoy these novellas. They are a fun, quick read, nothing complex so you can sit down and relax and forget about everything for awhile.  I loved Justin's geeky character and the way he was so into Raney from the start but a misunderstanding has him thinking she'd never be interested in his type of guy.  As a result he comes across as cold and distant, convincing her he doesn't like her.  When it appears they've solved their differences and are on the right track, he suddenly reverts back to the way he was before, leaving her questioning what had happened.  It takes interference on the part of their friends to finally get them together.

I thought this book was good when I started reading it but then it seemed like it was going to end much too soon and I just wasn't satisfied.  All of a sudden there was this unexpected twist to the story I didn't expect and pretty soon I was quickly turning pages, anxious to discover what happened.  Thankfully everything was brought to a satisfying conclusion and left room for future books in the series.  I found the heroine in the story totally likeable with a mind of her own and a refusal to be what society and others dictated she be. Claudia was stubborn, independent, and had a heart of gold. She was perfect for Micah.  He came to Washington D. C. looking for his sister.  He'd had a vision of her in danger and he was determined to save her. While investigating her disappearance, he meets Claudia.  This book had danger, suspense, and a heartwarming romance.  Would definitely recommend.

Of all the books Lee Child has written, this was my least favorite. I couldn't get into it at all.  Skipped a bunch of pages.  Maybe because it was on foreign soil. Maybe I didn't care for the characters, except Reacher, of course. Whatever it was, it won't keep me from buying the next one. Expectations are still high.
Didn't finish. Wasn't my cup of tea. The characters seemed shallow and the storyline just didn't hold my attention.  The writing style wasn't bad just didn't care for it myself.

This book started out with a bang (no pun intended) but got dragged down by all the description of Chicago. It might be interesting to people who live in Chicago but for the rest of us, not so much. It really slowed the pace of the story and it took awhile for it to get going again. Aside from that it was a really good read. I liked Dave and his partner, there was lots of action and while you had an idea of who the bad guy was it kept you guessing for most of the book.  Nice way to spend an afternoon.

This was one of the best Intrigues I've ever read. Noelle worked with a covert group of operatives, but on this particular mission she was paired with Thomas. He was tall, dark and Dangerous with a capital D.  The were going after a Senator they believed had tried to destroy the EOD where they worked. Several years earlier, Noelle had been kidnapped but she'd managed to get out alive. Unfortunately, her memories of the event escaped her. So why was working with Thomas all of a sudden causing her to remember bits and pieces of that time? What she doesn't realize is that Thomas is a man with secrets, one of them being that he's loved Noelle ever since he found her running in the forest, fleeing from her captor. He was after a terrorist cell and couldn't blow his cover. What he did back then could destroy any chance he might have with her. He knew his day of reckoning was coming. First, however, they needed to take down the Senator and then subsequently the killer tied to Noelle' s kidnapping. As they work together to do so, Noelle realizes there's a lot more to her partner than what she's been led to believe and despite her attraction to him, what she discovers might ruin their relationship forever. So many twists and turns, an evil villain that's bent on getting to Noelle, and a hero that will do anything to protect her, even if it means dying for her. Excellent read. Couldn't put it down. The plot was spellbinding, keeping you eagerly turning pages to the end.

This was a fantastic read, giving the reader a glimpse into a modern day high school and the dangers lurking there for both teachers and students alike. This book is well-researched and based primarily on fact. Susanna is principal at Fairholm High. When the Superintendent informs her two Secret Service agents are going undercover at the school because it's been deemed a high risk for violence, she isn't happy about it. She's always believed in a policy of honesty and integrity for staff and students both and to deceive everyone goes against the grain. Given no choice in the matter, she has to agree to Joe coming on as a counselor while his partner, Luke, goes undercover as a student. Joe's niece was the victim of a school shooter so he has first hand experience in this type of thing.  While working to discover potential risks and threats involved there's a nice attraction developing between Joe and Susanna while Luke struggles to remain in character when he's more that attracted to one of the teachers. Plenty of suspense involved and just enough romance to add to the story's appeal. Really enjoyed this one. Looking forward to reading about Luke's seven sisters!

Sometimes it's hard to put into words what you want to say about a book.  You read it and when you finish you feel so much better than when you started. It leaves you sighing and wanting more.  If you  are like me you sit there wondering why? What made the book so enjoyable?  In this case I'm sure the subject matter played a part. Military men, especially damaged ones have a way of getting to you.  Then there's the author's writing style. I haven't read one book of hers I haven't enjoyed.  She has a way of using her characters to draw you into the story and I loved Cat and Harper.  Cat was a very strong woman and there was no doubting she loved Harper. When he's wounded and near death she arrives at the hospital much to the surprise of his team. They didn't know he was married or that he had two kids.  The fact Cat hadn't seen him for a year and a half should have made things awkward for them but Harper was glad she'd come. He'd missed her terribly and needed her calm demeanor in the midst of his current storm.  He'd left his family because after his last deployment he'd been paranoid and feared he'd hurt one of them.  Employment at LNF and his visits to a counselor have helped but he wasn't sure if he was ready for them all to be together again.  Cat came prepared to fight for her marriage but she also carried divorce papers in her purse. This was her last stand. No more separation, no more battling his fears alone. She'd spent seventy-five percent of her married life alone and it was too much for her and the kids to take.  The feelings these two people had for one another were real but you felt Harper's pain and understood his indecisiveness.  His leaving had been all about getting himself right, healing, so they could be a family unit again and while he knew he was better, he still hadn't completely conquered his fears.  You also felt Cat's pain and her desire to be with her husband again. They'd been married fourteen years and in spite of their time apart she still loved him like she did the day they'd met

I thought I was getting a romance novel when in truth I got a sex manual. Seriously, if you are looking for a book with a plot this isn't the one for you.  Maggie had never had an orgasm so when a friend tells her about the "service" she got at the tattoo parlor down the street, Maggie decides that's the answer to her problem. She schedules an appointment with Eduardo but when she throws herself at him she discovers its actually his twin, Rafel.  While he turns her away, he can't help but be intrigued so he makes her his project of sorts. He teases and torments her, driving her crazy and leaving her hanging on the verge for days while he goes home and jerks off in the shower. (Not making this up) When he decides to forego seeing her for a few days, sure this is the only way to make her come, she takes matters into her own hands and hunts him down. After calling him names and telling him off, he once again overwhelms her with his sexual prowess and she FINALLY achieves her goal, an orgasm with a capital O!  By now, she is crazy for him but when she asks where the relationship is going, he balks.  Of course, predictably, he's miserable without her so he looks her up and she once again falls into his arms. By this time I'm wondering how much more of this I have to take. I actually did last to the end, wading through Rafel' s one true love coming back on the scene declaring she wants him again which almost sends Maggie packing. But all's well that ends well and Rafel realizes he loves Maggie and wants to be with her. I gave this two stars because I kind of liked the characters even if I found the book's premise bordering on ridiculous and the writing wasn't bad all things considered. It was my first time reading the author and unfortunately probably my last.

The printer arrived undamaged and unpacked fairly easily. The wireless setup for computers downstairs and one upstairs was quick and effortless, printing test sheets from both the second floor and on street level with no problem.I have owned several Canon printers and recommend them.  I like their text printing and the color photo printing too. This printer printed an 8x10” color photo clearly on Canon’s Photo Paper Plus Glossy II and with good color reproduction, as good as my MX922 (I printed the same photo a second time on the same paper from the MX922 for comparison)—but not quite as sharp as the photo appeared on my computer screen.Some disappointments. (1) The MX922 has an automatically opening paper tray door, but with this printer you have to open two paper tray doors manually before printing. For me, this means when I’m ready to print, going downstairs to turn on the printer and to open the paper tray doors (there are two doors to open for the one tray) and check that the right paper is in place. (2) That brings me to the next disappointment: only one paper tray.  So, for example, if I want to switch from letter size document printing to a 4x6” photo, I have to go downstairs again, pull out the letter-sized paper, adjust the printer tray lever for the smaller paper and put it in the tray. Then return upstairs to give the print command. (3) Also, the one-and-only paper tray holds a fairly small amount of paper. Its front door will not close if there is too much paper in the tray since the paper bends upward with the closing of the door. These are not major problems but are minor inconveniences.We also printed from an iPhone. The first iPhone didn’t seem to want to recognize the printer, so we tried another iPhone (same make and model—5C) and it connected with this printer immediately with no problem. We printed a photo on plain paper, large size, 8 x 10.5”, and the printing was excellent.Recommended for those who do not mind the inconvenience noted above with the paper tray and its doors and especially for those who are looking for a printer that accommodates wireless devices.

We mounted this on the wall behind my desk. I have two monitors, and now my monitor on the right swings outward to the right as well as turning to the right (revolving) so that I can use it for photos I want to refer to while painting (my painting table and easel are to the right of my computer desk).Packaging was fine, so it arrived without any damage, and the package was fairly easy to open.The only difficulty in mounting was finding the studs in the wall to screw the large screws into. The monitor plate has holes that fit perfectly to the back of the monitor. So once the wall mount was attached to the wall and the plate to the monitor, it was just a matter of a few seconds to assemble the arm--super easy--and it functioned perfectly. I can rotate the monitor (landscape to portrait position), easily swing it left or right, up, and push it back to close to flush with the wall.Note: I would consider carefully whether you want to mount its base on a wall (that is with the base positioned vertically) or flat on a surface like a desk and make sure you purchase the correct version. The Arms and the hardware of the two versions differ.Recommended

I liked these especially for storing odds and ends and small writing tools like pens and pencils for transport to the field for sketching. Also, I will use them for some foods, not all. Here's why: (1) a rather small opening for inserting food, especially when using a spoon (the zipper and its stops at each end make the opening smaller). (2) The ad boasts "Storage Slider bags feature patented MaxLock Track to ensure a secure seal." I tested this  with water in a bag half-full, I closed it and held the bag upside down, and water leaked out. So I do not recommend storing liquids in these bags.On  the positive side, other then noted above, the bags seem well-made and are economically priced. They do close easily and are good for storage of some items. I do not recommend using these a freezer bags.
Fun movie, good plot , engaging story, excellent animation and computer graphics, but probably not suitable for very young children due to the violence.

This is a well-made and nice-looking camera bag. It is a compromise between storage capacity and size. You can have a lot of storage in a bag, but it can easily become a bulky bag awkward to tote around with you. So the result here is a medium-sized bag that is fairly sleek but not with a lot of storage--but probably enough for photographers willing to pack carefully.There are two noteworthy features: (1) The add says, "Water-resistant Dura Base offers protection and stability from the ground up." It does offer stability and probably is waterproof (though I haven't tested it yet).  (2 The ad also says, "Innovative hammock system suspends camera body for superior impact protection"--this means that your camera sits in this hammock with the lens facing down toward the padded bottom of the case. The distance from where the camera body's front sits in the hammock to the bottom of the case is about 4". The width of the hammock opening where your camera lens slides through is also about 4" (maximum). Both the hammock and the padding are attached with Velcro can can be removed or their position adjusted some (See the second photo below that shows the inside of the main compartment with the  hammock on the left and the padding on the right. The top of the photo also shows an inside accessories pocket.The first photo below shows one of the two side pockets and the rear pocket both open.I have had good luck with Case Logic products, and I expect this one to work well and be durable.So if you are looking for a medium-sized camera bag that will hold and protect a small to medium DSLR camera and some accessories, I would check out this case.

I like the idea of batteries made from recycled battery parts and materials, if only about 4% recycled materials. To me, it's a move in the right direction. After a quick comparison, I saw that these are more expensive than comparable non-recycled batteries. (For example over twice as  much as for Duracell,, which boasts a 10 year shelf life.)Obviously, for the purposes of review, I cannot wait 12 years to check the shelf life of these. Bukt once I have used them long enough to see how long that last, I will report back and add to this review the results.

The set arrived intact with no damage. 4 player trays are included so if you have 6 players 2 of them will have to play without a tray for hold their pieces. Each piece/tile has a brass bead in the center. which makes it easy to pick it up (especially helpful for a player who doesn't have a tray). It's a good idea to read the rules all the way through, including the bonus point aspects, so that you are aware of them during play.The game does require some math, simple arithmetic, so is good practice for children (though the very young will require help), but generally this game should be enjoyable or all members of the family.All pieces seem to be quality made and should be durable.Recommended.

We were going to save these for Halloween hand outs but I think we'll have them eaten up before Halloween arrives! Hershey's always had great tasting chocolate bars. These are individually wrapped bite-size pieces (or a little larger). The box opens as shown in the ad above, so that you can choose your piece conveniently. Great tasting chocolate candy.Recommended.

This Charcoal Companion works well and quickly. You can use it to light charcoal,. and also kindling; it works equally well either way. When we used it on kindling, it lit up not only the kindling but also the used burnt pieces nearby. This is very easy to use and is a welcomed addition to our barbecue equipment. No more hassle and too much time spent getting the barbecue going. No problems with this starter. It worked right out of the box. Simple to use.Recommended.

It works. We cleaned the downstairs today. One area I watched closely was where my grandson sits to work on his computer. A few spills had left food spots. Our carpet cleaner (Bissell ProHeat Pet) removed the spots with one or two passes. The area smells fresh now, but there is really no odor, and the cleaner left behind no foam.Depending on the age and condition of your carpet, using it in a deep cleaner should result in a carpet that looks pretty-much-new after cleaning.Overall, this cleaner works about the same as the other cleaning solutions we've tried.Recommended.

This is a rather elegant looking dispenser. It certainly looks better that a bottle of mouthwash on the bathroom sink. The pump works well, bringing up mouthwash into the top pouring area a  little at a time. I need to pump twice to get the amount I usually use (which is not a lot, say about the amount in a shot glass). To fill this dispenser you unscrew the bottom section, pour in the mouthwash, then screw it  back together snugly.The brushed nickel, silicon and plastic parts seem well-made, so I expect it to be durable. It measures 9" from top to bottom, with the cup in place on top, and just under 3" in diameter at the bottom.Two negative aspects: (1) It doesn't hold a lot of mouthwash, about a drinking-glass amount or a little less. Also (2) it doesn't pour cleanly. It dribbles down its side when you pour (I tried this more than once to check it), and hence leaves a small amount of mouthwash on the sink as well as the side of the dispenser, requiring cleaning.

This toilet paper is stronger, soft, and does have a cloth-like texture, and I think it is stronger wet too. I tried it and found that it will even suffice for light-weight scrubbing, not like a  paper towel of course but better than you would expect.Now the "4-in-1" claim means that since it is "Ultra Strong" you can use up to 4 times fewer sheets, and therefore the roll  will last up to 4 times longer than another brand roll. Frankly, I don't think I'll be using 4 times less with this toilet paper..On the other hand, the price of these rolls is almost exactly the same (per sheet) as the cheapest I could find listed on Amazon. So you can get high quality for an economical price.Recommended

These are high quality, well-made, exercise bands. The key to them versatility--there's really no end to the ways you can use them. And they are super-portable. They fit in a suitcase, attache case, workout bag or pocket.I came across these bands after viewing Brenda and Chad Walding's freebie on YouTube "7 Simple Steps to Fixing Back Pain" (from the Sitting Solution program)--which is one of the best routines I've found (I've subsequently purchased their book and program--highly recommended). The husband and wife team are both doctors of physical therapy--they know what they are doing and teaching. They have these bands made, and the price here on Amazon is a good one.Highly recommended.

This is a comfortable mat with plenty of cushioning. Its price, to me, is reasonable. I measured 18 1/4 x 30 1/2" on its bottom. The bottom is nonslip and smooth (my grandson told me to include that  he likes the feel of the bottom on his bare feet better than the top). It is beveled which should help prevent any tripping, and  it is sealed all around. It cleans  quickly and easily (did so with a coffee plus cream spill). This mat should work well wherever in your home you do a lot of standing and help prevent standing fatigue. It's elegant looking and should fit in well with any decor.Recommended.

Good quality plastic cups. A little pricey.They are thicker than the usual plastic cup one comes across and can hold liquid in them full-up securely.There are some slight ridges on them  which make hold the cups a bit more securely.These cups are sturdy enough to be washed and reused, which makes sense to me if you use several cups daily.The cups do not stick together and are perfectly clear.Recommended.

Love this mat. I have it down in front of my painting easel. It is super comfortable, nice and thick and cushy. Now I paint barefooted, enjoying the feel under my feet.It's very well-made, seamless, and comes with a 5-year warranty. I have the rustic brown, which fits in well with  my natural wood finished desks. The top side does look like leather. Also, it has a beveled edge all the way around which cuts down on the possibility of any tripping at the edge. The measurements in the ad are accurate: I measured 36 x 20".This mat should work well anywhere you need it to stand on for lengthy jobs.It's a bit pricey but worth it if you frequnetly need to stand or work in a spot for a while.Highly recommended.

We have used this brand of laundry detergent for at least over a year (only just recently in these handy packs--which are easy to use and dissolve well with no problem).  Clothes come out fresh and clean, with no soap residue at all. It does a good job with stains too. It works well with regular washing machines (our previous machine) and high efficiency/low water washing machines too. I have notice absolutely no allergic reactions to clothes washed with this detergent. Colors come out looking good and bright, whites too. We use both cool and hot or warm water; it doesn't seem to make a difference.Recommended.

This is my favorite stretching/yoga strap. It is comfortable, with its elastic straps and loops. It is not so elastic that it fails to provide firm support, but on the other hand it is enough elastic to be comfortable while also providing some pull that adds a dynamic to stretches.and poses.The loops are a great idea. They give you a way to measure your progress (they are numbered) and also enable you to get set and stay in your stretches/positions more easily. I consider this strap ideal yoga equipment.The materials are quality and durable. The black and red coloring is attractive, and while that doesn't necessarily add to their functionality, it makes working out with them a bit more pleasant.Two important bonuses. A printed pamphlet with exercises in it, and an invitation and instructions for locating the free online instructional videos--25 of them (second bonus)! They quickly help you explore the ways you can use this strap to enhance your workout. This is the only piece of yoga equipment I have purchased that comes with such helpful instruction--for free!Highly recommended.

This is a good jack that does the job. We tried it out lifting a Ford Explorer, and it worked well and did the lift with no problem. Since it is a trailer jack, though, be careful using it with a car.One slight problem. The jack has a tendency to slip around when you are cranking it up until it catches the weight which then anchors it in place.This would be a handy jack to have along if you tow trailers or a boat.Recommended.

We live in the Pacific Northwest, and is the summer dry season right now. As a test we applied this to weeds in our front lawn. It absolutely  killed the weeds BUT did not damage the existing lawn at all. Judging from other reviews it works equally well in vegetable and flower gardens. (We prefer to keep our vegetable gardens chemical-free, so we did not test this product there.)Recommended.

When Cicadas Cry was another beautiful love story by this wonderful author. Here Ms. Miller yet again creates the kind of characters I so very much love from her books; genuine, humble, and heartwarming characters that captivate with the simplest of words because you just feel them speaking from the heart. Something else I love about this author, which was beautifully portrayed in this book as well, it's how she can so easily make my heart melt over and over again with just two people falling in love with each other. I think that's a very unique attribute to this author and the reason why I keep going back to her stories for more of that heartfelt romance.“In the next heartbeat, her light green eyes are on me, and then before too long, all I feel is a smile pushin’ up my face. And it’s funny, but I swear the world just stops, like literally, just freezes on its axis, just so we can have our moment—a private moment, where we say everything and nothin’ at all. And I can’t be sure what she’s sayin’, but I know what I’m sayin’. I’m sayin’: I like you; I think you might like me, at least a little; and I don’t want this conversation to end; and I, sure as hell, don’t want this night to end.”This story takes place in a small town in Missouri and it begins when town boy meets city girl. When Remington sees Ashley for the first time he's completely taken by her. Her beauty, her playfulness, and her curious personality were all like a straight arrow to Rem's heart. That's why after that meeting he feels like he has to know her and find out if she could ever feel the same way about him. Well, fortunately for Rem the same happens to Ashley. She also gets completely smitten by his charms, persistence, and attractiveness even at a time in her life where she wasn't exactly looking for love but couldn't help but fall for Rem.“For the first time in a really long time, I feel as if it might not be so bad to fall head over heels for a beautiful stranger. And maybe it's because he doesn't feel like a stranger at all, really.”But as soon as you feel the love and tenderness getting a hold of the characters that's when the plot in the story starts to spin. With chapters that alternate between past and present, Rem and Ashley's story is told from a past where they're in love to a present where they're brokenhearted and apart. So the big question is what happened? Well, that's the emotional journey these characters take you on and it's not a perfect one. It's a journey of love, faith, and the precious moments that make all the difference.“Why does it have to hurt so much?” I ask. Her smile fades a little.“It’s not supposed to be painless, Rem. It’s supposed to be worth it.”Again, something this author does wonderfully is making the characters fall deeply in love and I absolutely love that about her stories. Even when the 'falling in love' is a process, I can always see and feel it happening in the perfect moments she creates with all the firsts between the characters and how magical those moments truly feel to me. So yes, I looove romance and I was very happy to have found it again in When Cicadas Cry. This story sure delivered on it with a heartfelt story about faith, strength, and a beautiful message about how love isn't always painless but definitely worth everything to keep it. ♥“Real love bleeds. That’s how you know it’s real.”

I love how an author can create a hero so set in his ways that you think it would be impossible for him to change but then he does and what happens then it's amazing. Sustained was that kind of story and Jake Becker was exactly that kind of hero; a successful defense attorney and a womanizer that in a million years would have thought that his life would change completely for one single woman and her six kids.“I can’t think of anything I wouldn’t do for you.”At thirty years old, Jake has a set plan for his life: keep being the best at this job and always keep it strictly casual with the ladies. That's all he wants for his present and foreseeable future and he couldn't be more content with the idea. However, after a recent scare he realizes that nameless one-night-stands might not be the best option for him anymore so he decides to give dating a try even against his better judgement. It's during that time when he meets Chelsea McQuaid, a twenty-six-years old single, gorgeous, and enchanting woman that couldn't make him hotter even if she tried. The problem is that she's a package deal with being the guardian of her six orphaned nieces and nephews and a situation that couldn't be farthest from simple. So as expected, Chelsea and the kids are an immediate red-flag for Jake because again, the man is too set in his ways to even contemplate getting into that messy situation. Or so he thought. . .“I don’t know if it’s because I have a hard-on for his aunt or because he reminds me so much of myself, but if anyone wants a piece of that kid they’ll have to come through me first.”And that's when the magic of this book starts and what made it totally swoony for me. Seeing Jake give in little by little regardless of everything he'd planned before was so heart-melting, funny, and irresistible. This is a man that wasn't supposed to be the the touchy-feely kind of guy, oh no, instead he wanted to feel indifferent and tried not to let himself get bothered by the new feelings for this Chelsea and the kids. Yet this story shows how life can change in a blink of an eye when he let himself love and be loved. ♥ I have to emphasize once again how heart-melting and swoony this book was so picture this: six kids from ages of six-months to fourteen-years old who are a little bit of trouble makers but are as sweet as they come and a stubborn Jake that tries his hardest but can't help to fall in love with every single one of them. That plus Jake's connection with the kindhearted and sweet Chelsea were all really a beautiful and stellar love story to read.“Their joy, their laughter, their love. I want to come home to it, bask in it, be the reason for it. But even more than that, I want to deserve them.”I loved everything about this book: the excellent humor throughout the story, the chemistry between Jake and Chelsea, the sweet innocence of the kids, and the connections they all made. But within all those great times what I loved the most about this book has to be the little moments. You know, those moments where with just a word or a touch the characters make your heart swell with emotions? Yeah, that's what I'm talking about and there several of those in this book which I thought made all the difference for me making this story that much more heartfelt and wonderful. So for that I totally recommend this book if you enjoy heartwarming, sweet, and fun romances. This story will definitely make you smile from ear to ear, I'm telling you! Sustained can be read as a standalone so you can jump right into it. ;)

This story was really something. It was funny as I expected since I'm very familiar with this author's magical humor but what I didn't anticipate was its surprising plot. Here the author introduces the hero and the story of his first love which then almost drives the whole book and I found that a little risky. Risky because I usually like to connect both my hero and heroine romantically right away and with too much of their past histories that can make it kind of difficult. Fortunately, I did connect them and felt connected to them at the end as the hero made me laugh even at times when I wanted to slap him into his senses, hehe. ;)Stanton Shaw is a successful twenty-eight-years old defense attorney who lives a carefree life. Based in D.C. he makes sure he never gets attached to any woman other than the two he has in Missouri, his precious ten-year old daughter and high school sweetheart Jenny. Oh don't panic, no cheating in this story at all. You see, Stanton and Jenny have an arrangement that while apart they can live their lives freely but always keeping other relationships casual. That's how it's always been for them since Stanton moved out for college and law school and after their daughter was born. So of course with that arrangement, it's perfectly fine for Stanton to have his fun in D.C. and he currently has it with Sofia Santos, his dear friend and lawyer colleague.“With a sharp grin and an almost evil spark in her eye, she grips my tie and pulls me back in for a kiss.”Since day one Sofia has known about Stanton's past, his current situation in Missouri, and how their relationship could only be strictly casual sex. She's been totally fine with the arrangement and has been enjoying it just as much as him. However, when Stanton gets a very unexpected invitation to Jenny's wedding and he drags her there to help him stop the wedding, she soon starts to feel something more for her so called "friend with benefits."“What we have—what he and I do together—is fun. Physical and convenient. And above all else, it was supposed to be simple. But the sick feeling in my stomach, the tinge of sour jealousy on my tongue—there’s nothing simple about that.”Once they head to Missouri this story goes completely nuts and I loved it. There's crazy family members, tension, regrets, competition, and lots of confusion. During all that again, I did feel like slapping Stanton so he would wake up and make up his mind but it was also too funny to see him struggle in the mess he was in. Moreover, while him and Sofia took their time to realize their true feelings for each other and figuring out their situation, they had me laughing in the madness that was Missouri and everybody in there. Not to mention, I felt that their connection kept getting stronger with every chapter so it was very clear for me who was my heroine and what love story I was supposed to be cheering for. Yeah, when that switch finally happened it was perfect. ♥“Darlin’, you have me. By the heart, by the balls, and any other way you want.”I found this book sexy, funny and unexpected. I really enjoyed it. The humor, sexiness, and characters in the story really made me a fan of the series. Now I'm very curious to see what Ms. Chase has up her sleeve for the stories of Stanton's friends Jake (Sustained) and Brent (Appealed)! :D

What a sweet love story, I loved Matt and Grace. Their story was the kind of romance is only found once in a lifetime and so no matter life choices, timing, and/or the circumstances, it's the kind of love the heart can never let go.“You can’t re-create the first time you promise to love someone or the first time you feel loved by another. You cannot relive the sensation of fear, admiration, self-consciousness, passion, and desire all mixed into one because it never happens twice. You chase it like the first high for the rest of your life.”These two characters meet during college, a time where both of them didn't know what the future held. Yet, it was also a time full of many possibilities so between the attraction and strong connection they first shared, Grace and Matt immediately became "fast friends." I really loved how their romance began, it was carefree, authentic, and fun. Just two best friends falling in love with each other, sharing every moment, and taking it all into memory. Oh that was so special to their story, the memories. How Matt as a photography major was always taking pictures and capturing all those precious moments with Grace. And her, the talented music major, so passionate about creating music with her cello and sharing it all with Matt. The two of them were just in a high-paced college romance that even though it had a lot of reality to it, they always managed to make it special and worth it.“You called us fast friends. I like to think it was more.”But even with that tender love and all the good intensions, they couldn't stop life from happening to them and so they're forced to make some tough decisions that soon enough take over their present and future. It's until fifteen-years later that they find each other once again and the way that happens was really unique and heartfelt, I loved it. From the very beginning I could feel the magic between these two characters so when they reconnect again, it truly made me happy. However, reconnecting was just the start of their story. The plot soon reveals that there were too many loose ends, unanswered questions, and two broken hearts that needed healing for the story to yet come full circle. So I was excited and anxious to know what happened to their story but thankfully, the author surprised me in such a delightful way. She not only made me love this second chance romance more by the end with how she reconnects two true soul mates, but also by beautifully amending their imperfect and broken love story. Because Matt and Grace were always a love meant to be and their story proved that against all the odds and missed connections.“Weren’t we though? Timeless? Nothing could change what we’d had all those years before, even if the idea of what might’ve been lingered between us.”

Wow, this fifth installment might just be the darkest and most powerful yet in this series. Seriously, this book had me on the edge of suspense and it made my skin crawl more than a few times. Yeah, I gasped and cringed for my dear characters but everything they go through was so precisely elaborated that the experiences gave them that much needed courage and strength and I loved them getting stronger. Not to mention that darkness in the story was so thrilling to read as it made me FEEL so much."Live for me. Breathe for me. Come back to life for me."I can truly say this book has prepared me for the big finale. Oh yes, I'm so pumped for retribution and justice to happen in this story that's not even a joke. I can't wait for Nila and Jethro's last chapter because thanks to the Fourth Debt I know is going to be of epic proportions where definitely good will win over evil."It was me versus them now. I wouldn't back down again. I'm done being tortured. It was their turn."I have loved the incredible ride these characters have taken me and this book was another amazing breakthrough. Here's where the strength an faith of Nila and Jethro are really put to the test and as terrifying as it was to see them endure so much, it was also exhilarating to see how mentally powerful they've have become. Witnessing that growth in them did wonders for me but I have to say, what I loved the most about this book was how the author manipulated my emotions so intensively. Ms. Winters has not only made me passionate about the good feelings (love, faith, forgiveness) in this story, no, she has also achieved to make me feel strongly passionate about the not so good feelings too (revenge, hate) and all on behalf of my two dear characters. That really goes far to say how extremely invested I feel about this whole story no matter where it takes me. ♥"Fear was a strong emotion, but it had nothing on love."So kudos to Ms. Winters again, this is the fifth book in this series that I loved and devoured with pleasure. This story has been just amazing and for that I cannot wait for Final Debt and see how the final punch is delivered. I know one thing though, it's going to be EPIC fore sure! :D

It's truly amazing to me the talent of this author. Since book one in this Indebted series I felt this story was going to be something to behold but now after this book I can totally say what an understatement that was. After four books with the same characters Ms. Winters continues to engage me, truly captivate me, and surprise me with how she can manipulate a story and keep making it more brilliant. So brilliant that there's never been a dull moment in this series for me, oh no, there's always been something remarkable with each book and that something this time with Third Debt was the empowering love.“Death had tried to claim me only for love to save me instead.”In this fourth installment the plot is at its peak. Emotions, regrets, and fears are all over the place and these two passionate characters just keep trying to assimilate their torturous fucked-up reality and finally accept the truth. That is, the truth about their intense feelings for each other and how they no longer can suppress them. It's until then that their love really becomes that empowering love the two of them so desperately needed and the way that finally happens is truly breathtaking.“I don’t want to win or lose anymore. I just want you.”I found this book perfect. It gave me the romance I so much crave for, kept me in such suspense, and the development/growth of the characters made me love them even more. Oh yes, I can't say it enough, Nila Weaver is a magnificent heroine. This woman continues to amaze me with her strength/courage and captivate me with her unconditional love for Jethro. She's just incredible and with every book she becomes more and more a powerful and unforgettable character to me. Now, Jethro's evolution hasn't been as straightforward as Nila's, no, his been more complex and I've loved it. There's so many layers to what makes him the character that he is that his transformation couldn't be easy but the results have truly been mind-blowing particularly in this book.“I wished she would stay away. Her concern might be a blanket, but her love… S***, her love was a blade slicing me into pieces.”I adore these characters both individually and together. Oh together, these two set the book on fire. Their passion and longing for each other was so consuming and exquisite that I felt it all from beginning to end. Loved this book, Third Debt is yet another favorite for me in this series. So GOOD!

**REVIEW OF THE COMPLETE SERIAL**Wow. Just. Wow. This book was amazing, I FLOVED IT!! Such strong, memorable, and exceptional characters with a story that was incredibly addictive and sexy. So much so that I devoured it too quickly and I couldn't get enough of it by the end. And that was all Andrew Hamilton's fault because who in their right mind could ever get enough of him? Nobody, that's who! ;D“You know,” she went on, “for a high profile lawyer, you have a pretty dirty mouth.”“You’d be surprised how much filthier it can get.”“Filthier than what I’ve already experienced?”“Much filthier.”So who's Andrew Hamilton? Well, after reading this book I discovered he's the a**hole of my dreams. LOL. Yes, Andrew is an a**hole in this story and I loved him for it because that's exactly what made him HIM, so unique, and irresistible. He's a crude, condescending, and arrogant bastard who's all about what he wants which is usually just straight up sex. Being a very successful lawyer, he's used to getting his way but even sometimes he has to work a little harder to make it clear to women that all he's looking for is: "One dinner. One night. No repeats." It's during one of those "hard-working" times of his that Aubrey Everhart enters his life as one of the interns in his law firm. The attraction is unstoppable and he feels completely drawn to her gorgeousness; however, almost immediately he realizes that they already know each other and so their "professional" relationship begins on heated tension and lies...“There was no justification for what she’d done, but before I cut her off, I needed to make her pay for lying to me, and I needed to figure out how.”These two were incredible together! Andrew and his a**hole-ways really had no limits so he constantly had me gasping and laughing so hard at the many inappropriate things that would come out of his mouth. I absolutely loved his confidence and how he never gave a damn about he would be perceived. He only cared about getting his point across as rude as they sounded. So with a hero like him, a heroine with a strong backbone was needed and I was so happy to see that this story totally got it. Yes, Aubrey was awesome! She wouldn't take Andrew's s**t so easily, she would give as much as she would get from him even when she couldn't resist him most of the time. And that challenging personality of hers was just one more reason he couldn't stay away from her making him break his self-imposed rules.“I was completely insatiable when it came to Aubrey, and being around her for more than five seconds was enough to send me over the edge.”Their relationship was fiery, dysfunctional, and so intense that I couldn't get enough of it. That plus the humor and the layers of secrets they shared, made this story beyond amazing to me. Reasonable Doubt has to be one of the BEST books I've read this year for sure and even though I wish I had read it sooner, I'm more ecstatic I finally read it regardless. This erotic, succulent, and highly addictive story is without a doubt a must-read from me. If you've been waiting to start this serial or are just finding out about it, please do me a favor and read it. You'll thank me later! ;)“Andrew was the epitome of what it meant to be an a**hole, a shining example of what that word stood for, but no matter how pissed I was, I hadn’t been able to stop thinking about him.”
