The 3D glasses come contained inside a plastic bubble that is affixed to the front of the box, where the puzzle image is.  If you remove the glasses by cutting off the plastic bubble thing, you rip off part of the image.  There is an opening within the box where you can wrestle out the glasses from the inside, but then you're left with the empty plastic bubble on the front of the box obscuring the puzzle image.  There really isn't any good large puzzle image to study when you're assembling the puzzle.  You have to work off of the smaller one on the back (which is also partly obscured by some graphics) or the tiny image on the spine of the box.  I found this a big bummer.  I've always taught my kid to study the box image when he needs help figuring out what he's doing during puzzle assembly and he really can't with this one.EDIT:After three or four go-rounds with Mom and Dad, the boy started to be able to manage the puzzle entirely on his own, so don't fret so much about the irregular shape.

The quality of this trampoline is good.  It is crazy-easy to assemble and all the dangerous parts are well contained.  My boy loves it, but only in spurts.  More often than not, he prefers to use it as a low table for other playthings.  Like any plaything, the interest level with a preschooler is unpredictable and capricious.The product itself is high quality but don't expect it to change your life.

As we were approaching cold weather here in Denver, I decided to order a sweatshirt for my 3 yr old boy to wear when the weather cools.  I showed him all of the color choices here on amazon, and sadly he chose red.  It is not only a pain to launder, but it washes out the effect of his bright red hair.  Oh well.  The important thing is, it is a cozy sweatshirt and he loves it.I think I ordered XS for him, and it fits beautifully.  I would say this fits "true to size".EDIT MARCH 16 2013:  Hi there - just wanted to add that the color doesn't seem to have faded at all after laundering for the last 4 months, and I haven't noticed shrinkage either, FYI.

Out of nowhere, my nearly 4-year old boy has taken an interest in the solar system.  It seems to have clicked for him that we live on a planet and that there are other planets too.  All he talks about is "Saturinn" and Jupiter.I thought most books about the planets would be over the head of a 3+ year old boy, and parts of this one are, but in the main this is an excellent book for pre-pre-schoolers to start thinking about the universe around them.There's a set of instructions in the back for a simple project, recreating Saturn with a styrofoam sphere that we're planning on creating.  Fun!  Recommend.

I really enjoyed this book, as well as Tough's prior effort, Whatever It Takes: Geoffrey Canada's Quest to Change Harlem and America.  He is a capable writer and I especially appreciate his ability to avoid bogging down in tedious statistics.  Every now and then (as with the chapter about chess) you feel like he's meandering a little too much but then the problem resolves before it gets aggravating.I will say that the although this discussion of character education is very interesting, at the same time the content seemed to me to be dressed-up common sense.  It shouldn't be any surprise that being a hard worker, tenacious, patient, resilient, etc etc, will lead to success.  There's so much noise out there these days surrounding the topic of education, it seems like people have forgotten some really basic stuff, so I suppose this book is useful in refocusing people on the basics.

The story is almost non-existent.  Your child will be screaming "Boo!" for the next month.  But this is nonetheless a keeper.My little boy is 3.5 years old and this will be his third Halloween season reading this book every night before bed.  He loves it, and on that basis I give this title 4 stars.  One star subtracted for the almost entire absence of an actual story.

2:44 MinsMy oldest son is scared of the dark, BIG TIME. He has been scared for years, while I have always tried to make things comfortable for him sometimes it is hard. Like in my house now, the bathroom closest to my son’s room happens to be down a hall that if I were to leave a light on for him would shine right into my bedroom right in my eyes, that is a no go for me.We have tried tap lights but they just don’t seem to work that well.There are three settings for this light. ON, OFF and AUTO.So I do have to admit that at first I did have a little hiccup with the light. I thought it was broken lol. BUT I figured out why the auto setting was not working…. My light was on overhead, this light needs there to be little to no light on when it is in that auto setting. This actually works out perfectly because it kicks on in the hall right as my son comes out of his room and lights the hall enough that he can make it to the bathroom without freaking out.The light is actually surprisingly bright. I really do like that it is this bright because it makes the hallway less scary for my son. It would be great to place this in a closet where you may not have any light or any place really.If you needed to you could leave it on all the time but I know that it would eat batteries like crazy (it takes 3 AA batteries NOT INCLUDED), to install the batteries you just have to slide off the back. Its rather easy to slide it off, I actually think that my son could do it.It comes with TWO 3M mounting pieces. Since we are renting this house I think I will set it on a shelf for now, also I have very textured walls that hate sticky tabs.I did get this product for free in exchange for my honest review. I am not compensated in any way for this review

8:02 MinsOh my can we say cuteness overload! This is just tooo cute for words.Talk about a little kids dream toy. You can tell that a lot of time and effort went into this toy. It also has a handle on the top so that your little one can carry it with them.  There is a latch on the front that will keep it closed when you want it to be.When you have it set up as a play kitchen it has a piece that will be the range. It has two burners with functional knobs that turn. When you turn the knobs the red center of the burner lights up and it will make sounds of food cooking (at least to me that’s what it sounds like).  Under that is what I would call a well, inside that is where you will find all the little parts and pieces that snap into place to make this play kitchen come alive. There is a little orange basket like piece that will snap into the lid/back of the play kitchen. Then there is a little blue piece that I think is either the range hood or a window valance I’m not too sure but it’s just as cute as the rest.  There is an another blue piece that has little hooks on it, conveniently this will hold the utensil’s and the spatula. There is a pot and a skillet, both come with lids. Then there are 4 plates, two yellow and two blue. There are two pink cups.Now onto the food, wow the details in the food. The orange has little dimples just like a real orange. The carrot has the little groves that a real carrot has. The apple is so cute. The lettuce you can see the leaves and the ripples in those leaves. There is an egg that is fried and one still in a shell.There are two white pieces that clip onto the side one to be a counter space and one to be a sink with the faucet.The designs on the outside of the play kitchen/stool are so cute. With little music notes, hearts, stars and dots.Overall this is a really cute toy and will make your little one so happy to have it to play with.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

My husband has been through a lot, he is a veteran, and I always tell people that the Army rode him hard and put him away wet, meaning that like other soldiers their idea of looking at a soldier that has a problem, broke leg, sprained ankle, problems with anything else, is to had them Motrin and tell them to walk it off.For years my husband has had knee pain. The VA told him that he needs a J lateral knee brace, we are still waiting on that to be ordered.Most days he had a ton of pain in his knees, his left more than the right. He has tried many braces before and usually after a few minutes he takes them off.I have to say that not only am I surprised by this brace but so is he.It is really easy to put on. It only took him a minute or two while standing outside waiting on our son to get off the bus.He already has been wearing it for a few hours and I have asked him several times how it feels. At first he was like oh it feels great, now he is like oh im still wearing it I can’t tell lol.Overall my husband loves this brace and I am so glad that it is helping him deal with the knee pain and other issues.I did get this product with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest review. A little over a month ago my dad had two strokes 3 days apart. With this happening he became almost 100% paralyzed on his left side.He has almost no use of his left arm, he has it in a sling but his arm is still like dead weight, this has caused his shoulder to separate some. The doctors showed us how to use this kind of tape to tape up his shoulder to help that from happening.My dad usually takes a shower every other day just because he needs so much help. We tape up his shoulder after his shower and then we take it off when he takes his next one and this tape holds up great! It has been such a blessing in my family.I know that you can use this to workout but I have to say that this has been such a great help with my dad.
