A cordless stick vac is a convenience, not a necessary tool.  If I had to choose between a stick vac and a regular vac, I'd have to choose the regular vac.Also, if you have pets, hair will get wound around the brushes, even more so than with a regular vacuum.

This table gets points for design, especially the curved legs, and the top, with slats instead of single piece construction.  Water won't puddle and it will be easy to clean.  The powder coat finish means it will stand up to the elements.The table came in two sturdy cardboard boxes, one inside the other, with styrofoam on all sides, and everything wrapped in plastic and taped.  The legs and the center piece are wrapped in heavy paper and also taped.As another reviewer mentioned, the assembly instructions are useless, and unnecessary.  The legs attach to the table using eight short screws and washers, and the brace attaches to the legs using four long screws and washers.  A special tool is included to tighten the screws.  My husband complained that it would have been easier if he could have used a ratchet wrench instead of the special tool, but that's a minor nitpick.  Assembly was a two-person job.  At the point where two legs are attached, we needed one person to hold the legs in place while the other person started the screws.  I don't know if this is the case with all the tables, or if ours just had a couple of holes slightly out of place.Don't lose any of the screws because extras are not included.The table is sturdy, attractive and lightweight, and I can't imagine that it won't last "forever".  Compared to wooden tables and tables with plastic/glass tops, I think this is a good value.  (And by lightweight, I don't mean flimsy -- it's not so heavy that one person can't easily move it.)

At about 40 cents each, this is a good value.  The pens write smoothly -- I've tried ten of them, and they don't skip.  The ink dries quickly.  No smudging, even if you immediately run your finger over the ink.The color choices are interesting.  About ten of them are what I'd describe as a brownish-mauve.  Plenty of pink and purple if (like me) you have granddaughters who love pink and purple.  The ink has a shine, almost sparkly.  The colors include gold and a silvery grey.  The colors are muted -- not what you'd call primary colors. The orange is more apricot or peach; there's a "normal" blue but also a teal and a baby blue.What I really like is the rubber barrel grip near the point. Very comfortable.

This book is an eye-opener and deserves to be ranked with other groundbreaking novels about social issues.  Askew makes us think about the issue of undocumented workers (I can't say "illegal aliens" anymore) without preaching at us.  She does this by showing the impact of thoughtless lawmaking on one struggling family.  And what an interesting family it is.The story is told through several different points of view.  There's ten-year-old Dustin, an orphan (white mother, Mexican father) being raised by his grandpa Bob; plucky Sweet, Bob's daughter and Dustin's aunt; Grandpa Bob, who didn't think much about Mexicans until his granddaughter married one; Monica Moorehouse, an ambitious state Congresswoman; and Luis, a Mexican man trying to find his sons.All these voices are well-done and realistic.  The characters' actions and motivations all make sense.  None of it feels like a Hallmark channel movie, and in lesser hands than Askew's, it might have gone in that direction.  And there's plenty of story here.  Sweet evaluates her life and her marriage, Dustin goes missing, a pastor finds strength.  Parts of it are funny but there's also tension.  The book was a "page-turner" and I looked forward to picking it up every day.The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that I wanted more nuance in the characters of the Congresswoman and the sheriff.  They were a bit stereotypical.  I know that there are people in Congress who think only of the next election and that there are small town sheriffs who abuse their power.  Askew did so well with the likable characters, I wanted more from the unsympathetic ones.

You know how in the movie "Casino", Robert DeNiro's character explains in a voice-over how casinos operate, how they catch cheaters and dishonest employees?  That was some good background, helpful to a viewer.  The difference between Ace Rothstein and Roger Hobbs is that Ace knew when to shut up and let us enjoy the movie.I thought about "Casino" when I started reading this book.  Hobbs goes into detail about armored cars, moving cash between banks and casinos, and he gives us a minute by minute countdown of the heist that's about to take place.  That held my interest and the details were warranted.  But even after the heist, Hobbs kept doing this -- giving us unnecessary details of mundane activities.  These details didn't add atmosphere or build character, they were filler.Hobbs leads the reader by the hand, doesn't seem to trust us to figure anything out for ourselves, and what's worse -- he tells us everything about everyone.  How someone can share so much detail and still leave the reader feeling empty is beyond me.  After awhile, you feel like a five-year-old who can't be trusted to dress himself.If you want to read something that doesn't require you to think for yourself, read this book.

Don Robertson is one of our most neglected writers.  Only a few of his books -- the books forming Morris Bird Trilogy -- are in print.  All his books are worth seeking out.  My favorites are "Paradise Falls" and his Civil War novels.In "Mystical Union", Robertson looks at the marriage of Barbara Sellers and Donald Pilgrim.  There is no plot to speak of.  The book is written in short chapters, skipping back and forth in time from the early 1900's to the 1970's.  We hear from Barbara and Don and from their friends, lovers, and relatives as they consider their lives and the choices they've made.  They think what might have been and they make peace with themselves and each other -- or not.  The point is that they're thinking, and they're very perceptive.  At one point the pragmatic Don looks at the stars, thinks about all the things he doesn't know and doesn't understand, and he wonders if we're seeking the right kind of knowledge.  It's one thing to understand the stars, quite another to understand people, even the people we're married to.  It's hard, and sometimes it's worth it, sometimes not.  Don recognizes this.One of my favorite passages in the book is from Barbara, looking back at her life.  I think it's a good illustration of Robertson's style and of the mood of the book -- not fatalistic so much as examining:"So then let it all go, Barbara.  Forget it, Barbara.  The girl is gone, Barbara.  Your sister Phoebe never would talk with you about any of it, and your sister Rosemary never even would have understood it, let alone talked about it.  So mourn then alone, Barbara.  The days of promise, of latticed shadows, of roofs and dollbabies and erasers and paint sets and silly hairy dogs. Phoebe lives alone now in a house that is full of caged birds.  Rosemary watches soap operas and loves her children and her husband, even if he doesn't have much of a chin.  They are what they are, and they accept.  So then do the same, Barbara.  So then mourn whatever you like, but accept the walls that crowd you, nudging your shoulders.  If it all is debris, then it all is debris.  At least you see it.  At least you understand the choice you made.  At least now and then you spy an edge of what you missed.  That just may be an accomplishment."Robertson knows the Midwest and he knows small towns and small town people.  He looks at all of it without blinders -- there's no sloppy sentimentality  He sees the limitations but he also sees the value.  His writing can be raw, even vulgar, but it's honest.This was an intriguing book and one I will re-read.

The gap between my range and the kitchen counter is a catch-all.  The gap is small -- just an inch or so -- and it's amazing, the stuff that finds its way into the gap, and down the side of the range.  I'm lucky in that the range is at the end of the counter, so it's fairly easy to slide the range out for cleaning.  But with these guards, I won't have to do that anymore!These guards are magnetized so they stay in place.  They fit neatly.  That's all I need.I only needed one of the guards and didn't know where to store the second one so I'd be able to find it if I needed it later.  Since it's magnetized, I stuck it on the side of the fridge. Then it hit me -- magnet -- fridge -- it will hold photos! It could almost have been made for that.

This is a nice thick (but not too thick) bathroom rug.  The rubber backing has a light pebble texture -- very secure.  I'm using it on a tile floor, and it doesn't move unless I pick it up.  I can't move it with my feet, so when I sit down, the rug doesn't slip and slide.The color is a brighter blue than what is shown on my monitor, and it's a bit two-tone, lighter and darker blue.I'll update after washing it a few times.  The test of a good bathroom rug is how the rubber backing stands up to washing and drying, and whether the edges hold together.

Standard rubber mats have a solid surface -- those mats get slippery.  This mat is different.  The surface feels like fiber.  It's soft and cushiony -- very comfortable.  There are tiny holes in the mat and suction cups to help it adhere to the tub.  If you shower in your tub, this mat is much safer than a rubber mat with no drainage holes.Because this mat isn't made with rubber, it has no rubber smell.  It's machine washable and contains an antimicrobial agent to inhibit growth of mold and mildew.  The size is perfect for a standard tub.  You can move around without stepping off the mat.The label warns against use on a textured surface; the suction cups adhere better to a flat surface.  My tub has some textured strips but they're starting to wear, so the mat doesn't slip.If you're using a standard rubber mat in your tub/shower, consider replacing it with this one.  The difference in comfort and safety is worth it.

I love this.  I've used several brands of bottled hand soap, and this container is by far the most useful design.  As you can see, the bottle is short and squat -- it won't tip over -- and it's tapered in the center, for a good grip.Best of all, the pump is bigger than most pumps, and it's flat.  Your palm won't slip off.Foam means there's no drip, so no clog.  The scent is luscious.  I can't speak for the moisturizing effect, since it's still winter here and the air is very dry.  No matter what I use, I'll need hand lotion, at least until the humidity in the house is over 20%.I'm very, very happy with this, and will be buying it instead of the Dial foaming soap.

I expect a tingling sensation with toners, and maybe cleansers, but not with a sunscreen or a moisturizer.  There's no redness though, so maybe the tingling is because of the "luminous" aspect.The product is just okay.  It might be more useful for the SPF factor, but not for moisture.  This one leaves my skin feeling a bit tight and dry.  That might be a good thing -- maybe it's tightening my wrinkles -- but at my age (68), I don't like the dry feeling.

Twenty-five years ago, on impulse, teenager Jon Willing and his two best friends stole money from drug dealers -- a lot of money.  They thought they were smart, that if they didn't spend the money conspicuously, no one would suspect them.  They went on with their ordinary lives, finished school, got married, moved on.  They kept in touch with weekly phone calls, and it looked like they'd gotten away with it, until one of them didn't answer that weekly phone call.  The chase is on.What elevates The Accounting above the standard thriller is character.  There's plenty of action but what kept me reading was learning about Jon.  We learn about Jon as Jon learns about Jon, as he figures out for himself why he did that dangerous, impulsive thing, and how that act formed his adult life, shaped his personality, affected all his relationships.  This insight was fascinating, and original.  However, he's not totally sympathetic; he's a mortgage broker, after all, and has more to answer for than robbing drug dealers. To his credit, he understands this.The book is peppered with Jon's thoughts on the economy, life in suburbia, Little League, conspicuous consumption, raising kids, country clubs and golf.  Some of this made me think and some made me laugh out loud.The book is a "page-turner".  When the action slows, there are interesting characters and often witty conversations.  (If it's filmed, there's a role tailor-made for Conchata Ferrell.)I'd recommend this to anyone, with a warning about graphic violence and some torture.

Many airtight containers are airtight but I've yet to find any that are so easy to use.  If you've used Tupperware or similar products, you've probably broken a fingernail getting the thing open.  Or you've heard "Grandma! Help me with this please!"So this poptop is either a good thing -- no more fussing with the lid, or a bad thing -- too easy for little ones to get to the goodies.The jar has a wide mouth -- big enough for any size cookie.A clear jar so you can see inside and an airtight lid that's easy to use -- what more can you ask of a cookie jar (except cookies).

I had planned to order a new seat until I read the Amazon reviews. It looks like the new wooden seats (Bemis and others) are not solid wood and do not last very long. It took less than two minutes to snap these into my old solid wood seat and it is as good as new.

I use this to keep chipmunks out of my blueberries and it does the job well. Fi-Shock, however sells the more powerful model (without the Havahart Label)  on Amazon for less: http://www.amazon.com/Fi-Shock-EAC10A-FS-Super-Energizer-10-Acre/dp/B00536X0AS/ref=sr_1_1?s=lawn-garden&ie=UTF8&qid=1437871798&sr=1-1&keywords=Fi-Shock&pebp=1437871986825&perid=19Z1RERCC5SGYMSKBDTRIt is the 10 acre model EAC10A that puts out 1,200 volt AC vs. the 800 volts that this one puts out.  That's the one that I would have purchased if I had been aware of it. One lesson that I did learn is that wood does not provide adequate isolation. Voltage dropped from 800 to 75 before I added plastic insulators.

I bought this to speed up large backups and that was the first test that I did after installation. The test was very simple. Copy and Paste a folder containing 5GB of files from an internal HDD to an external WD Green 2TB HDD. First using USB 2, then an eSATA  dock and finally to a USB3 dock hooked up to this card. This card was more than 2x faster than USB 2, and slightly slower than eSATA. Results to paste 5GB as follows:USB2: 3min 23secUSB3: 1min 35seceSATA: 1min 11secA much larger file transfer with this card (290GB) took 62min for a transfer rate of 4.7GB/min) for USB3. My problem with eSATA was with the instability that the eSATA card caused in my old Dell XPS9000. Sometimes the drive was not recognized and at other times the computer would not shut down till I turned the eSATA drive bay off. So far I'm quite happy with the stability of the computer with this card and consider the slight loss of speed to be a small price to pay. If you are getting significantly faster performance with a newer computer, please post your results.Installation Tip: Unless you have unusually convenient power cables inside you PC, you will need one of these http://www.amazon.com/StarTech-com-LP4POWEXT12-12-Inch-Molex-Extension/dp/B00H91B980/ref=pd_sim_147_7?ie=UTF8&refRID=1ZEA8SZ2WNV0SMGQWWW5

I often make extended recordings and was tired of replacing the two AA batteries every other day. I then discovered that the H5 can be powered through its USB connector using a cheap iPhone portable charger and ordinary USB cable with a USB mini connector on the Zoom end.  I first tried it with this 6000 mAh charger (pictured) and it used up less than 1/3 of the capacity in eight hours. I then tried it with a small  3,200 mAh charger by Anker and it worked fine with that as well. I'll leave it to you to run your own endurance test, but expect that it would meet most needs.  I'm now very happy with my new Zoom H5.

Reduced the boot time from six minutes to 35 seconds and significantly sped up general performance. This is a SATA 2 computer so that I did not get the full benefit, but I'm very happy with the improvement. Also, I did not use the Magician SW (see update below) to optimize Win 7 for SSD because I did not want to screw up the two other internal hard drives that remain in my computer.  Migration software worked flawlessly and set up was a breeze.  I used an eSATA external drive bay rather than USB to do the cloning and it worked fine.Update 10/23/2015: I did not initially install the "optional" Samsung Magician software which is supposed to optimize performance but was initially so pleased with the speed that I put up with the occasional crash. When the crashes became more frequent, I decided to give the software a try and have not had a crash since. My guess is that the buffers it sets up are needed to help the old computer keep up with a drive that is much faster than the hard drives it was designed for.

While the mounting hole spacing did not allow all four screws to line up, two screws were plenty to hold my Samsung SSD firmly in place.  It comes with all the required mounting screws and was easy to install.

While this is definitely high quality paper, it is considerably thicker than what I normally use and overkill for general correspondence or business graphics. Had I been more knowledgeable about paper weights, I would have ordered a 24 lb. laser paper. I know that it is not fair to drop them one star for my ignorance, but I do not claim to be a fair person. Just wanted to warn others who are looking for ordinary laser paper that this is not it.

After reading the reviews I almost returned this thing without using it, but I am glad I gave it a try. I used it to apply a Spectraside insect killer and experienced no leaks while I was applying the insecticide. It did however leak profusely after I had finished spraying and turned the hose pressure off. The leak was just above the hose coupling as others have described, but did not start until I pulled the trigger to relieve the built up water pressure before removing the sprayer. Just water and no big deal for me. I used the flat spray pattern to apply the insecticide around the foundation of my house and found it much easier to use than the tank sprayers that I have used in the past.

The thread is much thinner than you would find on a normal button and the tiny needles have eyes that are too small to allow the thread to pass through. I am throwing this kit away as it is not worth returning and will go to a local store where I will try to find some real thread and real needles. That's what I was trying to avoid having to do when I bought this kit from Amazon.

0:16 Mins This video illustrates the squeaking (squishing) sound that you get when you walk in these shoes. I'm surprised that complaints from many others over a two year period have not been enough to get Merrell to fix the problem. You will never sneak up on anyone in these shoes.

Exactly as I remember them. The same taste and texture that I remember from my childhood in the south. I would not recommend ordering them in the hottest part of the summer as I do not expect that they would hold up very well in 90 plus temperatures.
Excellent quality print. Shipped by VIP sports in flat envelope with rigid foam backing that prevented bending or damage. A worthy memento of the play of the decade. Truly suitable for framing.

Nice NFL Certifies Hat, but not up to the standards of previous Patriots Super Bowl Hats. It is lighter weight and lacks the two basic colors, decorative piping, and thicker material of the earlier hats. It is however well made and I ordered it when I gave up on the NFL producing one of the more elaborate hats that have been offered for other Super Bowls. I guess the NFL really does not like the Patriots. Still a nice summer weight hat that brings my collection of Super Bowl Victory Hats to 4. Hoping for 5 soon.

I use it to put my iPad Air 2 at eye level while working out on my treadmill.  Looking down at an iPad or an iPhone is extremely bad for your posture and many in the medical profession are predicting that today's millennialis will be as stooped over as 80-year-olds by the time they reach 40. This device puts the iPad at eye-level for a person up to six feet tall. Check out the maximum opening of the C clamp (1.75") to be sure that it will fit on your treadmill. I mounted mine on a 1 inch diameter padded crossbar. It is extremely easy for me to insert and remove my iPad, with or without the case, and holds the iPad securely.

When my gimpy plastic supermarket holder cracked after two years, I decided to look for something a little more solid and attractive. If I had read the one and two star reviews first I would probably not have ordered this one, but I'm glad that I did. Those reviews suggesting that there are some quality control problems but the one that I got is perfect. That's the advantage of ordering on Amazon where the returns are free and easy.

The color that was shown in the picture was orange at the time that I ordered. This would have made them easy to find in the bottom of a drawer. The ones that I received were black. Still a great tool that I use every day to peel and orange for my smoothie. Excellent for both naval and Valencia oranges.

I was reluctant to upgrade from the non-flex version as it looked like I would be losing control of the razor. After trying one I realized that there was no loss of control and a significant improvement in the shave. I liked it well enough to buy a second one for my travel kit.
I applied it to the deposits that had built up on the heating element of a vegetable steamer and it had absolutely no effect.

I've been wearing Merrell Moab Ventilators for many years and wanted something that looked a little less like it belonged on a hiking trail. I saw the waterproof version of these at a local store when I went to pick up a new pair of Ventilators and they looked like they met my requirements. Same souls and fit but with leather uppers. Unfortunately, as is the case with most waterproof shoes, my feet were hot and sweaty within two minutes. I then ordered this non-waterproof version from Amazon and am very happy with the result. They are much cooler without the waterproof lining and I can hardly tell the difference between these in my Ventilators.

Perfect for heating precooked frozen meats. Takes about 28 minutes and leaves them as fresh and juicy as the day they were cooked. Far better than microwave or long-term thawing which tends to toughen and dry meat. I've used it for fish, meatloaf, and chicken. Also excellent for steaming vegetables which take less time and can be added about ten minutes later. The lid is a bit fragile and mine needed a little super glue at the two-year point, but overall an excellent value. I use it daily and highly recommended it.Update: Hairline crack developed in plastic lid after two years of daily use and then handle fell off. Warranty only for one year and the cost of replacing the lid was almost as much as the complete unit. I opted to order a  complete new unit and still like it well enough to leave my rating at five stars.

I've used two of these for two years and the first one died today. They have been used to charge my iPhone 4 and one charge (from 20% to 100%) just about exhausts the capacity. Best features are small size and built-in iPhone 4s and earlier connector -- will not work with iPhone 5 and beyond.  For this price, there cannot be much quality control and while mine were both good, it should not be surprising if you have to exchange a DOA. I would recommend buying two or more and returning the DOAs. If you expect more than this from a five dollar charger, you are living on the wrong planet. Much larger and more expensive chargers sold on Amazon have as much as five time the capacity and will also charge iPads. I purchased one by Jackery for that purpose and it works quite well. It does, however, require a not-included connector cable that is compatible with your device so that it will work with iPhone 5 as well as other smart phones, but not as convenient for iPhone 4 use.

I am so puzzled by all of the positive reviews that I've tried several times to get it to work. I've tried on several different types of weeds and in each case it leaves an unsightly hole and rarely gets the entire root system. My last attempt was after several days of rain so that moisture is not the problem. It would probably do a better job on a large isolated weed in loose soil but I don't have that situation.

Works fine if you first compress travel tube to remove air and hold it flat as you fill. Otherwise, trapped air will prevent filling. Different brands of toothpaste have different size caps and this may not fit them all. Colgate is larger that Crest, but the unique tapered design allows this device to fit both. They are now selling this device directly on their own site and I do recommend them for the frequent flyer who is fussy about their favorite toothpaste. Easy to find on Google.

Mine has been running continuously for more than three years with no problems. Recovers after power failures with no action on my part. Creates very realistic TV pattern outside a guest bedroom. I've given several as gifts and they all like them.

This came with my Dell XPS computer and I immediately replaced it with a larger and much more expensive Samsung. Big mistake; the Samsung caused severe eyestrain as do many other LCD monitors. I went back to this Dell and ordered a second one from Amazon as a backup. Most people can use just about any LCD monitor, but if you have fussy eyes you might look for one of these on Amazon and eBay. They have been discontinued.

This product does an excellent job of moisturizing without creating an oily shiny appearance and does very well as a sunscreen. It is also odorless. When I noticed that the price had more than doubled with all of the sellers listed on this date, I googled for alternatives and found it for much less at an old standby online drugstore. Yes, I did notice that the listed price was for two, but it is still double what I paid on Amazon the last time I purchased it.

I was skeptical as to the prospect of getting a replacement for my original battery at one third the price. My first test was to charge it in my Dewalt charger and run it for about 20 minutes. That worked out fine but the big test was yet to come. What would it do after sitting around for six weeks without being used? Would it still have the same level of energy? It passed that test as well and I am now a believer. My drill is a Dewalt DC 727.

It charged to 100% and looked fine at first, but then the problems came. First, the remaining battery indication percentage was extremely erratic. It would remain at 100% after many shots, then suddenly show 50% or less, and then suddenly fail completely. It also failed to hold a charge when left in my EOS-6D overnight. I've purchased several other STK batteries and find that about one in three are duds, but the price and Amazon's easy return policy at first appeared to make it worth the risk. That changed when I learned that the voltage on this battery is higher than on the Canon battery and according to Canon can damage your 6D camera. I measured the voltage on both and found the STK to be .8 volts higher than the Canon. There are several different types of Li-ion battery cells (LCO, LMO, etc) and this battery may use a chemistry that accounts for the voltage difference. While I was willing to risk getting a bad battery that could be easily exchanged, I'm not willing to risk my EOS 6D.
Large, bold and very high quality. No flaws on backs to give away value. A pleasure to play with. High quality spinners.
Solid mount and big improvement over the plastic one that comes with the Foscam. The supplied screws, however are butter soft and very easily stripped. Save time and use your own screws.

This is my second try at a cheap wireless remote for my 7D and I'm very happy with it. The first one (by Accessory Power) was unreliable, had a very limited range, ate expensive lithium batteries, and failed completely after one year. This one works consistently in the single shot, Continuous, HS Continuous and timer modes. Have not tried Bulb mode.The blinking light that indicates the receiver is turned on could be a bit distracting, but receiver can be reversed in the camera shoe to point away from the subject.  I've tried it at distances up to 60 ft  and it has worked without failure. Will update this review if battery life proves to be a problem, but will be thrilled if the cheap AAAs give close to specified standby times. Note that different sellers sell this same product under different names such as Pixel and Oppilas. Mine was marked with both of these names with no mention of RainbowImaging. Check the customer images to see if you are ordering the same one.

What they do not show in the pictures is a huge cable/connector collection that is not weatherproof and cannot be disconnected from the camera after wireless setup. This leaves you with the choice of either drilling a large hole (1-inch plus) in the side of your house, or building a special weatherproof enclosure (almost as big as the camera) to house the cables and connectors outside. In theory; all that should be needed after wireless setup is a very thin DC power cable that would require only a 1/8 inch hole to be drilled through the wall and require no extra housing for cables and connectors. I don’t know how much they saved by not designing the setup cable to be disconnected before outdoor installation, but they have certainly lost one customer for failing to do so. This was a huge disappointment to me because it is otherwise a very nice camera and the technical support was excellent.
Perfect fit and very easy installation on my 20-year old door. Note that they come in two sizes: 2-in and 2-1/4 in screw spacing.

I've used my 5200 every day for the last 2-1/2 years and was surprised when it started to act up a bit. It would still work, but would occasionally surge to a higher speed when set for a low speed. I had not expected this as I have friends who have used theirs more heavily for five years or more with no problems at all. When I called Vitamix customer service, I discovered that the 7-Year warranty is golden. A very courteous and knowledgeable rep listened patiently to my description of the problem and told me that I would need to send it in to the factory. She then emailed me a prepaid UPS label which I affixed to the box -- which I had thankfully kept. The repaired and refurbished blender showed up at my doorstep 10 days after I dropped it off at the UPS store. Not only did they fix the problem, they gave me a new container and lid. Nothing that I could see was wrong with the old one. I've never before had such an experience with any warranty.While this is by far the best blender I've ever owned, I have dropped it one star because I have to use the tamper on about every fifth smoothie. It's a matter of what you put in it and how it is packed, and not a big deal to tamp it down. Just once to get it started and it does the rest on its own. It's also too tall to fit under my cabinets, but again not a big deal to take the container off for storage. They now make a wider and shorter one with the same capacity that should solve both of these minor problems and I might consider it if I ever need another blender. I've had enough bad experiences with cheaper blenders (Kitchenaid and Breville) that I would not take a chance on any other brand. Breville, by the way, was the absolute worst. In spite of the much higher price of the Vitamix, I have found it to be the least expensive on a cost per smoothie basis: $480 / 7-years x 365 days = 19 cents per smoothie; even if it goes belly up at exactly 7 years. I expect that it will last much longer.Strongest points for this Vitamix are ability to blend almost anything -- stringy oranges, frozen bananas, flax seeds, calcium pills, etc. and easy cleanup.Interesting Experiment: Smoothie too warm? While the Vitamix was out for repair, I used an old KitchenAid blender and noticed that my smoothies were colder than they had been in the Vitamix. When the Vitamix returned, I tried this experiment: Fill 1/2 with water and run for one minute at highest speed -- measure water temp before and after, then repeat at variable speed 7.  Result: Water temperature increased by 14 degrees at highest speed, but only 7 degrees at lower speed. I learned that the higher speed was overkill for my smoothies and now blend them at variable speed 7 with an occasional high speed burst. Alternative is to add a little ice. This is not a flaw of the blender, but a simple illustration of the First Law of Thermodynamics -- more kinetic energy equals more heat.

A beautiful set with less than perfect quality control. A small white pock mark on the back of one domino and a small black one on another make it possible for anyone to identify their values while face down. They arrived in factory sealed packets, so I assume it's a factory quality control problem. This might not be a big deal for some, but it ruins the game for me. Like playing poker with a marked deck. I'm exchanging them for white ones on the theory that single color dominoes are less likely to have defects.

I had the original two pairs of 512MB Modules in my Dell 8300 for a total of 2GB before this upgrade. After swapping out one pair for this 2GB upgrade I expected to see a total of 3GB and that is what the Crucial system scanner shows that I have. Windows XP (SP 3) however only shows 2.5GB of RAM under computer-properties. Don't have a clue why this would happen, but the system does seem a bit faster anyway. It is possible that you need to reconfigure the system BIOS to recognize the full 3GB, but there are no instructions for that.UPDATE: After installing two more sticks of Crucial 1GB for a total of 4GB, Windows XP Pro (32bit) is still showing only 2.5GB of memory available. All four sticks are identical 1GB Crucial, and I've determined that they are all working properly by inserting them one at a time. I also have the latest BIOS A07 installed. Going to setup at boot up shows that all 4 sticks are properly installed. System properties also confirms 4GB of total Physical RAM, but only 1.8GB available RAM -- about what I would expect from 2.5GB minus Windows XP and other program memory use. Bottom line is that while my Dell manual says that the 8300 can accommodate 4GB, mine does not provide more than 2.5GB of usable memory.

If you don't mind downloading the instructions from the web, this referb unit is the way to go. I purchased mine from Dealville and it was delivered in about four days. While the setup is not completely idiot proof, it is not too difficult for the average non-technical user who can follow instructions. I made a couple of mistakes, but was able to correct them by going back and reading the instructions again. If you screw up in the initial connection to your PC, use the reset button on the extender and start over. The button must be held in for about five seconds. This extender is especially effective in situations where your Wi-Fi router is at one end of your house and coverage is weak or nonexistent on the other end. Just put this device in a spot where you already have good coverage near the middle of your house and it will do wonders. It creates a second network with an extension of _EXT on the end of your old network name. The new network has the same password as your old one and will be picked up automatically once you've signed in on your iPad or iPhone. The download speed will probably be about 40% slower than on your primary network, so that you may be better off on the original network for NETFLIX HD movies. For most other web uses, you will not notice a speed difference unless you do a speed test.This range extender was so effective in solving my Wi-Fi coverabe problems that I purchased a second one for a friend. It also worked perfectly for her.

I almost gave this thing away when I found that it would not work with my New iPad (3rd Gen) and USB flash drives, or with CF Card Readers. It also failed with several SD cards with an indication of too much power required. I then discovered that it does two things very well: Retrieving photos (even RAW format) and videos via USB directly from my Canon EOS 7d to my iPad, and transferring videos and photos from my iPhone 4 to my iPad. It allows me to select the photos and videos that I want to transfer and my iPad displays them (even the RAW Canon images) in all their glory. It does the same for images and videos on my Sony Cyber-shot HX30V when a micro-USB cable is substituted for the mini-USB cable, and does so without the compression loss of Sony's Play Memories Wi-Fi app. The second connector that is supposed to read SD cards is worthless since the iOS upgrade that limited power to external devices. Bottom line is that this kit only works with self-powered devices, but is so handy to use with my EOS 7D, Sony HX30V and iPhone that I'm glad I did not give up on it. I'm told that it works with most other Canon and Nikon cameras, but you need to read more reviews to find out if it works with yours.

I'm wearing this in size 34 with size 32 Dockers and it fits perfectly in the middle hole. I was tired of the normal solid leather belts that force you to choose between too tight and droopy. This looks much better and is very comfortable. Given the stretch and web construction, it would stand to reason that it will not last as long as a solid leather belt, but I would consider it a bargain if I only have to replace it once a year. Will update this review when it does need replacing.

If you are not familiar with OEM drive installation, you should know that these drives will not be automatically recognized by your system. If you are using Windows, you will have to go into the Device Manager to initialize and format the disk. While the instructions for doing this do not come with this drive, they are easy to find through Google, as I have to do every time I install one. It only takes a few minutes. The drive came well packaged and works perfectly.

While it  is true that each USB port is capable of 2.1 amps, they cannot both do this at the same time. Not a problem for 2 iPhones that only take 1 amp each, but throw in an iPad that takes 2 amps and things slow down. Both will still charge, it will just take longer. No problem charging both my iPhone and iPad overnight. I would raise my rating to four stars if it were not for the misleading Amazon description.

While this is a solid printer with full control over printing options when used with a PC, the lack of control when printing from an iPhone or iPad make it prohibitively expensive for AirPrint. Because you cannot preview or select the particular page you wish to print from Safari, or any other app that I've tried, you must print the whole document. To make things worse, you cannot select B&W when you do not need color. As a result, you typically get two or three color pages when all you need is one B&W page. When you consider the price of replacing all four cartridges, this makes it outrageously expensive to use AirPrint. While the HP website indicates that some iPad and iPhone apps allow you to select a page range, I have yet to find an app that offers that option. Also, I find nothing on their website that indicates an option to select B&W vs color. If AirPrint is to become a truly usefull feature, Apple needs to work with app developers and printer manufacturers to offer more control options.Finally, I'm a bit disappointed to find that the two-sided printing is not automatic. While the specification does say that it is manual, automatic two-sided printing is a standard feature on many less expensive printers -- such as my four-year-old Brother Laser.In summary, this printer is easy to set up with iPhones,iPads and Win 7 PCs and produces high quality documents.  The limited AirPrint control and functionality however makes it less than a bargain.

This review started off as a five star two weeks ago, but things have changed. The first problem took the form of erratic "remaining capacity" readings from my Canon EOS 7d. It might read 65% after a shooting session and then magically return to 100% after sitting around for an hour or more. It would, however, return to 65% after one or more shots, so I decided to live with this and did not change my review. A week later, it does not fully charge on my Canon charger. After charging overnight, the charger lights were still blinking and the capacity read only 57% in the camera. This has now happened twice. Most recently, the battery failed in the middle of recording a 10-minute video clip when it should have had plenty or capacity left. I haven't decided whether to go through the hassle of asking for a replacement as I don't know if the replacement would be any better. As much as I hate to pay Canon's inflated battery price, I guess I'll stick with them. Too bad as this looked like a really good deal.Update (7-25-2012): After two months, I decided to give Sterlingtek's one-year guarantee a try and called their customer service to find out if it was worth the trouble. They sent a replacement the next day with no grief or hastle. It arrived by Fedex Express and has worked perfectly through three recharge cycles. Given their guarantee and responsive customer service, I now consider the price to make it worth a try and would recommend buying directly from the company. I will update this review if the replacemtnt gives me problems.

Looked exactly the same as the charger that came with my 3rd Gen iPad but did not last long. At first I was afraid that there was something wrong with my iPad, but measurements showed it was the charger. This is most likely an unlicensed fake.

The compartment is definitely not waterproof, so that your phone, wallet, etc is not protected from sweat or rain. This problem is easily solved with a cheap zip-lock bag. For my iPhone 4 with bumper case the snack size bag (6-1/2 x 3-1/4) is perfect. The added benefit is the ability to put your keys in the same compartment without concern for scratching the screen. The compartment rides so comfortably that I forget I'm wearing the belt after a run.

This should be called the Premium Heart Rate Monitor PLUS Soft Strap. While it would be nice to order the strap only (it is the item that wears out), I have not found a way to do that. As for this monitor/strap combination, it is the same one that comes with the Forerunner 610 and I find it much better than my old Polar monitor/strap. It is a lot more comfortable and does a much better job of ignoring interference from power lines and other sources of electromagnetic interference. I've yet to see a single spike in areas where my old Polar monitor routinely went berserk. I was very lucky to order it before Amazon recognized that it was more than a strap and increased the price by 50%. Even at the new price, I would recommend it as a replacement strap plus spare monitor. My one gripe is that it is not compatible with my Precor Treadmill or Life Fitness elliptical which both work with my old Polar monitor. I look forward to the day when they standardize this interface.

I wish that I had read more reviews more carefully before I bought this thing. It was fine for about six months and then the problems started. First it started beeping at odd times while on the charger. Then the screen froze. Then the charger started to discharge the watch rather than charge it. While I expect Garmin to send a replacement, a closer look at the other Amazon reviews tells me that the replacement will probably not last much longer than this one did. I would not have purchased this watch if I had realized that the lifespan would be so short and would strongly recommend disregarding any review from a user who has owned the watch for less than a year.

I already had a 12-foot pull-cord type pruner which is great for larger higher branches, but nearly impossible to handle on small lower branches that require a near horizontal reach. This pruner weighs only 1 lb & 9 oz and is perfect for any small branch below 10 feet. I have no problem holding and clipping with one hand in a near horizontal position. While it is perfect for soft wood (new growth, etc) up to 1/2" in diameter, I would not recommend it for larger harder branches and would not expect a pruner this light and handy to be used for such heavy duty work. The cutting blade is extremely sharp, so that surprisingly little force is needed. Their literature claims that it is made of a high carbon steel that will outlast the softer steel used by their competitors and a find no reason to doubt that. The construction is first rate and it is a pleasure to use. My shrubs are already looking better.

This armband is far too much trouble for me to actually use. First, I must remove the bumper case from my iPhone 4. Next, the phone must be squeezed into a very tight armband compartment. So tight that I initially thought they had sent me the wrong armband. After doing this, you have a visible display in an awkward viewing position along with buttons that sometimes work. For those who need to have their iPhone display in full view (at least for passers-by) throughout a run, this may be necessary, but that is not a requirement for me. The iPhone's audio beeps and rings, along with the Nike-GPS app's announcements of pace and time at half mile intervals are all I need or want. I get this by carrying my phone in the pocket of my running jacket in the winter, but need a solution for the summer when there are no pockets. All the products that I see on Amazon look like they would have the same problem. Any suggestions would be appreciated.UPDATE: My solution is the Small Personal Item Belt SPIbelt - Small Personal Item Belt - Great for Runners!, Black along with a ziplock snack size bag for waterproofing. It easily accomodate my iPhone with bumper case and is inconspicuous under my untucked running shirt.

After downloading the free trial version from Adobe and playing with it for a while, I came very close to paying twice this much for the permanent version. When I stumbled upon this Amazon version, the price seemed too good to be true. I was pleased to discover that it is exactly the same product. The one possible difference is that the more expensive version is good for both PC and Mac, while you must choose one or the other with this option. Since I only have PCs, that is fine by me. A great deal!Update, 4-6-12: As of this date, Amazon was no longer offering it at half price. I suspect that I benefited from a pricing error. Still an excellent program and a convenient way to buy.

My wife wanted a small TV in our kitchen.  I don't know why, I do most of the cooking lol).  Anyway, I wasn't able to hook up a wireless connection where she wanted it, so I bought this starter kit.  I had her TV up and running in under fifteen minutes..no  exaggeration.  After I hooked up the two units, they paired almost immediately.  The directions say not to use an extension cord but I did anyway.  The Powerline worked flawlessly.  I highly recommend this product without hesitation.

After watching the installation video that the packaging refers to, I was able to place this screen protector on my new iPhone 6 with no problems. I bought this to protect the screen from smudges and scratches, not to protect from drops. This is the first screen protector that went on without bubbles or spots from debris.

At first, I didn't think I was going to like this because it has an "industrial" look to it.  But after I put it together (comes folded, just unfold and add the two drawers) I saw how versatile this storage unit is.  It is perfect for a kid's room for toys, books, audio/video equipment, sports stuff, etc.  I also think it's appropriate for an office, especially a home office, for books, files and such.  My wife claimed it for our laundry room store extra laundry and other supplies.  I was thinking about using it in my garage workshop, however when I saw that it wasn't really designed to hang on a wall, I passed.  Not being able to hang it is the only flaw in the design that I encountered.The shelving unit weighs about 30 pounds and comes in a large flat cardboard box.  Safco has other shelves available so it would be easy to add more and match them to this product.  The shelves are very sturdy and I wouldn't hesitate to put heavy items on them.  Overall a very good product with many uses.

So I read all these glowing reviews and how tasty this supplement is, and thought, "Yeah, right, whatever."  But I'm adding my glowing review for this drink mix.  It actually tastes GOOD.  I've tried other powder supplements before and could never get past the smell or taste.  Because what good is a supplement if it's not desirable to take.  This one is really different.  Obviously it's too soon to tell whether I'm getting any health benefit from it,  but it's nice to know that I don't have to "make" myself drink this.  It does have a slight citrus flavor to it.  I added a scoop to my frozen coffee drink, thinking I was going to ruin the taste, but it actually tasted better!Although there are thousands of species of mushrooms, science has found about six that warrant consideration.  This mushroom blend contains all of them.  The many health benefits of mushrooms include  improved weight management, improved nutrition, increased vitamin D levels, and improved immune system function.  It's nice to know there is an easy way to get this into our bodies.

My wife and I have visited New Orleans countless times.  Those of us who live in the Florida panhandle are no strangers to hurricanes.  A year before Katrina, our city of Pensacola was devastated by Hurricane Ivan.  What Katrina did to New Orleans, of course, is almost unthinkable.  This bond we share with others who have suffered prompted me to read this book.  Wendell Pierce, the author and well-known actor and resident of New Orleans tells of his family's ties to the city, their sacrifices, and their experiences before, during and after Katrina.  The city is recovering because of the character and determination of its citizens.  The importance of musicians and other artists is underlined in his story, because what would New Orleans be without these special people.  Thoroughly enjoyable book, easy to read and a pleasure to become aware of Mr. Pierce's personal story.

I like these gloves, particularly because of how easy they go on, and off.  Unlike some other gloves, I didn't have to turn them inside out to remove them.  They stretch really well, so you can pull the gloves off your hand finger by finger without the gloves tearing.  They are great for working around the house, especially for cleaning, painting, woodworking, etc.  They are not latex-free, so people with who are allergic to rubber latex must avoid them.  They are not intended for medical uses.  Made in Indonesia.

I had no problems using this skin lightener. I used it on my hands to try and lighten some sun spots. I haven't seen a difference yet, but I've just begun using it. My wife used this product on her neck area and immediately began burning and itching. She has sensitive skin. The product label comes with warnings about avoiding the sun after use. The label should also include warnings about using with herbal products, pregnancy, and prescription drugs, as well as people with sensitivity issues.The label states, "Discontinue use if no improvement is seen after 3 months of treatment."  I thought that was funny, as if someone would keep buying something that didn't work.Personally, I wouldn't buy this.  I didn't care for the fragrance. It made me think of my grandmother's hand lotion. A suggestion:  I have found a some success for dark spots using grapefruit seed extract.  Maybe that could work for you, too.

My hair is normally dull and dry. With just a few drops placed onto my palms and rubbed vigorously into my hair, it makes my hair look and feel silky smooth and shiny.  I have short hair, so a little goes a long way.  The hair treatment feels like and smells like baby oil.  If I use too much it weighs my hair down and looks a little greasy.
Watched the first 30 minutes hoping something interesting would happen. It didnt.

There is not a lot to say about a box of disposable gloves.  I like to use these for painting, cleaning outdoors, washing our cars, and for preparing meat and fish.  The box states these are meant for single use, but for painting, I get 2 or 3 uses from them.  They don't tear easily and are very stretchy.  They are not for medical use.The size Medium I have fits snugly.  I'm not a big guy, so I think these run just a little small.  They are latex and powder free.  Because they are textured, you can pick up a coin wearing them.  Unlike some gloves, these have no odor.Overall, a good disposable glove.  You might want to buy a size up if you're unsure.  Made in Thailand.

Ive used leveling tools before, but this one is different from those. Instead of just projecting a laser line, this one features a cross-line laser (like you would see on a sniper's weapon). It is simple to use, and can be used hand held, or with the tripod legs. In these photos, I used it handheld to show how easy it is to hang a picture straight. Although trying to hold the level in one hand and taking the photos with the other wasn't so easy lol.  I purposely made the picture look crooked in order to show the cross-laser feature.The level is very compact, about the size of a pocket flashlight. It comes with a nylon case that even has a Velcro strap to attach it to your belt. Also comes with the single AA alkaline  battery and, of course its instruction pamphlet.It has a self-leveling feature that adjusts itself when using the tripod on a flat surface.This tool is ideal for inside tasks like hanging pictures, mounting wall fixtures, painting, and even using as a chalk line for laying flooring.

My wife and I both used this product. She has very sensitively skin while I have an oily complexion. Both of us liked the mud mask; it made our faces feel tighter and cleaner. If there is a fragrance to it, it was unnoticeable to me.  I like it because it's a two-minute process that I can do while brushing my teeth. So it adds no time to a nightly routine.  Any longer than two minutes I probably wouldn't do it.
I haven't found anything better to keep our humidifier clean.  Saves on filters  Prevents buildup of mold and mildew, and makes it much easier to clean. I have this on auto-ship.

I thought these chewing sticks would taste bad because of the tea tree ingredient.  But the cinnamon flavor overshadows that.  Just a hint of spice that is very enjoyable.  I can't find them anywhere locally.
I used this to secure my house ground wire that somehow worked loose with a different connector.  This worked just fine.
I used this to make burlap curtains for an outdoor shower.  This stuff is super sticky, and works very well outdoors.  Weather doesn't affect it.
This soundtrack is just as impressive as the show itself.  Different, powerful, thought-provoking, enjoyable.

From what I can tell these batteries are ok, but I haven't used them long term so I cannot vouch for their reliability.  I do have some comments that may be helpful for fellow Amazon customers:  I switched to Amazon Basics alkaline batteries several months ago and have found that brand to be the best value.  One of the main reasons I prefer Amazon's brand is because of their frustration-free recyclable packaging.  GoGreen touts how green their products are.  Why then wrap the batteries in difficult-to-open clamshells?  Also their recycling program leaves much to be desired.  It isn't exactly free, as you must "earn" a certain number of points to get a free mailing label.  It's a hassle.  GoGreen's labeling displays the "VetCanDo" logo, whose mission includes bringing manufacturing jobs back from overseas.  But these batteries are made in China, so I think that's hypocritical.  I realize my review is more about the manufacturer and less about the batteries.  But I will continue to purchase Amazon's brand because I know they are good and reliable, less expensive, and much easier to open.  On a positive note, the GoGreen's batteries came with an excellent "use-by" date of 2021.

Well, who doesn't use surge protectors nowadays?  This surge protector will accommodate four electronic devices, as long as the total load doesn't exceed 1800 watts, plus the added feature of two USB chargers.  Most people know this, but in case you don't, surge protectors won't keep lightning from frying your electronic goodies. Surge protectors will help when the power goes off and then surges back on. It's nice to be able to plug all my computer geek stuff into the same power strip and keep our phones charged at the same time.  As far as the $100K equipment protection the manufacturer provides, I don't know anyone who had successfully filed a claim for loss of connected devices.  Not sure if the warranty adds any value.

Excellent, good quality ingredients with no out-sourced products.  I love this dry dog food.  My dog hesitated when I put this in front of him.  He wasn't as excited as me.  He wouldn't eat it "straight."  I mixed some with his regular wet food and he gobbled it down.  He hasn't been on this food long enough to make a difference yet, but I'm sure it will.Also, this food comes in a resealable bag.  And the seal actually works.  You can pour the kibble straight from the opening (in front) and then seal it right back up.  Other dog food packaging I've tried never seemed to reseal correctly.

Here in Hurricane Country (Florida panhandle) we stock up on all types of batteries.  I have bought just about every brand there is and I've found AmazonBasics brand to be as effective and reliable as any other.  For the price these can't be beat.

This is the second one of these I bought.  I have it mounted on a pole near my swimming pool to help keep birds from pooping in the pool.  It works.  It is so lifelike that when I first put one up, my adult daughter screamed and ran back inside when she went outside for her smoke break.  I had the first one mounted on the same pole for two years and I had no birds in my yard.  However, one evening, an owl with a very large wingspan came and swooped down on it, knocked it off its perch and broke its head.  Feathers were everywhere.  So I can really attest that it looks real.
Bought these shoes for my wife, who likes them.  Comfortable, fun shoe, but don't expect arch support.

This steam mop is useful in a lot of ways, especially if you have large kitchens and bathrooms.  Not recommended for floors such as laminate or unsealed hardwood floors.  A couple of nice things about this mop are:  It stands up on its own.  No more propping it up against a wall.  Extra long cord.  Comes with over a dozen attachments:  brushes, scraping tool, window squeegee, grout cleaners and lots more.  Has a mesh bag to put all these attachments in.  Easy to use.As far as its operation, the steam mop works like any other steam mop I've owned.  Put water in the reservoir, wait 30 seconds for it to heat up, and SLOWLY mop the floor.  The steam will continue for about 20 minutes on one tankful (about 13oz).  This unit comes with two microfiber pads, one of which is more coarse than the other, for harder to clean surfaces.  When I used it, the mop easily erased spilled dried coffee stains from the floor.Something unique to this mop is its "easy scrubber" that attaches to the rear of the microfiber pad which helps get sticky stuff up.And of course, the big draw to this mop is that it has a detachable hand-held pod for surface cleaning and sanitizing.  Great for kitchen and bath counters.I found filling the reservoir to be sort of awkward because you have to lie the mop on its side to add the water.  No big deal, just different.  Also, I found it pretty hefty and some may think it's too heavy to handle on a daily basis.Overall a very versatile cleaning tool.

This is a nice, comfortable toilet seat.  After having a slow-closing seat, we won't ever go back to the old standard slamming type.  The seat is made of plastic which is easy to clean, and surprisingly comfortable.  It was easy to install.  One thing I particularly liked about this seat is that the manufacturer provided a couple of different washers to use with the bolts.  One set of washers is elongated allowing you to adjust the seat up or back when installing it.  Good idea.
I like using this on my microwave and counters.  It makes cleaning  It's supposed to make appliances smell better, but I didn't notice any fragrance.  No need to rinse or wipe off.
I've been using these for many years.  Good dental checkups.
Bought this for my 12' pool, so I had to shorten the rope.  Easy to do with youtube how-to video.  Looks good.
Works very well.  Good to repair and save expensive garden hoses.  Much better than the plastic fittings.
Looked nothing like the color in the photo. Flimsy.  Returned for refund.

It's a nice, tight elastic band.  Perhaps a little too tight.  I have a hard time getting my pen in but, at the same time, I don't have to worry about losing one.  It's pretty grippy and I absolutely could not get a pen in that had a rubbery grip.  Too much friction.  Fairly thin adhesive placard so there's minimal bulge added to my Moleskine.  I'm a satisfied customer.

Too drying.  Like how abrasive it is but I actually get more acne using this than without.  I was told that, because it is so drying, my skin tries to compensate with extra production and causes the increase in acne.  Don't know if that's true, but makes sense.  On top of that, switching to a moisturizing face wash has actually reduced my acne.  Interesting!

I love this case.  It is a perfect fit for my Sennheiser HD 600's plus comes with two pouches.  One pouch is small and fits loose things like adapters and my small (6") phone connections cords while the other is big and fills the entire space in the headband of the phones.  This pouch is nice because it velcros in place against the inside of the case so its contents don't fly around inside.  I put my portable headphone amp in that.  Also, it comes with a fishbone headphone cable wrap and it also comes with a velcro cable tie which I use to tie up my headphone wires.  It's nice and sturdy and should keep your headphones free of debris and safe inside your luggage when travelling.  Great stuff.

Works lightning quick.  My phone can start ringing and I can answer by flipping this open and putting it on.  It connects that quickly from power off and everyone likes the quality of sound they get from me.  Another great feature is that I have this paired to two phones at the same time (work phone and personal phone) so I can field calls from either while driving.  Battery lasts forever.  Falles short of 5 stars because it doesn't get very loud.

These sound great and the distance with clear signal is pretty good.  No issues in my 2500sf house.  Love that it has digital optical in so you can use the higher quality (than most digital devices these days) digital-to-analog converter in the base station.  Purchased a Chromecast Audio which has digital optical out and plugged it into this to listen to streaming music services via my phone and have noticeably improved quality over listening through headphones on the phone.  Very nice.  Sound profile is very similar to my HD600 headphones but a little lighter (just a touch) on the bass. These are exceptionally comfortable headphones.

Can't believe this is a ten dollar pen.  It looks really sharp, has a nice, solid metal feel in the hand and writes really well.  I have a couple of $100 pens and I actually prefer the writing of these Energel refills to them.  The pen doesn't feel as nice as those expensive ones, but the writing feels smoother and is richer and darker ink.  Love this pen.  Also, the Energel dries really quickly so no more inky cuffs on my white shirts!

Clicked it four times when it jammed and wouldn't work anymore. I have a twist version and it's fantastic.  Can't believe how much lower the quality is for the snapper. Do not buy! Get the standard twist version and you'll be happy.

One of the best leadership books I've ever come across.  This book actually tells the writer's story of success.  Exactly what he did.  No stratified concepts or theories with no practical, specific stories.  Capt. Marquet actually tells very specific, seemingly small and inconsequential stories, about running his submarine and managing the people onboard.  One of the best parts of this book is that, in his situation, he was stuck with these people that were performing poorly and couldn't just replace the personnel.  He was forced to deal with the people he had and make them better employees.This book really shines for mid to mid/high managers because he uses examples where he is levels removed from the people, but still has interactions with them and has to make decisions influencing their lives without being their direct supervisor.  There is good stuff to be had here for first line supervisors, but this book is really the perfect learning experience for those a level or two above that.
Great quality.  Heavy weight cloth.  Fits very well.  Is there anything else to say about these?

These are the best flip flops ever!  Get these.  They are like wearing sneakers (as far as the comfort goes).  Good arch support for all day pleasure.  One important tip:  Buy a half size large so that your feet don't protrude off of any edge!

This thing is awesome! Tested on iPhone 6, Android, and PC. Works great with all of them. On Windows 7, I had to wait a few moments for it to install drivers, but it was plug and play.  Purchased from J-made (Amazon listing) in Japan and saved a ton (about a third) over Amazon and other sellers and still received a US unit shipped from Japan.  Choose expedited shipping and received it in about six calendar days.This thing does not require any intervention from you (aside from selecting the correct input and adjusting the volume knob) and does not require the onkyo player software to work. It improves all sound on all three sources.  I can now crank up my volume and there is no hiss and the music is much punchier, clearer, and more distinct.I listened to the sources with my Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro 80 ohm headphones and my Sennheiser HD600 300 ohm cans as well.  My wife tried it and her words were "Wow, you really can hear more than without one"Surprisingly, it is very noticeable even with low quality 128kbps files.  You can clearly hear that they sound like garbage, but they sound like better garbage.Side benefit was that using this into my car's Aux input had drastically increased the sound quality of the music I listen to on my commute.  Night and day difference.This is the single best consumer audio purchase I've made.  Very pleased.  Everyone who listens to a lot of music on the go should get one of these.*Update*  Absolutely love this but wanted to comment to explain that this "comes" with the Onkyo DSD hi-res player app.  I was very confused at first because I downloaded the app from the app store and installed it.  It asked me for $10 to upgrade the player to DSD and hi-res ability (the player plays low res files for free).  I was very upset as the box says that the player is included.  I then plugged in my DAC and turned it on.  Bingo!  Suddenly, all features were enabled and it didn't ask me to upgrade...I was using the full version of the player software.  I turned off the DAC and all of the advanced features disappeared and it wanted me to pay $10 to use them...turned the player back on and everything went back to the full version for free.  So, the bottom line is their hi-res DSD player app is smart and checks to see if you have this product connected before it allows you the full version.

Interesting.  This is actually a Whirlpool part that is exactly the same as the Sears part...I compared them side by side.  The only difference is that this one is marked with whirlpool part numbers.  That's the funny things with Kenmore is that someone else makes their stuff and it's practically every company!  I bought two air conditioners of the same model from them and one was Samsung inside and the other LG! Same Kenmore model!  Anyway, this part is a nice $35 savings over picking this up at Sears.
I like how thin and flexible these cables are.  They other big plus is that they have very narrow ends that can fit through any opening on the tightest of phone cases to get to the headphone jack.
Great little cable.  Tiny ends, nice thin cable that is very comparable to the relaxed nature of the Apple branded cables.  No problems syncing iPhone 6 with this or the iPad 4.

Pretty nice.  Ratcheting system to hold glue stick in place works well.  Unfortunately, it takes forever to heat up to the level where I can actually apply the glue.  Also wish it had a way to prevent the glue from melting and pouring out of the end...with how long it takes to heat up, I usually walk away and then come back to find a puddle of glue.  If it heated up faster, this wouldn't happen.
I don't get how this is any faster than a stock keyboard or swype or swiftkey.  Very obnoxious to use if you Iike punctuation at all.

Avoid these!  I have an iPhone 6 and an iPad 4 and the cables worked for about a month.  Now, the devices say its an incompatible cable when plugged in.  This happens on two of the three cables.  I believe that I ave used them a total of mane andozen times each when this started happening,  the third one gets used everyday about once for an hour (at my desk at work).  Very surprised that they could crap out.  Plugged into genuine Apple charger!***UPDATE*** emailed the company.  They promptly shipped me a full replacement.  Updated from 1 to 3 stars due to follow up on their warranty.  Will update again after testing the new shipment which I received today.***UPDATE #2***  Have had the replacements for a while now.  They work great.  The only thing that keeps these from five stars is the thick insulation.  These are thick wires while most other brands are very thin and more flexible.  I prefer the thin, more flexible wires.

I really, really like this.  I love that it automatically switches to my Blu-Ray player when I turn it on, then back to my cable signal when I turn the player off.  That alone makes it worth the price.  The only problem is that this thing senses which device is active to decide where to switch so my Chromecast gave it fits since the Chromecast is always displaying a screen saver.

Work fine but the thicker ones from Progressive are better.  These are very thin and this can make them uncomfortable to use as they cut (not literally) into your hand.  The fine, almost knife-like, edges work in the right scenarios but also wear down much faster than other scrapers I've used.  I like these (because of their sharp edges) for more precision things like scraping bits off of my cutting board or cleaning off a non-stick baking sheet. Not so much for scraping my cast iron pans.

Simple, comfortable, adjustable.  Is there anything else you would want from this?  Being able to adjust the lenses makes Google Cardboard compatible 3D apps and videos actually look much better.  With standard Cardboard, I had blurry spots in my field of view and had to try hard to focus.  Since upgrading to this and being able to position the lenses right over my eye and twist the lenses to focus, everything is much clearer.  The rubber face bumpers are SOOOO much more comfortable than the cardboard of Cardboard.  Get this.

This really saved my blueberries from the birds.  The only problem is that it's hideous and I had to put a ton everywhere to keep the birds away.  When I first deployed, the birds would just go around to the side without tape...only a foot away from the tape on the opposite side of the bush.  Once I saw them approach meekly from the opposite side, I put up tape on the other side and it worked.  I knocked off one start because the tape now overwhelms my garden and is aesthetically unappealing.

Pros: no wires (on the camera, requires base station); weather proof; easy set up; good picture; one year free Web storageCons: no audio; requires base station plugged into ethernet port on your routerI like this device and really thought it was perfect until I learned  there was no audio support and none planned.  I figured there was no talk back, but doesn't realize there was no microphone at all until I set it up.  Probably a good investment for security for "after the event" crime reporting but for live monitoring or as a baby monitor, I need a microphone to capture audio from the source.
Nicely textured without feeling gummy. Excellent slim fit is perfect and adds very little bulk.

I've been searching everywhere to find a large, stiff brush that can clean the burnt on bits in my cast iron cookware.  This one takes it down really quickly and covers a large area.  The handle is comfy and helps me really dig in.
Agonizing decision until I noticed the free shipping.  I've been looking for the perfect piece for my giant, bare purple wall.  Now on to a 3'x3' piece that I can center on this piece.

This light works really well. Very bright, covers about a 30'x30' area with acceptable light and a 10'x10' area is very brightly lit. The motion sensor works well and the light shuts off very quickly after leaving the zone.

Purchased as a Comcast replacement to save $10/month.  Was this easy-peasy or what?  I'm stupified.  My speeds are at least the same as my brand new Comcast modem.  I plugged it in and logged it automatically connect me to the Comcast website where it had me enter my account info.  It then automatically registered with Comcast, updated the firmware, then was up and running.  About 15 minutes with my only actions being to physically connect it to my router and the wall; and then log in to my account on any web browser connected through my router.  I'm annoyed at myself for not doing this sooner.  Has been running like a champ since.My only complaint is that this thing has a ton of bright blue lights that are way too bright for a bedroom at night.  I wound up hiding it under my dresser.

Some interesting anecdotes, none of them really long enough to truly entertain. A whole chapter on  controlling one's sexual impulses? A few good points sprinkled throughout with the overriding theme of: don't tick people off if you want to keep your job. Overall, the book can be summed up with "be tactful, try to look at other's perspective, remember the big picture, be careful about timing, distance yourself from controversy by spreading responsibility for ideas."The most practical leadership book I've read was "turn the ship around".  This one felt half as useful.

This camera has a great picture day or night. It comes with a goose neck arm and clip which is really a stand out feature.Unfortunately, this thing craps out every five to twenty minutes. It goes offline and won't let you reconnect without a reset. Completely unreliable as a baby monitor. It even randomly locked out my password once. What good is a monitor that let's you watch your baby for five minutes, then locks you out?

This unit is awesome.  I can hot swap my box of old IDE drives, use them reliably as a drive on my system, or as removable storage.  No hassles with getting the drives in and out of cases, just lay them on my desk and plug this in to swap to them to access old garbage files I never bothered transferring.  If you have an old IDE drive you need to access or if you, like me, work on your computer illiterate friends' PC's, this can save a lot of hassles.

They fit.  The Dremel works again, although they don't seem to perform as good as new.  Hard to say if it's really jus tthat the Dremel is old or if the brushes are knock-offs.  The tool works, gets up to full speed again, allows variable speed like normal again, but just doesn't quite feel like it did before I needed to change the brushes.

This thing works great, has all of the best built-in wifi apps (including Amazon Prime Video), connects easily, and wound up looking just like a new unit.  It even had the protective film on it so it was glossy and scratch free.  Plays videos like a champ.  Remote controls my Samsung TV perfectly, including all advanced features, so my TV remote has been stored away.Interestingly, as a refurb, they went through the manual by hand and stamped out some things (like length of warranty and that it included batteries - the refurb omits the batteries).

Was really neat at first, maybe a little too bright.  The flat cable kinks too easily and, once it does, the cable konks out shortly after an no longer works.***UPDATE***  Dockem reached out to me and sent me a replacement, long after I would have expected any warranty coverage to apply.  They obviously stand by their products.  New one is working like a champ.  Had it at least a month now without a kink.  Will update if anything changes.  (BTW...I've owned several long charging cables ~10' and they have all stopped working within a year so far...I believe the USB standard is 6 or 8 feet and am pretty sure that 10' is beyond the normal length of a cable.  I will update on the longevity of this one)As for the product, it is pretty nifty to be able to plug your cable into your phone in the dark with this light.  I do wish it were dimmer.

This charger is a bit odd.  It charges four things at once at a good price but has a couple of quirks:The plug is oriented with the flat side of the charger which means it wants to fall out of your outlet all of the time.Two outlets are specifically for Apple and two for Android...most chargers these days auto-switch.  They will generally work, but not always depending on the device if you swap the ports.Solid build quality and good, steady power.  If only they had turned the outlet prongs 90, it wouldn't fall out of the outlet!

These have been really nice overall.  The ability to pack 6 oz homemade smoothies for my kids is great.  People marvel that I have these.  Why only three stars?  Well, here we go:1.  They are really tough to fill with 6 oz of smoothie without squeezing out an ounce when closing.  I am good at it now, but really had to learn my technique...my wife can't do it yet.  She can reliably get 5 oz in without a spill.2.  They are very hard to snap closed.  I found that I have to do a squeeze test every time to make sure that my smoothie doesn't leak out of the bottom into my fridge.3.  The caps are a bit flimsy and look like trash from the disposable ones.  The maids and in-laws have thrown away quite a few of the caps when they ran across them on the counter.4.  These can be really tough to clean.  Bits of pureed kale and strawberry seeds seem to find the hardest nook and/or cranny to wedge into at the top and my tiny brushes never seem to get them.  Tip:  Fill your pack halfway with water, seal, shake vigorously...this is the only way to reach some bits of fruit/veggies.Overall, I have a love/hate relationship with these.
