I do it all because I can't buy store-bought packs in this size and I know that mine are healthy.

I bought this for work since it fell under my petty cash limit.  I was expecting junk as I have a $200 Zojirushi (which this is a very close copy of, except for the quality parts) and it looked like it when I put it on the counter.  There's a big seams in the steel and everything...BUT...I have to say that this thing has performed like a champ!  Our whole office loves it and can't believe the price.  It's been in use since, what, September?  It shows no signs of wear, the scaling has been minimal, the pump is strong and fast.  It doesn't heat the water as fast as my Zojirushi, but, hey?  I could buy several of these for the same price...and...once it's hot, who cares?  We leave it on all day (which is what it's designed for) and always have our hot water at the ready.  Love this.  I will buy these for every office I move to as my employer transfers me around.  Get it!

The double sided tape on this was a little too weak.  Mine just fell off the wall one day.  Had to install with screws.  Fortunately, installation is a snap since you can drill and screw right through the front because of the dispenser opening.  This makes real installation a snap due to just being able to eyeball this and still have it mount straight!  The idea is great, and we love having this at home to tidy up the old box and bag we used to use to store grocery bags for our dog walks.  Why only three stars?  Well, the tape mentioned previously is one reason.  The other reason is that the bags tend to just bunch up at the top and not fill in the bottom dispensing area all that well.  It works fine until you develop any decent amount of bags when it starts bunching.  This is nice to have but, surely, a better shape would dispense the bags more easily.It's attractive and I'd buy it again.

This thing is heavy duty, but not totally.  It's thin enough to be very flexible and is for a single appliance.  An important bit of information that is not included in the listing is this:This is rated for 1250 Watts or 10 Amps.  This really should be listed here.  To let you know what that means, I've tested two devices with my Kill-A-Watt machine:A portable electric heater (1500Watt) with two settings:  When one low, uses 670 Watts and draws 6-8 Amps.  On high, it draws 1300 Watts and 11 Amps...cord didn't get warm during my short test, but remember that overloading is a fire hazard!1600 Watt hair dryer:  On low, used 700 Watts, 7 Amps, on high:  used 1375 Watts, 11.5 Amps.  Now, for a hair dryer, the short use didn't warm up the cord or outlet, but it's not rated for that level of use.Good cord but they really should put the specs on the listing!

This thing works better than any pest trap I have ever seen.  They really did build a better mousetrap.  Baited with peanut butter, caught the field mouse living in my garage with an hour.  No mess as you simply turn it upside down over the trash can and the mouse falls right out.  There is a little cleanup required as the two mice I've killed with this left some urine inside, but nothing a q-tip couldn't handle.

These are handy to have in cheap supply but they are a little too small and a little to prone to getting caught on things and popping off.  Hard to beat the price to quantity ratio, though.  I would buy again

I love this mouse. Small and inexpensive, yet this mouse feels good on the hand. Bluetooth picks up really quickly with my Yoga 2 windows tablet and the windows button on the side is very convenient: press it in to go home, swipe (yes, it's touch sensitive) up to go to your open  apps, swipe down to go to your next app. For this price, a must have for any Windows tablet.
Great value for great speed and reliability. Couldn't find a better price /performance ratio anywhere.

This thing makes great coffee fast. What more could you want the flavor is rich from this pressurized method. It is designed to make two-four shots of pseudo espresso which you then top up with hot water, Americano style. Rich, round flavor from most roasts. Coffee codes or much another than with drip or French press.

The solid brass looks great with a deep luster instead of a plated finish. Smooth operation. Most importantly, it is designed with a tension spring so you can use these in any direction without the bolt sliding back open. Easy to install but the screws are only about 3/4" long so they are plenty sturdy for small kids and pets but not anything larger without getting longer screws.

This does a great grind.  I just wish that the handle were a little less awkward,  since it takes some time to get a fine grind, you'll find it awkward to keep spinning that crank on the top while still keeping this grinder level so the beans don't spill out of the top over the three minutes it takes to get two shots of espresso ground up.  I wind up holding this with my thighs and one hand while spinning the crank which gets old.  This thing would earn five stars if the crank could somehow be canted off at an angle to make it less awkward. Otherwise, this thing is nice.

Set up was fairly simple.  Got it set up and running quickly.  Google Cloud Print worked well.  Suddenly, within a month, the printer stopped working over wifi, disappeared from the networks.  Couldn't get it back up after a whole day of trying (and I used to do this for a living). Works over USB still, but bought this for wifi and cloud print!!!  I suspect the wifi card went bad.  Don't know why.  Also, this thing draws a ton of power and causes the lights on the same circuit to flicker constantly...maybe related to whatever crapped out?  Maybe I got a bad one?  Maybe UPS dropped it?  Either way, I'm very disappointed.  Contacting Brother support to see about an exchange.  Will change if a replacement has no problems.UPDATE: After spending two days resetting and trying over, I got it to connect.  Not sure why the first several tries didn't work.  Very frustrating but it eventually did come back online.  A search of their support forums shows that several people had weird problems with its deep sleep mode knocking it offline.Next UPDATE:  The unit apparently defaults to a dynamic IP address (I learned this with a lot of searching online) which causes it to go offline all of the time.  If you can get this to stick to a single IP address, the offline issue goes away.  Apparently, Windows connects to this using some wireless printing standard that makes it jump all over the place so services like Google Cloud Print lose track of it and it needs to be reconnect and reregistered repeatedly.  I learned to log into the printer using a web browser to reconnect it to my services when I do this, but it is a real hassle.

This thing looks great and the cutouts are perfect and gorgeous.  This only problem I have with this is that the fit on the buttons (volume, power) is a little off...too easy to accidentally trip the power switch, a little too difficult to use the volume-up button.  It's not like it made the phone difficult to use, just the occasional look at the phone to make sure I'm pressing what I want (unlike some cases that are easier to use by feel).  Overall, a really nice case.  Nice matte finish that isn't sticky, glossy accents look great.UPDATE: After living with this case for a few weeks, I wanted to update my review.  I said that the buttons were a little off... they are not... they just really make it easy to accidentally push them.  The fit is great and it has worn well without blemish, but the side buttons are a little too hidden to use easily by feel and they really increase how easy it is to trip them.  Much less effort than without the case. I am constant turning off my screen by accident.  Overall, its what I like in a case: slim, protective, and good looking.  If the buttons were a little more firm, I'd give it five stars.

Mounted two 24" Viewsonic monitors on this...what a tight fit.  Barely got them side by side.  Great price, sturdy.  Just keep in mind that these will only work for a stationary mount.  You can't move the monitors around once you get them positioned with this bracket.  Very sturdy once tightened.  Very difficult to get set up with one person.  It's too hard to line up and tighten by yourself.These things mount in just about any position, but must be tightened to that position and then the monitors will not move.  If that works for you, this is highly recommended.  I put these at a common area workstation at my office.

Very secure attachment to the headrest.  Clever design.  Very easy to snug in any tablet and twist to any location.  I'd give it 5 stars except for one design flaw:  You mount the one bracket to the headrest - rock solid.  You mount the tablet in the other bracket - again, solid.  You then slide the tablet bracket into four small slots on the headrest bracket...these grooves are only about 5mm deep.  Any bump (like your kids might do) on the bottom half of the tablet knocks the tablet up and out of the grooves and it falls to the floor.  Annoying.  Works like a champ if it's not physically bumped.

This thing is brilliant.  Low price, small enough to hold a phone at a table, large enough to support my iPad 4.  Will work with any tablet.  Folds flat to fit in any pocket, purse, or briefcase.  I bought a few more after the first to tuck into door pockets and my wife's bags so that we can prop up a phone in a pinch to entertain the kids when we can't deal with them.  I keep one in my briefcase for my iPad and haven't been to a meeting yet where someone didn't ask me where to buy one.
My wife is very pleased that she can keep going on her phone into the wee hours from bed because of the length of this cord.  No problems at all, if a little garish with the bright color and all!

Poorly packaged...I had to get three before an unbroken one arrived.  Amazon was great replacing them, of course, but it was a hassle.  It works perfectly...everyone should have one in their home...no better way to enjoy butter on your bread (or anything else you need to spread it on).  I only give this three stars because, well, you get what you pay for.  It works perfectly but it looks cheap and the fit between the top and bottom is far from precise...reflection of the price.  Still a worthwhile purchase because:  who really needs to spend $50+ for a butter keeper when this one works well!

This thing is awesome.  I cannot rave enough about Zojirushi quality.  Works quickly, works every time, well made, thoughtful design.  If you drink a lot of tea, I can't recommend this enough.  Just buy it already!

I've had this almost a year now.  The sound fills the room.  It's really wonderful.  The pairing is simple (TIP:  to switch pairing from one phone to another, simply press the bluetooth button once, then connect from a second phone).  I've compared this side by side with the Soundlink (larger one) in my office and can't tell the difference.Update: The new Soundlink III does sound noticeably better than this, but hadn't come out yet when I bought this.  I compared it to version 1 when making my statement above
The quality is awesome.  Had it for about 6 months...withstands moisture and my toddler chewing on it all day and still looks brand new.  Easily worth $75 if purchased at a jeweler.
Super high quality.  No broken lights in my box.  This is fantastic.  Will buy more when I need more outdoor lighting.

For the price, it's hard to beat.  The chime is super-duper loud.  We have a 4,000 sf office space that we used this for.  It goes straight through our concrete and steel walls and works reliably.  The button is nice and big and simple.

This thing is well made and looks great.  The cable is long enough for the tallest of cases.  Both a plus and a minus is that the cable is nice and thick...the thickness makes it a little cumbersome to route through your case.  The thickness also makes it want to unplug from the motherboard since the cable is constantly trying to straighten itself out.
My daughter loves this.  It squeaks loudly enough, feels nice, and looks close enough to the TV bird that my daughter jumped for joy when she saw it.

Nice leather.  Gets tons of compliments.  Unfortunately, the thickness of the leather interferes with the DuoCamera setup.  I get frequent "Your second lens is blocked" warnings on my phone.  Overall, I can't complain.  It's a steal at this price, but be aware of the potential camera issue which blocks the DuoCamera effects from working.

I don't have an Apple Watch so I am not using this stand for the intended purpose, but I do use it for a similar purpose. I have a Fitbit Surge (a wrist worn activity tracker that is similar in size to a smart watch), a phone and a couple different sizes of tablet. This stand holds everything neatly while they charge. It is simple, attractive and functional. My desk looks a little neater thanks to this charging caddy.If you are like me and have a few gadgets you regularly charge (and if one of those devices is wrist worn), this is an attractive way to keep your desk tidy. The stand is able to hold my full sized iPad vertically (at a slight angle, so not exactly verticle but on it's side so it takes less space on my desk). It holds my phone, a watch, 2-3 tablets and 3 pens or stylis pens.I received this stand free to review. All opinions and experiences are my own.

This shoe rack is a useful space saver. It makes sense to keep shoes on a little shelf and this rack holds 20 pairs of shoes.The instructions are brief, but the diagrams look clear. I admit, I have not yet been able to assemble the rack. I will need to try again with a little help. The instructions say to press the rods into the little plastic cups with your fist or a mallet. I tried my fist -- ouch! I tried a rolling pin and it did not work. It seems like the little rods might be a little wide for the little "cups".I won't downgrade them more than a star for my lack of DIY skills. However, I have previously assembled a shoe tree similar to this that was all metal. However, it may require two people to get the correct angle.The frame is plastic. It is moderately firm -- not the weakest plastic but not the sturdiest either. I really was not sure whether it would survive hammering. But it did survive my rolling pin. The rods are metal. I have some concerns about the durability. But it is a shoe rack, how sturdy does it need to be?Finally, I looked at the retail price. I realized this is at least as expensive as the shoe rack I have. The one I have was easy to assemble and has lasted at least 5 years so far. I cannot really suggest this one over it. Sadly, I bought it in a shop and never saw the brand. The design is similar to this but all metal. I will use this show rack, but I am not sure I would buy it unless I wanted a white shoe rack to match my decor.Disclosure: I received this shoe rack to review, all opinions and experiences are my own. I will update if I find my opinion changes for better or worse.

I wanted to love this as I love coffee and I love cold brew coffee. The bottle is attractive and looks like it is good quality.However, in practice...I have made cold brew coffee in a normal French Press coffee pot and also in a mason jar (strained with a cheese cloth). Both of those methods yielded stronger coffee and they both worked faster. I grind my own beans, so maybe my grind isn't right for this bottle. The strainer is very fine and it took a couple days before my water looked like coffee. Sadly in that time, the bottle sprung a leak and leaked coffee all over the bottom shelf in my refrigerator. You see, the bottom of this bottle comes off. It has a rubber real, but this is how you fill the strainer or how you clean it (the bottle top is too small). After a couple days they seal started to loosen. The coffee did taste nice, but honestly, I probably will not use it again. (Okay one more time to see if it works better with practice).I really wanted to love this. But I think there are a few issues with the design.I received this cold brew coffee maker free to review. All opinions and experiences are my own. Still looking for the right cold brew system for me!

I like spinning workouts but find them very uncomfortable. I am just not built right for sitting on the cycles and always feel bruised for days after. These shorts help. The gel padding is plush and thick enough and has a cooling effect. I feel that the placement of the padding is a little off, there is a little too much padding towards the back. But I suspect that is different for different people.I feel the padding also looks a little funny. Not too bad, I wouldn't feel self-conscious cycling or in spin class, but I certainly would not wear them to a yoga class. But that is to be expected since they are padded. They look a little funnier than they need to since some of the padding is concentrated in the back. They are meant as undergarments and may be a little too sheer to wear as outwear shorts.I received these shorts free to review and all opinions and experiences expressed are my own.

​This mop system is useful and clever.I found it was easy to assemble. It came with a very short instruction sheet that included photographs.The buckets uses two spinning actions -- one to clean the mop and the other to dry it. While assembly was easy, I had a slight learning curve in learning to use the mop. Specifically in getting the spin action to work correctly. This was easily fixed, I just overlooked one detail in the instructions that prevented me from getting a straight angle when spin drying the mop. Once it worked, it was very much like a salad spinner.On the plus side: The kit includes 2 mop heads, a duster, and a scrub brush as well as the mop and bucket system. It is feature rich. The spinning action does remove the extra water from the mop. And it worked well on my floor. The mop head can be angled to clean different spaces.Any downsides? I feel the bucket is a little large for my apartment, but this would be a plus for those who live in larger houses. I also feel the mop head is a little flimsy. During my first use of the mop 3 strands fell off. I could see a head lasting about a month at this rate, maybe a little longer depending how clean it stays.Overall, I am pleased and impressed with this mop system.I received a complimentary mop to review. All opinions and experiences are my own.

This dual USB travel charger is useful at home and while traveling. As described, it can charge two devices at once. The outlet plug folds into the charger block for more compact travel. I used this while pet sitting as I wanted to do a little work on my devices and it worked wonderfully.It conveniently comes with a lightning USB, this is handy as I like to have one in each bag. My only issue is that it is a bit of a mini-wall brick. However, that isn't a deal breaker for me.All in all, I am satisfied with this dual USB travel charger from iClever.I received this travel charger free to review. All experiences​ and opinions expressed are my own.

I have been curious about a salad spinner, but hesitant to try one. I thought of them as a novelty one-trick pony type item that would take too much space in my small kitchen.I was partially right and partially wrong! In truth, this salad spinner from Brieftons works wonderfully. I use it to remove excess water from freshly washed salad leaves, herbs, kale and other vegetables. Yes, I use it for other vegetables too. I have used it almost daily since receiving this salad spinner.I find the lever and button system works well, however, this is the first salad spinner I have used.I was partially right as it does take a little extra space in my kitchen. But I am eating more fresh vegetables, so the trade-off seems worthwhile.I received a free Brieftons Salad Spinner to facilitate this review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

When I opened the package I expected to love this dispenser. The idea is great. It is a glass bottle with a shot glass dispenser at the top.In reality, it was a huge mess and disappointment. I could not get it to work. I think most likely something was wrong with mine, but I reached out to the company and received no response. Considering that I received a sample of this item to review, the fact they did not respond really does not make me trust their customer service for paying customers!Anyway, when I press the buttons there is a large air opening (between one and two inches) on each side (see on the diagram where the grey button it). Oil sometimes comes out. And no oil makes it to the shot glass. When I turn it upside down and press the button oil gushes out all over my kitchen counter. There seems to be no way to cleaning dispense oil into the little shot glass.I think most likely I received a faulty or damaged product. It happens. But usually if that happens the company offers to replace the item. This did not happen in my case. I could not exchange it as I received the item free to review. I tend to think if a company ignores their reviewers, they might do similar to their customers. So I guess buy at your own risk.If you receive one that works -- it is an attractive dispenser and it seems like it would be a nice way to control or measure the amount of oil you use. This would be a great cooking gadget for someone on a diet who likes to track or monitor their food consumption.I received a free Oil and Vinegar Dispenser to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This gift pack includes three lovely lotions from LeliaSea Cosmetics. I have previously reviewed a couple of them individually and as a set they make a delightful gift.All three are lightly scented and elegantly textured moisturizers. They are light enough to absorb easily without leaving an overly greasy feeling. The scent is similar (perhaps the same) between all three products so there is no scent clash.The formulation is also gentle on my semi-sensitive skin. Some lotions cause mild irritation, but this one does not.I received a sample of this spa gift basket to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I posted the following review on Audible. However, I thought I would also share it here since the content is available as a book and ebook..."Useful Introduction to LLC"Where does LLC QuickStart Guide: The Simplified Beginner's Guide to Limited Liability Companies rank among all the audiobooks you’ve listened to so far?I admit this audio book is not the most exciting. It provides a detailed overview of Limited Liability Companies including the pros and cons of forming one.I have listened to one other business related audio book from the same publisher and it is consistent in quality and level of detail.What was one of the most memorable moments of LLC QuickStart Guide: The Simplified Beginner's Guide to Limited Liability Companies?It was an eye-opening experience and full of information. I like that it covered the pros and cons of forming one and some other details useful for a new business person.What does Amy Barron Smolinski bring to the story that you wouldn’t experience if you just read the book?The narration was pleasant, clear and easy to understand. The narrator is excellent. I appreciate this book in audio form because it allows me to multitask and listen while doing busy-work type chores.Any additional comments?I am pleased with the information and content presented in this book. I have been curious about Limited Liability Companies (LLC) and this book answered my questions.I received a complimentary review copy to facilitate this review. All opinions expressed are my own.

This protein powder is delicious and blends well into my smoothies.I am not sure I like Stevia, and it is sweetened with Stevia. So I didn't give it 5 stars, but I know a lot of people love Stevia. However, despite that,  it is one of my favorite protein powders.I typically use protein powders to boost my smoothies and sometimes while cooking. I used this powder to make a vanilla coffee protein shake. I used cold brewed coffee (made the night before), 1 scoop of this protein, and about 4 ounces of Coconut/almond milk. I blended using my blender. The result was a thick shake that reminded me of a coffee milkshake without the sugar and as much fat (and it contained 25 grams of protein!). This is a nice treat, or a morning pre-workout pick-me-up. I drink coffee in the morning anyway and have difficulty exercising on am empty stomach. When in a hurry this shake works well, especially if I eat some fruit or vegetables after my workout.I received a sample of this protein powder to review. All opinions and experiences​ described are my own.

Sleep Soundly features beautiful guitar music that helps quiet my mind for sleep. I sometimes have trouble getting to sleep because my mind is racing with ideas, plans, reflections, memories. I am not sure why, but I have always resisted sleep in this way. Perhaps that is why I am more of a a night owl.I find that the right music always helps me wind down. Sleep Soundly is no exception. The album is obviously designed to aid relaxation and sleep. I find the guided meditation an especially powerful tool in reminding my mind that it is time for sleep. I also find the ocean sounds soothing and have always loved  the sound of guitar music.I received a review copy of Sleep Soundly for review purposes. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I work at home a fair amount between blogging, writing and some event planning I do. I also spend a lot of time on my laptop.I like to vary my work position to ensure I am not a complete computer potato. I spend some of the time sitting stretched out on the floor, some on a sofa, some standing at a counter and some at my desk.This foldable desk works well with my work style. I can use it to make my desk into a standing desk. I can also use it on the sofa or floor. I even used it last week while pet sitting. Since I did some of my work at someone else's home, I found this an easy way to set up my own temporary lap desk. My laptop tends to get hot lately, so I found that I appreciate the built in USB powered fan.I also find the desk easy to set up, collapse and store. Most of the parts are plastic so I am slightly concerned about long-term durability. However, for now, this desk is excellent.I received this lapdesk free to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

These Leather Gardening Gloves are adorable, durable and seem true to size. I ordered my normal size and they fit well.I originally thought I would use them for golf as that is one of the uses mentioned. My hands get cold in the cooler months and thought I would like to wear gloves on both hands. While the appearance is sporty, I feel the leather on the palm is too thick for that use. If they were sold as golf gloves I would give them 3 stars. However, they are described as gardening gloves.I have used them for workouts as well. Mainly for kettlebell and weights. I have some workout gloves that I generally prefer, except the set of weights I own is very rough on my soft hands. This pair does solve that issue. Normally I prefer fingerless gloves for workouts to maintain grip, but the exception is when I use the weights I have at home due to the rough texture of the handles. If you have a similar set of weights, you might like more protective gloves like these. Otherwise, I would leave them to gardening and work where your hands need protection.Finally as work and gardening gloves. These gloves are cute and protective. I usually lose some sense of coordination and flexibility with work gloves. These are not bad as far as work gloves go. The glove fits well and is flexible.I received a free pair of these gloves to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I have used a basic basal thermometer for a while and this is definitely an improvement.I like that the display is a little larger than a typical thermometer. This thermometer allows me to program a date and time. Both of these features make it easier to track and record my daily readings.The backlit display is also useful since I take my temperature first thing in the morning in a dark room.Overall I am pleased with this thermometer. The readings seem similar to my previous thermometer so I have no concerns about the accuracy. My understanding is the thermometer has an alarm clock. I think that is a nice feature, but I haven't figured out how to get it to work. It could be that I am not hearing the beep. I am still pleased with this thermometer as that is more of a nice to have not need to have function. However, it can be useful in staying consistent for more accurate readings.I received this complimentary thermometer for review purposes. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This Vanilla Bean powder is amazing. I love vanilla. Not all vanilla, some cheap vanilla is just sweet but lacks flavor (it's okay but is obviously the reason people use the term "vanilla" to describe "duller" tastes). I tend to prefer items containing a pure vanilla extract or an infusion from vanilla beans. There is a huge difference! I feel that good vanilla is equal to good chocolate. Of course, it is all just personal preference.  That is why I was eager to try a vanilla bean powder.So far, I have enjoyed this powder in smoothies and in coffee drinks. I have not yet baked with it. In coffee, I have had two ways -- I added it to brewed coffee or I have added it to coffee grounds during the brewing process. Either way works. I usually add it just because the other person who drinks the coffee does not like flavored coffees. Though I personally prefer adding it during the brewing process because the vanilla powder does not fully dissolve (it is kind of like cinnamon or powdered ginger in that way).In coffee, it adds a rich vanilla scent, smooths the flavor so it seems less bitter, but does not add much sweetness (unless you also add sugar or sweetener). I associate the taste and smell of vanilla with a sweet flavor, but it is nice and different to enjoy unsweetened vanilla coffee.I also add it to fruit smoothies or Greek yogurt with fruit. In this case the vanilla is sweetened by the fruit sugars and is more similar to the flavor I am accustomed to. This powder blends really well with banana's for a sweet treat without guilt. (I know some people avoid fruit due to the sugar, but I do eat fruit daily).The powder is very fine in texture. On problem I have is that sometimes if someone opens the bag too quickly some floats out and I have a small mess to clean. This happens a little more than I would expect because people want to smell the contents of the bag. Other than that, I am impressed with the vanilla powder and expect to purchase more when I run out.I received a free sample of Sunny Day organics Vanilla Bean Powder for review. All opinions described are my own.

I found these storage boxes easy to assemble, attractive and they seem fairly sturdy. I think they are great for a variety of purposes such as containing cosmetics, bottles, craft items, small electronic gadgets, and more.They seem to be made of cloth covered cardboard. The bottom is a thin fabric until you insert the base square. I wouldn't recommend this for super heavy-duty use. But once assembled, it is a decent and attractive storage option.I used mine for small computer, phone and electronics accessories. I was able o fit my Cocoon GRID-IT! Organizer Case, Blue (CPG7BL) inside to keep my cables and chargers tidy. I put other electronics accessories inside the box. My very messy desk area is a lot neater now! I think a couple sets would be wonderful for closet organization too.The only things I wish were different -- I would love lid and for the material to be just a little more sturdy. In truth, it is just as I hoped and expected. I knew it didn't have a lid, just in hindsight it would allow stacking. And the material is durable enough given the purpose and price range.I like that these boxes fold completely flat for storage. I may be folding-challenged in that often items that advertise as foldable are not easily folded (by me). These boxes are easy to fold. As someone who lives in an apartment, I value items that are easy to sto​re in a closet. And I like that these offer either temporary or long-term storage options.I received these foldable storage boxes for free to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I just love this microphone because I sometimes use my iPhone or iPad to make videos. The built-in sound is not quite good enough. I needed a microphone that would enhance my voiceovers or narration without picking up too much background noise. I feel this microphone does the job well (for my purposes anyway).With the included adapter, it was pretty much plug and play! I am reasonably good at getting my personal tech to work, but it is nice not to have to spend extra time getting something to work.Sometimes the cushioned microphone cover slips off. When that happens the mic picks up extra sound from my breathing or any wind. However, I am satisfied when the cover is on the mic. I had recorded a test using the audio notes app on my iPhone and this mic definitely was an improvement over the built-in mic. I will duplicate the in the near future for a video example and upload it to this review when I get a chance.I think this microphone is great for hobbyists like me who need to improve their i-device sound for video recordings (or for audio recordings), but also need an affordable option. The only downside (other than the mic cover issue) is that you cannot hear what you record without headphones. This isn't a big issue for me, but maybe for some of the pros and podcasters. I also reviewed another USB microphone that I think gives slightly better sound, however that other mic is at a higher price point, is not as easily adapted to a phone and is larger and less convenient. There are always trade-offs. I like and will continue to use both -- this microphone I will use when recording with my phone.I love the lavalier design as it clips nicely in place.I received a free iPro-Max Microphone for review. All experiences and opinions are my own.

These flameless LED candles provide tranquil, soothing lighting. They are controlled with a remote control that offers a choice of about a dozen colors and a few modes including one that cycles through all the colors. Overall, I am pleased with the color options and mood provided by these LED candles.These are my second LED Wax candles. The first I used and reviewed is very real looking. These are not as authentic looking, but they are still a lovely lighting feature. I am happy with them and feel they are a good value.I do have one issue and that is the battery power. Each candle requires 3 AAA batteries. (Not included, be sure you have 9 AAA batteries on hand). Sadly, the first set of batteries (Amazon basics) only lasted less than 2 weeks before the candles started blinking abruptly (not soothing at all as it is a fast blink like an emergency signal). I thought something was wrong and emailed the company, but received no response at all. I decided to change the candles and that fixed it. I was running the candles for about 2-3 hours in the evening starting at dinner time for about 7-9 nights before this happened. The battery life seems poor. And the company was unresponsive to my question. I took a star off for those two issues.I received this set of LED wax candles free in exchange for an honest review. All experiences and opinions described are my own.

I am writing this as I am only half way through constructing this closet. I am not optimistic that my finished closet will look like the item in the picture. In fact, I have big concerns whether the shelves with be sturdy enough to hold my clothing.I seem to be missing pieces, the instructions are simply a diagram with minimal details and the shelves sag (they are longer than the space between bars). I must have done something wrong. But here I am 30  minutes later and with a terrible headache and a half constructed cheap looking closet.I will update this review if it turns out better than expected. Right now I regret committing to review this closet. The shelves are made of a cloth that is this and seems more like paper.I received this closet free to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This is a simple device that is designed to help your golf swing. It simulates a golf club. The shaft is flexible, and there is a small weight at the end. It has a slightly off balance weight like a club, and it feels very much like one. The difference is the shaft is slightly flexible, and there is no club head. This allows you to practice your golf swing at home with less fear of hitting objects.I like to practice a few minutes here and there, and I also like to practice a little during commercials. I also do a little practice during my workout warmups. So far, so good...I am a beginner level golfer. I have had a few lessons and I play every week or two when time and weather allow.  The course I most often use does not have a driving range, so any pre-game practice is putting and chipping. I found that my longer distance swing has improved a lot. I was a little surprised and it may be beginners luck. I believe the swing trainer is helping me better get the feel and motion of a swing into my muscle memory.All and all, I am happy with the swing trainer. I do think it is more of a nice to have than a need to have. But if you would like a training tool to help you develop your golf swing, this may be a great option for you!I received a free golf swing trainer to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This toner has a lovely orange scent that I find invigorating. I like this toner despite the facts that a lot of toners irritate my semi-sensitive combination skin and I typically do not prefer scented facial products.I don't find this toner irritating to my skin. I feel a warming sensation if I use it too soon after exfoliation (I prefer a gentle floral water as a toner in that case). Otherwise, it is just invigorating.I like the spray bottle as it helps apply just the right amount and it feel nice. I am using the entire Azure Naturals Ultimate C product line and like how the products coordinate together.Disclosure: I received a free sample for review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This is a freshly scented gentle gel cleanser. It works well to remove my makeup at the end of the day.I appreciate this entire vitamin C product line from Azure Naturals. I have had good results with the vitamin C serum and look forward to seeing whether the other products in this line will improve on those results.I really like the packaging of this and other Azure Naturals products. I know it is about more than the packaging, but for skin care products the packaging makes a difference. This cleanser comes in a light spray bottle and one pump provides just enough gel cleanser.I enjoy the sweet orange scent. It is light and not overpowering. I normally do not prefer scented facial skin care products even though I do like the scent of this one.All in all, I like this cleanser and would recommend it.I received a free product for review, all opinions and experiences described are my own.

2:54 MinsThis device is very handy to have for travel, camping or short term emergencies. This UV water purifier also doubles as an emergency LED lantern. It charges through an USB cable (included). I mention it is suitable for short term emergencies because it needs to be kept charged.The purifier is easy to use and only takes 90 seconds. You simply fill the water bottle, turn on the purifier and agitate the water.The BPA-free water bottle is a good size for one or two people to drink water. The bottle came with two lids. One lid contains the light and the other is a simple top. I do with the simple lid came with a pouring spout as it is a little less convenient to remove the lid to serve water. It isn't a big deal, just a small inconvenience.I received this water purifier at a discounted rate to review. All opinions are my own.

This set is attractive, neutral and functional. The organizer holds all our removes and mini tablet with style. Why is it that we have so many remotes? (I know a first world problem).The tissue box is a little big especially since I am not a big tissue user. However, the size turned into an advantage. I am able to neatly tuck some Amazon Basics batteries and charging cords in the bottom under the tissue.Thanks to this set, our coffee table and living room look a little tidier!I received this set at a promotional discount in order to review it. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

There are so many uses for aloe vera, it is handy to have aloe vera gel on hand. I use this aloe vera gel to treat a recovering scar and also in my homemade shaving oil. I find it very soothing to my skin and it is easy to use and apply.I sometimes make simple personal care and beauty products for my own use. Aloe Vera is a useful ingredient as it is soothing to the skin.  This isn't a pure aloe vera gel, it also contains some vitamin C (as a preservative) and a natural thickener for ease of application. It may contain a couple other ingredients, but it is mostly organic aloe vera gel (they say 99.75%).I even tried a little as a hair gel. I read some use aloe vera gel as a natural hair gel. I am happy with my existing products but decided to try since I received this gel for review. I used a little aloe gel with a little argan oil (mixed in my palm). It seems like a very light gel that made my slightly frizzy (chlorine damaged) hair seem smooth and shiny looking. I don't think it has much holding power for serious styling, but may be a nice natural alternative for a little hair taming.I received a sample of La Lune Naturals aloe Vera Gel for review. All experiences and opinions describe are my own.

I find this style of garlic and ginger grater easier to use for ginger than a press. It is also easier to clean than a press. It doesn't mince garlic as finely as my press, but I like a lot of garlic so it isn't a problem for me.I found this tool easy to use and easy to clean. It also seems very durable (it is made of stainless steel). I am impressed with the functionality and simplicity. I like that it can be used both the grate and to mince garlic and ginger. In the winter I like to make ginger infused "tea", this will make it much easier to make the tea!I received this ginger and garlic press and grater for free to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I usually prefer fresh garlic. However, for convenience I like to keep some powdered garlic on hand in case I run out or for some recipes where powdered is easier.I have used this garlic powder to season popcorn, kale chips, and in cauliflower pizza crust. It has a nice taste, not quite as intense as fresh cloves but still strong. I really like using this garlic to season popcorn and kale chips, I think the dehydrated form works better for these snacks.I also have the dehydrated ginger from Vedica and it is also nice to have on hand when I don't have fresh ginger.I received a free sample of Vedica organic garlic for review. All experiences and opinions described are my own.

I usually prefer fresh ginger when I cook or make water infusions. However, for convenience I like to keep some powdered ginger on hand. This ginger has a nice strong ginger flavor. Sometimes powdered ginger doesn't have the same flavor. This one is pretty good (not as intense as fresh, but more than some other powdered gingers that I tried).I also have the dehydrated garlic from Vedica and it is also nice! Sometimes the powdered version works better in certain recipes, but I mostly keep it on hand for convenience if I run out of the fresh ginger. I appreciate the taste and quality and I like that it is organic. I have used it in sauces for stir fry and in smoothies so far.I received a free sample of Vedica organic Ginger for review. All experiences and opinions described are my own.

This set comes with 3 bars of soap. The soap is attractive and presented well in an organza bag. I mention this because they make a lovely gift.Each is individually wrapped. They smell amazing. I like elegant soaps. I am using one of the bars and find it moisturizing and pleasant to use. I like starting the day using a lovely soap in the shower. Some harsh soaps dry my skin too much, but I haven't had that experience with the Safron Dream soap from this set. The soap appears very nice quality. I have used other Sublime Beauty products and so far they have all been quality.  I am also using the lotus Simplicity as a hand soap and it is also lovely. I like soaps that contain shea butter as they tent to be less drying to the skin.I expect the other bars of soap to be wonderful, I will update if I learn otherwise. I find that a bar of soap this size typically lasts a couple of months if I keep it in a draining soap dish.So far, I highly recommend this set based on my experience with this brand, the presentation of the items, the ingredient list and my experience using the two of the three bars.I received this soap set for free to review, all opinions and experiences described are my own.

I am an argan oil lover. I review a fair few argan oil products and the oil itself. My hair is also long, fine, dry and damaged. It gets damaged from chlorine and since it is fine, the ends are easily damaged.  Oh I also heat style with blow dryers, hot irons and curling irons (occasionally). Since I have only used the Tru moroccan conditioner alongside the Tru Moroccan shampoo, this is pretty much the same review as I posted for the shampoo.There are a few things that help my hair -- regular hair cuts, gentle conditioning shampoo and conditioner, occasional clarifying shampoo. This shampoo is moisturizing and wonderful for my hair. I am due for a hair cut and swimming twice a week so my hair really needs the TLC. It actually feels softer and looks shinier after I use this shampoo and the coordinating conditioner. I am sure it will look better still after my ends are trimmed.  Oh, I also color treat my hair. The coloring product I use does make my hair look healthier and shinier but it is still hair color. It doesn't seem to strip my hair color, but I am not sure I could tell since I only go a shade brighter than my natural color.I also like the scent and texture. The only thing I would change is that I would prefer larger bottles!I received a free sample of Tru Moroccan shampoo for an honest review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I do my laundry in a shared facility in my apartment building. So it is hard for me to test whether these dryer balls shorten drying time since I always have to enter a certain minimum dry time to even use the machines. However, when I do a load of towels and cotton items my clothes do not get completely dry  within the minimum time. With these dryer balls, my towels do get completely dry. So I do believe that these wool dryer balls can improve the efficiency of a dryer and save a little energy.I was impressed with how soft and fluffy my towels were. Since they were mostly cotton, static was not much of an issue. However, I feel my workout clothing have less static when I use these dryer balls. I do not use dryer sheets for a variety of reasons. Some irritate my skin, I feel the extra chemicals are unnecessary for me, and that is one thing I don't want to spend money on (I am a little cheap when it comes to household and cleaning supplies). I like these dryer balls on all levels so far--energy saving, they seem to work, easy on my skin, no added chemicals, re-usable!I received a free sample for review, all opinions and experiences described are my own.

I like to carry a stylus / pen with me as I like writing notes, but I also like having them digitized and on the cloud. I am an Evernote addict and often use my tablet as a notebook. So I prefer that my pen is also a stylus. This pen/stylus is compact, sleek and attractive. It is surprisingly heavy for the size and is decorated with a little crystal.I personally prefer a slightly bigger pen just because it feels better in my hand. However, the size of this pen is nice to keep in my small cross body purse. The stylus nib feels a little coarser than I am use to. I am not sure whether that is a pro or a con as so far it works fine. My pen/stylus came in an attractive box which makes it a nice inexpensive gift.Overall, I am please with this stylus and may buy a second to keep in my laptop bag.I received a free silver stylus pen for review. All opinions and experiences are my own.

So far I love everything about this baking dish. It is attractive and stylish. It has a simple, striking design on the bottom of the dish and on the handle. This dish also seems durable. And it is made in the USA! I buy and use plenty of products that were manufactured abroad, but I do keep an eye out for made-in-the-USA products.I wish I had a smaller version of the same. This dish bakes about 6-8 servings of casserole. It is wonderful to have on-hand. I did a little research on Consumer Reports and it sounds like borosiliate glass is usually more shatterproof and durable than the glass more commonly used in glass bake ware. I have not personally verified this, but I typically find Consumer Reports a good source of information.I received a free baking dish in exchange for an honest review. All experiences and opinions expressed are my own.

Using this band, I was able to do pull ups for the first time ever. I reviewed a different, lighter-resistance band but I really needed a little more assistance and this band is perfect for me now.It is easy to use the Bold Tribe Pull Up Band. I took mine to a park playground and was able to figure it out right away. You simply loop the band on your pull up bar then step into it (or kneel into it). The resistance of the band supports some of your body weight to make it easier to do a pull up. I like this because other exercises can train the muscles, but it really helps to practice technique. I have heard being able to do pull ups is partially about using the right technique and partially about strength and coordination. I found that to be the case with push ups. I recently built up enough strength to do on toes push ups for the first time in my life. I find with compound body weight exercises part of the challenge is getting various muscle groups to work together and hold form. Good form makes it easier, but it takes practice and conditioning. I think this band will help a lot with developing my ability to do pull ups!I received a free Bold Tribe band for review. All experiences and opinions described are my own.

These socks from Fuego are comfortable and supportive. I have a white pair and a black pair.I wore the black socks on a day when I was on my feet all day for work. I walked miles wearing them. My feet felt comfortable and were fine at the end of the day. It was a hot day and I had to wear enclosed shoes. I was surprised that my feet smelled fresh at the end of the day. I was a little skeptical of whether the silver content would make a difference in decreasing foot odor, but so far it seems to work.I am usually more of a barefoot person, but these socks are great for days when I have to wear shoes and for workouts.I find them form-fitting without being too tight and supportive. The thicker, soft sole provides a little padding when pounding the pavement. I typically like socks that are right and left foot specific as I find they hug my feet a little better. I hate I when my socks shift around and bunch up within my shoes. These socks do not do this!I have only worn the white pair during workouts with trainers. I haven't worn them for as long as the black so I didn't challenge the deodorizing properties in the white socks. I do find them very comfortable during workouts.All in all, I am very happy with these socks. I have a black pair and a white pair and may get another pair of each in the future.**I received a free pair of these athletic socks to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This is the best spray bottle I have used so far. I like to make home made bath, beauty, personal care and sometimes cleaning products. (By home made cleaning products I mean mixing vinegar, water and a little essential oil or other very simple classic combinations). I have a few plastic bottles that I use for my cleaning supplies and tat is fine. They are designated for the purpose.I use this glass bottle more for personal care/beauty items. I like that it is glass so it is easier to clean than plastic and doesn't retain scent from the strongly scented oils I sometimes use. Also, since it is a dark amber color it prevents light from breaking down the ingredients. The bottle also contains a mini-strainer to keep the nozzle from getting clogged up. The sprayer is adjustable and so far works perfectly.Any downside? Well, it is glass (both a plus and minus). Since it is glass, I have to be a little careful where and how I use it. Right now I have a homemade shaving oil in it and I use it in the shower when I shave my legs. Glass bottles, oil, water and small shower shelves -- uh, scary combination! I have to be careful.I received a free Emmi's Essential bottle for review purposes, all opinions and experiences described are my own. If budget allowed, I would buy a bunch more to replace  all my plastic spray bottles. Well, no, I would keep a couple plastic mainly because plastic isn't breakable (for things like washing windows).

I like to burn candles, but there are some places it would be nice to have candle light without concern over safety.I have been intrigued by the new LED wax candles. I once received a plastic LED candle as a present and it works fine in a lantern but looks very fake. Not this one! I am surprised at how real this looks. I was even scolded for having a lit candle so close to the houseplants on the window sill!The fake "flame" is a thin flat metallic flame shaped bit (technical term!). Up close it looks fake, but it does sway with bits of air. When the light is on the effect looks like a flickering, gently swaying flame. It is quite clever! In pictures and on video it looks real unless you zoom in really close from above.This electric candle is perfect to add atmosphere , soft light and decoration in areas where you do not want to use actual candles. I am impressed with how real and elegant this candle looks.Any downsides: Maybe the price (it may seem expensive compared to candles, but it should last much longer!). Also,  the candle does not come with batteries and used a size I don't keep on hand. This wasn't a big deal, I just ordered a set of Amazon Basics batteries.**Disclosure: I received a free sample of this LED candle to test and review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I enjoy trying different skin care products especially if they contain ingredients that are kind to my semi-sensitive skin. I have had good experiences with Azure Naturals so I was excited to try their Ocean Mineral line.This is a nice moisturizing cream with mostly natural ingredients. I find it has a nice rich texture and absorbs easily.I like the scent of the Ocean Minerals line, though I actually prefer unscented facial skin care products. My main reason is that scented products are a common, unnecessary irritant. However, since I find this product gentle and moisturizing I give it a pass. Of course, everyone's skin is different.I am impressed with this moisturizing lotion. My face feel lovely, soft and smooth after using it.I received a free sample to test and review. My opinions and experiences are my own. I have reviewed other Azure Naturals products and have also purchased some, but I have no other connection with the company.

I enjoy trying different skin care products especially if they contain ingredients that are kind to my semi-sensitive skin. I have had good experiences with Azure Naturals so I was excited to try their Ocean Mineral line.I enjoy facial masks and find them strangely satisfying and relaxing. This mask is very hydrating and moisturizing. I imagine it is nice for semi-dry skin and may not be as good for very oily skin. I enjoy trying different skin care products especially if they contain ingredients that are kind to my semi-sensitive skin. I have had good experiences with Azure Naturals so I was excited to try their Ocean Mineral line.I have mixed experiences with toners. Many irritate or burn my skin. I have not had any issues with this toner. I find it invigorating and soothing.I like the scent of the Ocean Minerals line, though I actually prefer unscented facial skin care products. My feet felt comfortable and were fine at the end of the day. It was a hot day and I had to wear enclosed shoes. I was surprised that my feet smelled fresh at the end of the day. I was a little skeptical of whether the silver content would make a difference in decreasing foot odor, but so far it seems to work.I am usually more of a barefoot person, but these socks are great for days when I have to wear shoes and for workouts.I find them form-fitting without being too tight and supportive. The thicker, soft sole provides a little padding when pounding the pavement. I typically like socks that are right and left foot specific as I find they hug my feet a little better. I hate I when my socks shift around and bunch up within my shoes. These socks do not do this!All in all, I am very happy with these socks. I knew the second that I opened the bag that I would love Purple Tractor Coffee! The aroma revealed a warm, rich tasting coffee.I enjoyed Purple Tractor as did everyone I shared it with. Flavor preference is so subjective. I typically like stronger flavored coffees. I usually do not like bitter flavors, but for some reason I don’t mind certain bitter flavors such as dark chocolate, olives or a nice cup of coffee. To me, Purple Tractor was well-balanced and not quite as bitter as some stronger coffees. It is labelled as a medium roast so this isn’t entirely surprising. I did find the beans look a little darker than some medium roast coffees and even darker than a few “dark roasts” I have tried!Yes, you shouldn’t judge “a book by the cover”, but I like the labeling on Purple Tractor. They identify the source of the beans, provide nutrition information (the information is pretty typical for coffee, but this is among the first I have seen printed on the packaging), and it lists the roast date. Sometimes I look for this information about other coffee and don’t easily find it. Kudos to Purple Tractor!I prepared this coffee in my French Press and also in my Moka pot and it worked well with either method. I didn’t try cold brewing The Purple Tractor.  I wish I had as the smooth flavor seems like it would cold brew beautifully.I found these beans fairly oily. I typically like moderately oily beans, though I know some prefer drier beans so I just thought I would mention this.I recommend The Purple Tractor “On The Move” blend whole bean coffee. At this point, it is probably my new favorite medium-roast coffee (based on the bag I received).**I received a free sample of The Purple Tractor's On The Move Coffee for review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.**

I have another pair of in-ear headphones that I love, but the DH keeps taking them. So I needed another pair for myself. These work perfectly for my purposes so far.I have used these earphones to listen to spoken word narration, television programming, and music on 4 different devices.  So I have used them in a variety of situations over the past few weeks.I really prefer the sound of these headphones over my Bluetooth headphones. Don’t get me wrong, I love the convenience of my Bluetooth speakers and headphones. I just find the sound smoother and more immersive with the wired in-ear headphones. So these are the earphones I am most likely to reach for when relaxing.The Audiosharp earphones very comfortable, the set came with 2 replacement ear buds in different sizes.The set also included a velcro cable “tie” to help keep the wires from getting tangled.  It also comes with an attractive little storage case. I like how easy it is to neatly keep these earphones in my bag.The cord is very flexible and rubberized. This is my first set of earphones with this style of cord. I don’t have an opinion about this type of cord, but I just thought I would mention it.Audiosharp’s in-ear headphones also features a built-in microphone with simple controls. I tested the microphone on a voice memo and it did sound better than using the built in microphone. It is certainly a handy feature if you need to make or take a telephone call! There is also a little mute red  button which comes in handy.My Conclusion: The Audiosharp in-ear headphones has a nice sound during sedentary and lightly active activities (I would not recommend them for running or vigorous activity). They are comfortable and easy to keep tidy with the included case and cable tie.  These earphones are my new carry-on bag, travel essential.I received a free pair of these earphones to test and review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This coffee is medium mild and reminds me a little of Folgers or other drip coffee that was my first exposure to coffee. I like it, but it really isn't my favorite. I prefer a darker, richer, more full bodied coffee. However, my mom really liked this coffee so it is a matter of personal preference.I tried three types of coffee from CoffeeCrazy. My favorite was the Espresso, followed by the French Roast followed by the Colombian. I do like that it is organic and fair-trade.This is a highly drinkable coffee, just not one that I am that excited about. However, if you like a medium coffee, maybe you will be excited about it.I received a free sample of this coffee to taste and review. All opinions described are my own.

I really like the coffee I made from these beans. I have brewed it in my French press, Moka pot and cold brewed it.Sadly, the beans are not as dark nor as oily as other espresso beans I have used. I would describe this as a medium roast, medium bodied coffee. I still like it, though would prefer it to be a little stronger or fresher. It is really nice in iced lattes though. The cold brewed coffee is really smooth and not bitter -- though I don't object to a hint of bitterness in espresso!I like that it is fair-trade, organic and non-GMO. I have tried this and two other varieties of coffee from CoffeeCrazy. This is probably my favorite of the three.I received a free sample of this coffee to taste and review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I am a big coffee lover. I usually prefer strong, dark roasted coffee. French Roast is typically one of my favorites.This whole bean coffee smelled amazing from the moment I opened it. However the first time I made it in my French Press is was very weak compared to other French Roast Coffees. I ground it to the normal level and used the normal quantity (1 coffee scoop per cup). To get the desired intensity, I had to grind it a little finer than usual for the French Press and use a little more. Then it made delicious coffee, but I went through the 12 ounce bag rather quickly. I am sure my issue is likely a matter of personal preference.Since then I have tried a couple other CoffeeCrazy whole bean coffees. Overall, I am highly impressed with this  line especially the Espresso Roast (review coming!). The French Roast is my second favorite of the three varieties available from CoffeeCrazy. I recommend it for people who like French Roast that is a little milder. I have used three methods to prepare this coffee: Mokka pot, French press and cold brew. My main issue was with the French Press method, but I used a finer grind for all three methods of brewing. I especially like that this coffee is both fair trade and organic!I received a free sample of this product to review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

This essential oil is a good value for money as it comes in a 4 ounce bottle. The scent is clear and pleasant, but potent so only a small amount is required for most uses. I expect this bottle to last a while even with frequent use.I have used this essential oil to make some DIY bath and personal care products. I have made a sugar scrub and also some shaving oil. I have also used it in a diffuser. The scent seems purely lavender. I am pleased with the quality in the items I have made as well.I am very happy with this essential oil.I received a free sample of this essential oil for review.

I recently upgraded from an iPhone 4s to an iPhone 6. After investing in the phone with decent memory storage, I wanted to protect my investment. I have been able to use my 4s for years by keeping it in a case and using a screen protector, so I know these things do pay off over time.After installing this tampered glass screen protector, I feel like I upgraded my screen protection along with the phone. The protector is smooth and feels wonderful to my fingers while using the touch screen.I was a little worries that it might look too blue. But I only saw the slight blue tint when I held the protector up to a light at an angle (before applying it). According to Gshine, this protector not only protects the phone's screen, but it helps protect the eyes from blue light from your phone's monitor. I wanted blue light protection as I understand it is a little easier and less tiring to the eyes over time. I am not sure how true these claims are as I have only used the protector for a few days.However, I do know that my phone looks nice, I barely notice the protector. As mentioned it also feels nice to the touch and the screen is still very responsive. My phone fits well within my case. And best of all, I know that my screen is somewhat protected against scratches. Overall, I am very pleased with this screen protector and will probably buy another if I need to. (Touching wood that I won't). I attached some pictures I took of my unboxing and also my phone with this screen protector installed.I highly recommend this screen protector. I notice from the other reviews that some refer to anti-spy protectors, I do not have the anti-spy. My review refers to the plain, anti-blue light protector. If I later find the protector is not as durable as I would expect, I will update. But so far I could not be happier with this product.I received this screen protector for free from the seller to test and review. All experiences described and opinions are my own.

I was surprised by the delicious berry taste of these gummy vitamins. I do like gummy candies but do not eat them very often. The taste was just as good as I remember gummy candies to have. I think this vitamin supplement would be great for someone who wants a reasonably priced multi-vitamin but does not like to swallow pills.I am not qualified to evaluate the nutritional content, I do personally take a multi-vitamin though and this is pleasant to take.I received a free  sample of Nutrition Now Women's Gummy Vitamins through Smiley360 sampling program to sample and review. My opinions expressed are 100% my own.

Sluggo's BBQ Sauce is sweet and tangy. I like the flavor, though it is just a little sweeter than I prefer. It was a hit with others in my household so I think that is really just a matter of personal preference. I added a little hot sauce to balance the flavor a bit. I could definitely identify the vinegar, brown sugar and tomato in this sauce and thought I tasted Worcestershire sauce. When I checked the ingredients all of those were among the listed ingredients. It is quite sweet though, so may be a great choice if you like sweet sauces.I received a sample of Sluggo's at a discount to test and review. All opinions expressed are my own.

I received a free sample of three new Bumble Bee Tuna flavors: Chipotle Peppers, Jalapeños, Sundried Tomatoes and Olive Oil, Bumble Bee Prime Fillet Gourmet Flavors.All three contained nice chunky tuna ( a little more flaky than some) that were packed in olive oil along with the seasoning. I used them to make over classic canned tuna recipes. I admit, I eat ahi often, but have not been eating canned tuna as much recently. I was impressed.I used the Jalapeños tuna to make a nice Tuna Casserole (I also used fresh cilantro, and whole wheat pasta and substituted much of the pasta with sliced zucchini. I used the sundried tomato I used lemon, dill aioli with pine nuts, pickles and capers. I used the Chiplotle to make fish tacos.I recommend that you check out these new varieties if you like canned tuna.I received a free sample of each to review but no other compensation (as always with amazon reviews). #sponsored

I use a lot of hot sauce. Some taste a little too much of vinegar for my preference. This hot sauce does not, it has a bit of tang but the flavor is nicely balanced. It has a nice amount of kick to it, but is not too hot. I would describe it as medium hot, but the intensity can build. Some in my household like very hot sauce and some prefer a milder intensity. I am in the middle, I like to feel the heat without feeling uncomfortable. I think this sauce is just right for my preferences.The packaging is cute too. I think the "I's Hot" label is fun.I received a free sample to taste and review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

Self-massage and Myofascial Release are important parts of my fitness routine. I typically use a foam roller, a massage stick and massage balls. I like having different options for different purposes. I like to use balls to massage smaller muscles and my feet.These massage balls have a rubber texture that grips the skin just enough. They are just the right size for the intended purpose. I should note they are rather firm. I have another set (different brand) that are softer. I think the firmness can be a pro or a con depending on your sensitivity. This type of massage does hurt a little especially when you are new to it. It gets better if you stay consistent, but beginners might want softer balls (depending on the area).I like to incorporate foam rolling and massage into my workout warmups. When I do this, I find I am more flexible and don't seem to get as bad of sore muscles.I am pleased with this set of Massage Lacrosse Balls. I especially like to use them for my feet and shoulders. The set of three is especially useful to position just right for smaller muscle groups.I received a free set of these massage balls to test and to review.

4:03 MinsThis set is a lot of fun. It is great if you like vigorous, body-weight exercises and circuits. It is also wonderful for those who like to compete whether they prefer to compete with themselves or with others. This set is a creative and fun way to get a HIIT workout.The set comes with a few decks of cards (some containing exercises, some interval ratios, and some to enhance the game play and competition. I have only played this game with myself, but I can see that playing against others would take it to the next level.Each card contains a short code and a QR code so you can easily watch a short video if any exercise is unfamiliar to you. This is so wonderfully creative as it is hard to figure out an exercise from a line drawing on a card. The illustrations are clear, but it helps to see the exercise in motion. I like how there are so many variations of exercises, sequence, and interval structure so there countless workouts. It can be different every time you play.I highly recommend this if you like this type of training and also like the idea of gamifying your workouts.I received a free set of the HIIT game for review. All opinions and experiences described are my own.

I have mixed feelings about this camera. It is not quite right for me, but may be perfect for others.First the good...*It is very affordable (at the time of writing this review it cost about $10)*There is a tripod mount connection at the bottom*You can adjust to zoom (within reason)*There are 6 small LED lights on the front and you can adjust the brightness. The lights give a cool, almost blueish light.*You can use it with no sound or as a built-in microphone (use just UBB for no mic or to use your computer's built-in mic or also use sound cord to input the cameras sound to your computer).*You can use it to take still pictures by pressing a button on the topI think this camera would be great for a PC desktop user with a computer with no camera who wants to skype, chat, do Google Hangout and more. Especially if that person needs a budget camera. It isn't right for me because I am a Mac user. I was able to get the camera to work with certain apps (mainly ManyCam and Google Hangouts). I like that I could adjust the zoom (a plus), but in truth the images did not look as good as my laptop's built in camera. I would tend to say, if your computer has a decent built in camera, you probably do not need this unless the positioning of your camera is not idea (you can position this how you want) or your camera auto-focus is not good. It might be nice if you want a second  web camera for alternate views.The Bad (other than my own compatibility issues:*It did not come with instructions, the camera was simply in the box.*The camera is very light weight plastic and I actually managed to break it when testing it for this review. (I do not know how, it still works fine but I broke the base off the camera.)*It seemed a little more difficult to set up and use than it should be, possibly because of the lack of directions. (I figured out how I can use it from reading the other reviews and then downloading the app ManyCam.)I received this item at a discount for testing and review purposes. The opinions and experiences described are my own.

I enjoy the Rockridge cookbook series as an affordable cooking reference set. I don't regularly do home canning, but have fond memories of my grandmother canning in the Summer and Fall. This is such a useful book to have on hand when harvesting a garden, buying seasonal vegetables or visiting a local you-pick. It covers the basics for small batch home canning. By small batch, the recipes and instructions are for about 3 - 6 pint jars. This is perfect for me. I also like that it touches on the topics of low sugar and low sodium canning--as those are my biggest concerns with canned foods (other than safety of course!).I also like that although it is a book that covers the basics it has a few unusual (to me) recipes including Rosehip jam. Most of the recipes do feature more common ingredients so it is great for taking advantage of seasonal specials. The recipes include jams, jellies, conserves, condiments,  sauces, pie fillings, salsas, chutneys, pickles, and canned fruits and vegetables.As someone who does not have a lot of space in my kitchen, I like that the book focuses on small batch canning. I also like that it mainly uses basic techniques. There are some distinctive recipes, but I suspect it will be more interesting to someone new to canning.I received a complimentary download of this book for review.

From my Goodreads:Imagine a world where the books we read are considered catalysts for the minds of serial killers. A world where the ideas we express and publish are considered so dangerous, that even stories like Little Red Riding Hood would be taken off of shelves and burned for its "violent content."Imagine a world where libraries and those who recognized this overblown censorship enlisted to fight for our freedom of expression. Where lives were in danger over censorship unlawfully imposed on us. You might be thinking, "Why in the world would you be willing to die for books?" Well, then you have a lot to think about dear friend. As silly as the concept is, if you actually look into it, this concept of censorship is happening around us all the time. If you don't see the connection of how branding our entertainment as evil influences over our minds, that humans are so weak willed that they would emulate what books had depicted, then you fail to see what makes this story so important.Kasahara Iku has been waiting to read the last book in a series for 10 YEARS. When she finally gets the chance to buy it, the Improvement Special Agency (part of the Media Improvement Committee who are doing the censorship) storm in to the bookstore. Iku slips the book under her shirt, but suddenly, an enforcer grabs it from her. Iku desperately fights to keep her book. To anyone who understands the pain of waiting for a conclusion to a series, to have their rights violated, I am certain you can understand Iku's feelings and actions, even if the concept of the story might still sound absurd to you. Just as she is shoved to the ground, someone catches her. This man becomes such a prominent figure to Iku that she vows to join the Library Defense Force after he saves all of the books from censorship and returns her the book she had been waiting for 10 years to read.Problem is, she never saw his face. She remembers the feeling of his arms as he caught her, his heroic rescue of the books, and his victory. She equates him to a prince for she is a huge romantic, and after evaluating her choices in college, proceeds to enlist to the Defense Force. Iku is the first woman ever to put the Defense Force as her first choice, she's driven, and she's extremely tall for a Japanese girl, towering over her instructor. Her instructor, Doujou, seems to always be finding ways to criticize her, and Iku disdains him. It isn't until she gets to know her instructor better, that she realizes he might care more about her than she ever knew, and that her "prince" might be closer than she thought.Toshokan Sensou-Library Wars in English-started as this Light Novel series, then inspired a manga series, an anime, an anime movie, and a live action movie with a sequel based on the second light novel coming out October 2015. I watched the movie first before realizing there were other ways of watching the series but instantly fell in love. The acting was amazing, the characters were great and the romance wasn't in your face. Just like this book, everything was well done.Those who have read light novels before will probably tell you how poorly written they are. I have to disagree. You must take into account the fact that this is written in a different style to fit a different culture. Whereas most YA books have plenty of detail, light novels tend to speed forward. They don't waste time describing the color of someone's eyes or how their hair looks or what exact brand of clothing they own, or what kind of tree this is etc. They spend time developing the characters, making you understand the world and politics and rules set up, and make you dive into the thoughts of the characters. It was a different experience. Light novels treat you as intelligent. They assume you as the reader can interpret the surrounding of the story without too much detail. They treat you as an intelligent person. This is not to say that YA treats you as someone of no intelligence, but I have noticed now just how excessive the use of detail is in our books.The translations of this book were done by Methiliel, who has provided a PDF of this light novel. This book not licensed in English so there was no way to read it until now. I have to give this translator a huge round of applause.
