You see the airport it departed from, airport it is landing to, the times for both, as well as the capability to email or message that information to someone if you so choose. You can do a whole bunch of other stuff with this information if your phone type permutes, as well as track the flight in real-time if you download another app (Flighttrack).I checked this app alongside my local airport's flight website, and so far everything has been accurate. When you are in the app, the airport's time, the interval of time the list of flight are being shown to you as well as the last time the app updated said list is indicated on the bottom of the screen in small lettering. It is not intrusive, but moves at a constant basis. On the top left status bar is where the name of the airport is located, and to the right of that are two arrows that you can pick to decide if you would like to see departing or arriving flights. You can only see one or the other, not both at the same time.There is also a search bar for your convenience if you would prefer to cut to the chase and find your flight. I was unsuccessful in finding some of the random flights I found in or out on the airport's website, so I thought there might be an issue with accuracy with this app. However, on the bottom of the screen it is indicated what interval of time the app is showing flights. At the moment it is showing at a six hour interval -- therefore only the arriving or departing flights from 2:55am to 8:55am pst. It really depends how long you are at an airport to determine if you would need a more broad list or times of flights, but that may be an issue or inconvenience for some. I could not find a way to expand or lengthen the time interval either.If the flight is on time/en route, the time is green. If it has landed, it is blue. If it is delayed, it is orange (though it may look red to some; it's more of a tangerine orange in my opinion, but that is besides the point).At the end of the day, I really like this app. I can see those who frequently travel benefitting from it, and a great app to have for those who sporadically travel as well.

This lotion was prescribed by my dermatologist as I have Eczema with a weird combination of Psoriasis, and as it as ceramides in it, it is supposed to help restore my dry skin. I have been using it for almost three months, and I like it over all. It isn't oily to me, which is nice. I will say that I use it as a body moisturizer and not something on my hands (even though I have some Eczema there). I have really dry hands (especially in the winter), and it's hard for me to find lotion that actually moisturizes my hands literally and visually. So I do put it on my hands by habit, but I put either Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream, 7.3 Ounce or Vaseline Cocoa Butter Deep Conditioning Body Lotion 13.52 oz, as they both absorb very well into the skin on my hands. But Cerave serves its purpose, and is something that will be on my permanent lotion list.

I have been looking for comfortable boots that aren't fancy heeled boots, or fancy heeled boots that go up mid thigh, and this is one of them! It's really hard now a days because it seems (at least to me) that everything is coming out the same, and I just want a standard boot that doesn't have a spike heel that I cannot nor do I have a desire to walk in.I have this in black, and this shoe is completely comfortable. I like the style of the boot, which is very combat like. I like that it was the lace up front so you can tightened it up to the size you need, but it has as zipper down the side for ease and comfort. These are inexpensive as well, which is greatly appreciated, so I am counting all positives.

Sambas are really cool. I would always steal my sister's pair to wear (which she didn't mind) because they were so easy to coordinate with and comfortable to wear. Funnily enough a classmate was wearing them as well, though he said he majorly wore them or purchased them for playing soccer. I just told him I wear them to have shoes on my feet, lol. Very good shoe regardless in regard to whatever you need them for.

I have wanted an Invicta watch since I saw them on a cruise many years ago.  Invicta makes high quality watches our grandparents would have loved but with style that fits the 21st century.  The current fashion trend with watches is for them to be big and this one fits that description.  This watch is large and thick.  You can see in the photos the two toned colors, the additional dials for day, date and 24 hours.  The first thing I noticed when I opened the box is that it comes with an instruction booklet that is thick and explains how to adjust all the settings for just about every watch Invicta makes.  It is somewhat generic for all invicta analog watches but it's well written and includes a short story of how the company began.  It also comes with care instuctions and a plastic card where you can record the purchase date.I  put the watch on and was pleased that it was loose on my wrist. I have very large wrists for a woman and many bracelets and most watch bands are too small for me.  I will be able to adjust this smaller if needed but for now it's very comfortable fitting loosely.  I haven't had it long enough to talk about how well it keeps time but, because of the brand and the warranty that comes with the watch, I will assume it does a good job at that.  The documentation that comes with the watch includes care instructions and recommends you take this watch to a watch shop for inspection once a year to keep it in top running condition.  Overall, I am very pleased with this watch.  However, if you don't want a very large timepiece on your arm, I would recommend you look at other watches from Invicta.

This is a stunning ornament that will look very nice on my tree.  Earlier I purchased the same ornament with the angel in place of the snowman.  Both ornaments have a switch on bottom to turn on the lights and the lights cycle through different colors.  This would make a great gift for a gift exchange or make any tree look beautiful.

This is a nice docking station that looks good and does it's job.  It's smaller than you would thing based on the photos but it works well with my iPhone 5s.  I use a case that is open on the bottom and that is critical for this dock.  Otherwise, the phone will not sit on dock and have a good connection with the plug.  The white part of the dock feels "clingy" so it helps stablize your phone.  If you have a larger iPhone6 this seems like it would be easily toppled over and definitely with an iPad.  The cord is a good length to plug into a wall socket.I tested this first while sitting on the sofa with my laptop in my lap.  I plugged my phone in and set the dock next to me.  Since the surface was unstable, it fell over and I jostled it around quite a bit.  My phone stayed securily connected and my poor choice of surface didn't affect the dock in fulfilling its purpose of charging my phone.

I bought this mouse to go with my rock candy keyboard, hoping that it would use the same wireless transmitter as the keyboard.  Sadly, I haven't gotten that to work but I like the mouse in spite of that.  It has a very smooth motion and feels good in the hand.  It's very responsive and I can't tell a difference between this mouse and the wired mouse it replaced as far as response times.  When the computer is away from the mouse for a while or has been turned off, you need to click the mouse before it starts working again.  This is a great feature to save battery life.  You also have an on/off switch.This mouse is also a great conversation piece.  I can't tell you how many coworkers have stopped to comment on the cool keyboard and mouse.

I have never used a silcon baking mat and was impressed with how easy it was to use.  I placed it in the bottom of my jelly roll pan and dropped the cookie batter on the mat.  I didn't change the temperature or baking time and my cookies came out great - NO STICKING.  It was really nice to not have to scrub a pan and the mat cleaned up quickly and easily.  I am storing mine in the jelly roll pan so they stay flat and are right where I need them the next time I bake.  This will also prevent them from getting any kind of memory rolled up.  My next experiment will be with baking a sheet cake and I will use this mat under the cake.  I'll let you know how it "turns out".

I've been buying Mandala color books for my mother and she swears it lowers her blood pressure. She makes beautiful pages and I make okay pages. However, with the information in this book I have techniques to apply and color combinations that will bring my pages to life. The author describes the types of pencils and pens to use, patterns for effects, and goes into the color wheel and color harmony. He also talks about the different patterns in the books available and how to use coloring as a part of meditation. I highly recommend this book to all my friends.

I've been using Reynolds Parchment paper for years and this is a great deal since it can be very difficult to find in the stores.  I first learned to use parchment paper for baking from a chef teaching a class on baking with chocolate.  we made a flourless roulade and the parchment paper was critical in baking and then rolling the cake.  Since then, I use it when making things like chocolate dipped fruits or cooking foods in a pouch.  This is one item I keep on hand at all times.

This lovely ornament is well made and very pretty.  It came exactly as described, a white birdhouse with a cardinal peeking out.  It looks hand painted and is not too heavy for the branches.  It comes in a pretty red box where you can see the ornament inside.  It will be very pretty on my tree.  It would also be a very nice gift for a young couple with their first home.Update 11/17/15 - today I received the "annual ornament".  This is a stunning egg shaped ornament with gold plating and intricate cut outs.  It's fairly large, about the size of my hand.  It is by far the prettiest ornament I've received from Lenox and I can't wait to see it on my tree this year.  It's going to be so pretty with the colored twinkle lights reflecting off the gold and through the small holes.

I love this bowl from Lenox.  It is a cream color decorated with holly and a cardinal and comes with wooden salad spoon and fork.  It is larger than i expected based on the photo.  I see no flaws in the design or the construction of the bowl.  I can't wait to set my table of Christmas goodies with a fresh green salad in this bowl.  This would make a great gift for anyone wanting to decorate their table with beautiful china dishes for the holiday.

The pictures just don't do this set justice.  The platter looks thin and delicate with a holly pattern that goes well with my Christmas china.  The salt and pepper look like a couple of eggs sitting in the center.  I can see using this platter for more than eggs, other h'orderves or even finger desserts.

I'm sitting here chewing on this new jerky and loving every bite.  The pieces are tender with a lot of flavor.  You can taste the smoke and it really makes you think of Korean BBQ.  This jerky is much more tender than most of the beef jerky I've had and I'm now a fan of pork jerky.  The package says it contains about 3 servings but I'm afraid mine will only make one.  That's okay though because it's 1g of fat, 8g of sugar and 11g of protein per serving.  The sugar might be a little high, but it's BBQ so that's what I expected.

This ornament is beautiful.  On the base is a switch to turn on the lights and the angel inside changes color.  It's very delicate looking and sparkles in it's own light.  I plan to give this as a gift in an ornament exchange and I know the recipient will love it.

I was disappointed in the quality of this product.  I knew it was going to be plastic but I didn't expect it to be that brittle kind of plastic that will crack and break after a few washes and use.  That said, we'll see if it exceedes my expectations.Setup - you have to look at the manual for this one because it is not obvious how to set it up and/or take it apart for cleaning.  It came with the pump in it but not attached in any way so it rattled in the box.  To open the area with the pump, there's a small tab that you push up on and the whole thing opens up.  The pump has a small round opening that fits inside the round opening in the side of the interior of the dish so the water stream is controlled.  After washing everything in mild soap and attaching the pump to the dish, it was ready for use.Use - The dish holds more water than I expected and can be very heavy.  I was concerned that the sides would break when I lifted the full dish from the sink so I recommend you find a place for the dish and just refill it with a glass or something.  It runs very quietly and there is very little motion in the water.  However, if you look closely, you can see ripples in the water and see that it IS circulating.  I set this bowl up close to my cat's food dish and old stainless steel water bowl.  I let the water in the old bowl get stale to entice kitty to try the new bowl.  As far as I can tell, she is still avoiding it.As I mentioned at the start of this review, the entire dish is made of molded plastic.  This is something I avoid in my pet's food and water dishes based on the recommendation of my vet.  I had a kitty who suffered from feline acne and plastic was a big no-no.  It is nice that this dish can go in the dishwasher but I'm concerned the detergents and heat will bleach the color and break down the plastic.  For this reason, I give it three stars.

These will look very pretty on my Christmas tree.  They are lightweight glass and the colors are subtle.  They pick up the light very well to add an elegant but simple look.  They would also make great gifts.

I've been using this serum for about a week and have noticed that the fine wrinkles on my face have started smoothing out.  It's a very light oil and my skin absorbs it quickly.  I've been post menopausal for 5 years and noticed my skin is getting thinner and showing signs of aging.  My arms have especially started looking "old".  I've been applying the serum to one forearm and not the other so I could see if it makes a difference.  After a week, the arm with the serum does look a little less wrinkled than the other.  I plan to continue using this product.

I got this for my husband's desktop computer because he chose to build it without a wireless card.  It sticks out of the computer quite a bit but since it's a desktop under a desk that doesn't cause any concerns.  It's fairly close to the wireless router and and when it works I haven't observed any serious latency issues.  However, there are periods when the device just stops working.  I have experienced similar issues with other USB wireless converters and suspect the problem is more with the USB port than it is this device.

I love the bright color and the feel of the keys on this keyboard.  It was easy to set up once I acquired some AAA batteries and borrowed a screw driver from a coworker.  The keys are big and well spaced and the raised portion on the F and J are easy to feel so you can get lined up.  The home/end/insert/delete keys are in a logical place on the keyboard and clearly labeled.  All of the keys are quiet EXCEPT the spacebar which clicks every time you hit it.The keyboard takes two triple A batteries that supposedly come with the keyboard.  They were missing from mine but it was only a minor inconvenience.  Just make sure you have some on hand.  Being a person who frequently eats at my desk, I like how easy it is to clean this keyboard.  Setup was as easy as plugging in the wireless dongle (which is hiding in one of the small end boxes).  I am using Windows 7 and it was able to find the correct drivers and start working right away.  The function keys appear to do the things they are supposed to do.After typing on it for a bit, my hands are a little cramped so maybe the keys are a little closer together than I had thought.  Also, I would prefer a little more elevation when I use the legs under the keyboard.  Otherwise, it's pretty and trendy and functional.EDIT - I ordered the PDP Rock Candy Wireless Mouse to go with this keyboard and, while I like the feel of the mouse, I am disappointed that it is not recognizing the wireless transmitter from the keyboard and vice versa.  I have two small wireless transmitters sticking out of my laptop and no USB ports remaining.  I will contact customer support if I can't get the two to work with just one transmitter as advertised.

After several months of use these pillows have turned into a flat space and a couple of lumps, not at all like a down pillow.  I shake the pillow and try to get the lumps distributed but sometime in the middle of the night the lumps return and I am sleeping either on a lump or a very flat spot.  I got these as part of a black friday sale and I can see why they were so deeply discounted.  I would not recommend them to anyone except as pillows to go into a decorative sham.

A dear frend of mine LOVED these Wine-A-Rita mixes.  You put the mix, some wine and some ice in a blender and out comes a slushy delicious beverage.  When my friend passed away, I bought this box of the different flavors and gave them out to my friends.  It's a nice assortment with all the flavors made.  My favorite is the peach belini.  My one issue came after I read the ingredients.  It is basically a bag of flavored sugar.  It gets 4 stars because it is a delicious bag of flavored sugar.

I have a shredder that I never use so wind up with mail and other items that need to be "wiped" before throwing them away.  I first tried this on a mailing label and it did an okay job.  There are a few places that I went over too many times creating a solid black which made the text underneath readable.  I can see that for some things, like mail or prescription bottles it will work but for those glossy labels, I should resort to shredding.

I love this jar.  It is made of lightweight plastic so it won't weigh you down to carry for your lunch.  You can put your salad in the jar and the cup in the lid is perfect for the dressing so you don't have to deal with soggy lettuce.  Both the lid and the cup seal so there are no leaks.  The top of the jar is big enough to eat straight out of the jar - no bowl needed.

I frequently pinch a nerve in my neck that can be debilitating for days. I was suffering from a pinch at work when a friend told me he had something that would help. He sent me a link for this trac collar. I had it the next day thanks to Prime. I've used it several times and can tell it has made a huge difference. You want to be sure and read the material that comes with it so you use it properly. You don't want it too tight.
Fit it charging cables are easy to misplace so having an extra cable is a good thing. This cable works well with my Fitbit charge HR.

This is my second wireless Epson color printer and I couldn't be happier with it.  Setup was very easy and I haven't had any issues connecting to it from anywhere in the house.  The touch screen is an upgrade from my older printer and makes selecting options a snap.  I could see where it could be a little frustrating for someone with large hands and I'd recommend they get one of those smart phone styluses if it's too small for them.  The print quality is everything I expect from an Epson printer.  The colors appear true and match what I see on my calibrated monitor.

I was expecting a strong flower scent but it was not.  The powder has kind of a talc feeling to it but when you apply a little water and rub it in your hands, it lathers up and makes a nice wash.  My face feels fresh and clean.  It's not dry or stiff feeling.  One thing to note, when you receive it in the mail, it is likely to have opened and spilled into the envelope.  Hopefully the manufacturers or shippers will fix this problem by sealing the lid somehow.

I'm a fat lady and need to work on my core. This product was offered to me through the Vine program and I thought some people might appreciate the feedback from someone who doesn't work out on a regular basis but would like a stronger core for better health.  I took every thing out of the package and felt a little overwhelmed.  I was ready to strap it on but it said I had to first charge it for 2 full hours.  As most exercise adverse people would do, I put it all back in the box for another day.  Finally I got it out and plugged it in to charge.  That evening, I read through the quick start guide and put the gel pads on for the widest point.  It comes with two sets of pads so when one set wears out, you have another to use.The controller is easy to use and the band was JUST big enough to go around my middle.  Per the quick start guide, I turned up the intensity until I could feel my abs tighten.  Then I turned it up a little more.  I went about my business, doing a little house work, watching TV until the cycle finished.  The next day I could tell that my abs had been exercised.  They felt tighter and a little sore as if I had done a few extra sit ups. I'm looking forward to using the more advanced features.

My mother is diabetic but cannot have artificial sweeteners, sugar alcohol, gluten and has other food alergies.  We tried the Zevia Tonic water and LOVED it.  The first time I had a product with stevia in it, it was very bitter so I have been hesitant to try Zevia brand sodas.  I didn't taste any of the bitterness I exected so this will be on the top of my shopping list from now on.  It contains Erythroitol which is a sugar alcohol but does not have the same negative affect on the body that other sugar alcohols cause (gas, bloating, diarrhea).  We opened the first can and enjoyed it in a cocktail and later I heard the sound of a second can being opened.  Today, no negative side effects.I can't wait to try other flavors.  It's nice to have a sugar free alternative without the artificial sweeteners.

This is a great pack of snack mix.  You get 21 each of Hershey's Snack Mix and Reeses Snack mix, in 270 calorie packs.  Each pack has a mix of candy, nuts and pretzel nuggets so you get a nice mix of salty and sweet.  They are a little high in sugar but these aren't supposed to be health food.  I plan to pass these out at halloween for trick or treats but I might not have any left since the family loves them.One thing to consider when ordering these online:  If you live in the southern states, wait until winter.  The first few packs I opened were a solid glob of melted chocolate, pretzel bites and nuts and this was in September.

FIrst let me say, it's beautiful and the glass bottle is very heavy and well made.  It is smaller than I expected and this is a good thing because you don't want a lot of nectar in the bottle for a long time or it goes bad and you hurt the hummingbirds instead of feeding them.  The spinner comes in a separate package, like it was an afterthought.  It's almost as big as the the feeder bottle is tall.  The red color is similar to the color of the nectar and will attract the little birds.  The feeding stations are just right.  It is currently the end of the season for hummingbirds as they are currently migrating for the winter.  However, it is still a lovely addtion to my garden.I took one star off for packaging.  Although I received this as a Vine product, it was in the original packaging from the vendor.  The bottle was wrapped in bubble wrap but not completely and the two items were in the bottom of a very large box.  I am impressed that the glass didn't get broken (testament to the thickness and quality of the glass) or that the spinner wasn't damaged from the bottle bouncing around in the box.

I use a One Touch Ultra to test my sugars on a regular basis.  This review is a comparison between that monitor and the iHealth Bg5.Setup:  Setup for this monitor felt cumbersome.  First you have to charge it for two hours to ensure a good change.  Other monitors use watch batteries that you can replace and come ready to use out of the box.  In addition, you have to download the app to your smart phone and then link the monitor to your phone.  I look forward to getting the feedback in one place on my phone but this would be intimidating to someone who is not quite as "electronically savvy" as I am.  (I'm thinking of my mother.)  Finding the port to plug in the monitor is a challenge. It has a little plug on the side and the opposite side has a power button that is very, very tiny.  They look identical and it took me a bit to find it.Use:  The lancet device is pretty and functional, but still takes some figuring out to get it right.  I prefer the design of the lancets I have with my OneTouch Ultra because the top that you remove to expose the needle becomes a cover for the needle so it can be disposed of in a normal trash can if necessary.  With the lancets included with the iHealth monitor, you end up with a used, exposed needle that should be disposed of in a sharps container for safety.  It's also difficult to figure out how to adjust the depth of the prick.  It is hard to turn but you can turn the end of the device to make adjustments.  It is just not clear that this is what you do since it is so hard to turn.Before you do your first test, you should scan the bottle of test strips.  The app will tell you that it will automatically expire those strips in 90 days. I thought it would read the expiration from the bottle but the 90 days seems like a built in value.  Otherwise it would tell you they will expire on a specific date.I tested with both monitors at the same time using the same finger stick.  iHealth ready 15 points higher than my OneTouch and required quite a bit more blood than the OneTouch.  My mother did the same with similar results.  A second test with the same stick and my results were lower.  I would have expected the same results both times since they were from the same stick and within a few minutes of each other.PROS: Small design with convenient carry pouch that has room to carry everything you need including the charging cable. Values stored on your smart phone for easy tracking over time.  I haven't played with the app much but it has potential to help people manage their diabetes.CONS:Difficult setupInconsistent values and high valuesComes with a control solution and I will try to calibrate to see if the values are closer to the other monitor (which matches the values my Dr gets).  Most monitors today do not require calibration with a control solutionI can't get my replacement strips from the local Pharmacy - my insurance covers the cost of the strips and my Dr. writes the prescription for them.It takes a bigger stick to get enough blood for a test.

I bought this book as a gift for my mother who enjoys coloring and especially enjoys Manadala pictures.  These pictures have some very tiny lines and can be difficult to color with some markers but the end results are stunning.  In the two that are in the attached picture, she used roseart fine tip markers and fine tip crayola markers.

I really want to give this product a great review because it DOES pick up cat and dog hair.  I bought it to more easily clean the stairs in my house and I have a persian cat.  I tried it first on the carpet in the living room.  This is a low pile carpet with thin padding.  After a couple of pushes, the connector in the handle broke off in the head and that was the end of that.  I will still use the head on furniture but it's useless for me for floors and stairs without the handle.

I wanted a charger for home and one for work so I can charge when I need to.  Sadly, it doesn't fit my Fitbit Charge HR.  I tried it on my sister's Fitbit Charge (no HR) and it's the same problem.  I'm not sure what it's supposed to fit.  I'm very disappointed.

This is a great starter set of matching dishtowels, two potholders and two oven mitts.  The fabric on the dishtowels is a thin terry cloth.  Both the potholders and the oven mitt are more of a heavy woven material.  I have large hands so I found the mitts to be a little difficult to maneuver but they felt substantial enough to use when pulling those cookies out of the oven.  The potholders are thin but protected my hands just fine.  I think I like the towels the best.  I was pleasantly surprised that the print on the terry cloth didn't bind the loops together into a stiff, unusable towel.  The towels are thin enough that they dry quickly but can absorb quite a bit of water.  One thing I found interesting is that the decoration on everything says "Product of USA", referencing a UA vineyard.  The set, of course, is made in China.

I am fair complected with rosacea so finding a blush that suits my coloring is difficult.  I also need one that isn't going to irritate my skin and cause a break out.  I use Neutrogena soaps and foundation so it made sense to try this blush.  In the package I received the blush Rosy plus the bronzer and the luminous powder.  All can be used as a blusher but I used Rosy for blush, the bronzer to highlight areas to get a sunkist look and the luminous powder all over.  You need your own brushes to apply this product.  It goes on nicely and blends very well.  On my pale skin with red blotches, it smooths out the colors and looks natural.  If you are looking for something bold, keep looking.  This is a blush that is very subtle.At the end of the day, when I remove my makeup with a facial cleansing wipe, there is plenty of color so it stays on very well.  It's just very subtle.

Today is day three for me using the Lumo Lift and so far I am fairly impressed.  Out of the box you get the Lumo lift, a charging base, two magnetic clips and a clip that is supposed to be used with your bra strap.  I plugged in the charging base and charged my lift for two hours as recommended.  In the pictures, you see the base as a place to set your lumo lift but what it doesn't show you is that it is magnetic so the lumo lift practically jumps onto the base.  If you have it sitting on a desk, you don't have to worry about it not charging due to a poor connection.  I've seen some videos where the owner actually used a rubber band to attach the lumo lift to the charger but I see no need for that at this point.After charging, I set up an account and installed the software on my iPhone.  It paired with my phone almost instantly.  I found the app to be helpful as it takes you through a first time user's training session.  You need to remember three things.1.  Double click to tell it you are in good posture.  You need to do this periodically throughout the day as it can move and get off.2.  Press and hold to start a coaching session.  You don't HAVE to do coaching sessions.  Lumo lift will track how well you maintain good posture regardless but it is nice to be reminded when you've been slouching for two hours.  You will get one buzz when coaching starts.  You'll also get a notice on your phone.3.  Press and hold to stop a coaching session.  You'll get two buzzes when you stop the coaching.On days one and two with the lumo lift, I used the bra strap clip.  When I went to my car to get something, the clip slipped and the lumo lift fell under my car. :(  I crawled under and retrieved it and reattached.  When I reached my destination, it was off again.  I put it back in place and went about my business.  Later it fell off again, this time in the bathroom and I was lucky it didn't get wet.  I tried again on day 2 with similar results.  If you use the bra strap attachment, you need really thin, narrow straps.  If there is any padding in them, the clip won't hold.  I'm hoping maybe they'll come out with a new attachment that has a stronger magnet. (hint, hint)  I would have given this 5 stars if I'd had better luck with that clip.Today I am sitting here, back straight, lumo lift attached with the silver magnet and feeling great about my posture improving.  When I slouch for more than 2 minutes, I feel a mild tickle and straighten up.  I received an email from lumo lift congratulating me on meeting my first milestone.  I've also recieved emails from them saying that I'll get daily emails for the first 14 days to help me get started.  They say it takes three weeks to form a habit so the lumo lift team is making sure we all get a good start on that habit with plenty of positive feedback.

I was given a wallet style iPhone case for Christmas and loved it.  The case was wearing out so I ordered a couple from Amazon.  The other case I ordered did not hold up and was falling apart by the end of the first day.  Even though it said you could carry a couple of cards and some other items in the case, it couldn't close if you had even one.  This case, however, has a couple of credit cards, drivers license, a few gift cards, some cash and a receipt all tucked in to the wallet side and closes without any problems at all.  The only negative is flash photography.  The case is so thick, that when you take a photo with the flash, it over exposes and you get a whitish blur.  You have to remove the phone from the case, take the picture and then put it back.  This will wear out the case much quicker than if you left the phone in all the time.

This thing is very loud and clear.  I bought it as a joke for work where I tell people in meetings to speak up. Everyone had a great time playing with it and now it is being used by one of them when he's coaching his kid's soccer team.

My husband is the GoPro expert in my home and this is the case he requested for a gift.  It's great when you need to black out the lights and film in a dark place.  He even snuck in a little video on a cruise without being detected.
Good old fashioned fun.  I missed having a tree with Icicles on it and was tickled to find a seller with them.  My who family loved them and the sparkly tree.
I bought these as a gift for someone doing Mandala color books.  She absolutely loves them and the variety of colors.  No problems with them being dry or lacking in ink.

The brushes are very soft, compact and the bristles stay put very nicely.  I've used several different brushes and really like them except for one small problem.  One of them comes apart where the wood a metal meet.  This is not a good thing when applying eye shadow or anything else.

Once in a while I like tea in place of my morning coffee and this Saturday was one of those days.  I pulled out my tea ball and filled it to the halfway mark and then steeped this tea in hot water for several minutes.  The result was very weak, tasteless tea.  After several more minutes of steeping, the team had good flavor but was very tanic.  I'm giving it three stars because it's not bad tea, it's just not strong enough for my tastes and I used a lot of tea since my tea ball is large.

I have never used a manual grinder to grind my coffee and I am impressed.  This is pretty easy to use and I get a perfect grind every time.  With the electric models I've used in the past it varies from having large chunks to a fine powder - oops.  The Tanors Ceramic Burr Coffee Grinder comes with a handy storage bag, a brush to clean it and a handle.  The first thing I did was take it out of the original packaging and take it apart.  The section where the grounds go has a plastic sleeve that holds the grounds.  In the top, you have a "gear shaped nob" that you can turn to adjust how course you want it ground.  This can be unscrewed so you can take the grinding mechanism off for cleaning.  (Be careful, there is a small washer between the spring and the grinder that falls off if you didn't know it was already there.)After the initial wash, I put some coffee beans in the grinder, put on the lid and handle and started turning it.  I found it best to hold on to the top half of the grinder to give myself resistance against the handle.  After adjusting the grind to a fine one for a k-cup, I went to work.  Clean up afterwards was a snap and I allowed everything to air dry.  I've used it several mornings in a row and am very pleased.  Not only is it easy to use, it is much quieter than the electric gadget I had used in the past.

As I read this story I found myself becoming more and more disturbed and even started questioning my own sanity.  The author has done a great job of portraying the mind of one who suffers from mental illness while leaving the reader to question whether she is really mentally ill and what happened to Mia.  From the first of the book she held my attention.  I read on the train ride to and from work and found myself wishing the train ride was just a little bit longer.  Most of the story is in first person told to you in Estelle's thoughts.  Between chapters you get a snippet of a "news article" about the missing baby.  Overall, a good read and one that really makes you think.

I love the color and I love the fabric.  What I don't love is the quality and size.  I expect to be able to put my DL, a couple credit/debit cards and medical cards in a wallet like this along with one or two other things, like a gift card.  Instead, I am barely able to squeeze one gift card, DL and one Debit card into the wallet.  It has a place to slide a  dollar or two in but when you do that, it will not close because they didn't make the back wide enough to expand for anything to be stored in the wallet besides the phone.  The two pockets to hold a DL and credit card are too small as well and the pocket has already started to split out and fray.  I wish they had actually incorporated the space in the pockets to hold something.  Then I would give this 5 stars.  As it is, it won't last me even one month before it will be in tatters and tossed to the trash.

This is a very mild tasting coffee.  My first cup I thought it tasted very weak but after a few more times drinking it I have decided that it really is just a very mild tasting coffee.  It has a good aroma and is not burnt tasting.  If you are a starbucks drinker then this will not be to your liking.  One thing to note, the cups are not labeled to work in a Keurig 2.0 machine.  Also, the cups are a heavier grade plastic so it is harder to close the lid of the keurig than other cups.  I am intrigued by the advertising that came with the coffee referring to a french press made for k-cups.  That might make a better cup than my Keurig 2.0 which I had to trick to brew this coffee.

These are great little clips for cube walls, locker doors, refrigerators - anyplace that has a smooth surface where you need to hold something with a clip and don't want a permanent hole or sticker.  The backing reminds me of those gooey toys you could buy from a quarters machine and then throw against a wall to watch it splat down.  I had several of these toys: balls, octopus, etc.  The difference here is that the material used in the toys is against a flat surface so when you press it against something like a cube wall, it clings and clings very well.  I attached one to the refrigerator door and pressed out the bubbles like the instructions said.  Then I let it sit there.  When I came back, it was very thoroughly attached to the fridge.  The plastic clip is strong and holds papers and small objects very well.When I want to move it to another location, I simply peel it off, wash it if there's any dirt on it, and then put it someplace else after it dries.  My only concern would be painted surfaces.  I can remember my old splat toys leaving what looked like a grease mark on the wall.  I'm not willing to test that theory with these clips.  In the meantime, I will happily use them on my cube walls to hold those little things that take up space on my desk.
I received this as a gift and I love it.  It has a sweet floral scent that reminds me of  Freesia flowers or the perfume from the 80s called Tatiana.

I really wanted to like this caulk.  I have caulked my shower many times and do not do a great job.  It's messy and I wind up with caulk in places it doesn't belong.  I tried to use this in my kitchen where the caulk along the sink and the backsplash has gotten old an cracked.  It seemed easy enough to apply.  Press it into place and peel away the backing.  However, I am dealing with gaps that vary in width and this tape doesn't seem to allow for those variations like a caulk gun would.  After a short time, I gave up and went searching for a tube of caulk and the caulk gun to finish the job.

I've used Belkin chargers and cables in the past and have had good experiences most of the time.  This particular cable is much heavier than the typical Lightning to USB cable and appears to be well shielded.  I have charged my phone and saw no differences in the amount of time it takes to charge.  The length is an added bonus since I can now plug my phone in and still use it without unplugging or bending close to the outlet.

Although this color is called "on a silver platter" it's more of a gold dust with blue glitter.  Like any polish with glitter in it, it goes on a little rough so you'll want to apply a top coat every time.  However, it is very durable and resists chipping.  I found it easier to apply than the cheaper brands I typically buy with less running off the nail onto the skin and cuticle.  It's a very pretty color and I received a complement from a total stranger.

I have used this bath wash for several days and am very pleased.  My skin is very sensitive and, because of a bad sunburn, very dry.  Most brands of body wash cause my skin to be very itchy.  I have not had that problem with Neutrogena.  It has a pleasant scent and a little bit foams nicely and cleans a large area.

A coffee creamer that can sit on a shelf and not require refrigeration is a good thing if you have an office with a coffee pot and no fridge.  The powdered creamer is not exactly what I would call good.  I have been a user of Coffee Mate products for a very long time and I love the small individual sized cups which can sit on a counter and not go bad.  I also love the cartons that have all the different flavors.  All of the flavored versions have sugar in them to make them taste good.This Coffee mate creamer has a different formula than the ones in the little pods and the kind in the carton.  First, the "original" is sweetened so if you like your coffee with just cream added, this won't work for you.  The first ingredient is "sugar".  This is followed by water and partially hydrogenated oil.  Personally, I would prefer something that did not contain hydrogenated anything.The nutrition label says there are no trans fats but that is for a single serving.  The serving size is one pump.  One pump is supposed to be the equivalent to one of the single serving cups.  However, the advertising that came with the creamer says "most people put 2 or 3 pumps in their coffee so go ahead and put 3 pumps.  If it is not to your taste, you can put more or less the next time."  Since 2 or 3 is the recommended "serving", it would be nice if they could include the nutrition information for 2 or three.  They provide the information for how many servings you get in a bottle based on 2 pumps per cup of coffee.  Anyway, you are consuming trans fats which are very dangerous fats and clog your arteries.As for flavor, I first tried my coffee with one pump.  It was creamy enough for me and not at all sweet.  I added my usual sweetener and the coffee was good.  The next cup I added 3 pumps.  This was creamy and slightly sweet.  It tasted pretty good.  If it weren't for the trans fats that are hiding in the creamer, I would probably put 4 pumps in my coffee.  At work we have this creamer and a couple of the flavors.  I've seen people put a lot of this stuff in their coffee and I'm sure, because the nutrition label says no trans fats, they have no idea how bad it is for their health.  I would probably give this product 4 stars if the serving size was set to the recommended 2 or 3 pumps and indicated whether or not that provided 1 or more grams of trans fat.

When traveling in Central Europe I noticed most of the homes had lovely lace curtains in their windows.  I fell in love with the look and was excited to be offered these curtains from Amazon.  First, the lace pattern is very pretty.  The fabric, while not a dainty lace, is a durable polyester so they should hold up to years of sunlight.  The edges are not finished but are a selvage type edge with a slight chance of the weave unraveling.  The pattern is scalloped on the bottom which adds to the overall look.  They look very pretty hanging in my guestroom window.

I have never used fondant before but since all the cakes these days are decorated with fondant I thought it would be fun to try.  This fondant comes with very few instructions so I did some searching on the internet for a few more instructions.  Then I was ready to decorate.This fondant comes in two blocks.  You massage it and work it with your hands until it is soft and pliable.  It gets a little sticky on your hands as you work it but pulls off cleanly.  I added several drops of food color (gel type) and worked it until the color was even.  Then I put it on parchment paper and started rolling it out.  No matter how thin rolled it, it never showed a single crack.  I used one full block to cover my two layer cake.  I cut the excess from around the edges and smoothed out any wrinkles.  For decorations on my cake I used silicon candy molds and colored pieces of fondant to create roses and leaves and then played with the fondant to make ropes with two colors for edging.Overall, I found it very easy to work with and well made.  My husband strolled into the kitchen as I was finishing and devoured the last little piece that I had colored and not used.  It tastes a lot like marshmallows.

I love this style of Crocs so much that I practically wear them every day to work.  When new they don't look like I'm wearing crocs.  They are stylish and comfortable.  I have very wide feet and these fit me comfortably.

I found this book to be interesting and fun to read.  As a Christian, I have attended a few seders hosted in a Christian church with a Rabbi present to explain what each food represents but never fully understood.  Rabbi Moffic gives the history and the meaning of the seder and, at the end of the book, provides the full ritual.  Some of the history involves stories told through time, the fables of the Jewish people.  It adds a richness to the tradition that was missing before reading this book.

The Datacolor S5X100 SpyderExpress screen calibrator is designed to create a profile for your monitor to ensure it displays colors accurately. This is a valuable function for people who work with photography and videos in particular, ensuring that their finished products will display properly on other screens (assuming the other screens are accurately set) and print accurately. This type of device used to be extremely expensive; now, with consumer level products like this one, any home user can afford to have their monitor is accurately rendering their images.The device is powered through the USB cable, making it easy to work with. I appreciated that the USB cable was long, allowing it to wind down from the top of the monitor all the way to my CPU, which is on the floor.The process is simple, in principle at least - reset your monitor to its factory defaults, then place the calibrator's sensor over the center of your monitor, with a counter-weight holding the sensor in place. Next just start the calibration program. The test takes about 10 minutes, during which time the sensor can not be moved and nothing else can be displayed on screen (read that as - disable pop-ups and close all other programs before you start the test). Once the test is finished, the calibration software will generate a profile for your monitor that adjusts the monitor's output to create an accurate display.In practice, the process is not so simple.I ran two tests with the device and evaluated the results with an onscreen color chart.Initially, I had a great deal of difficulty getting the sensor to seat itself on the screen. If the monitor is straight up and down, the sensor dangles and doesn't press against the screen, which gives flawed results. The instructions said you should tilt the monitor to more of a horizontal position so gravity will keep the sensor in its place. Unfortunately, my monitor doesn't tilt that far back so the sensor wasn't firmly seated against the screen. As a result, my first attempt created a profile that wasn't anywhere close to accurate.My second attempt was better; I actually held the sensor against the monitor for the test. The instructions tell you not to do this, but it was the only way to get the sensor to stay. This test gave me more accurate colors but they were still a little dark. This could be due to the fact that my monitor does not have a factory default reset on it, so I may have run the test with the monitor set too bright. Once I ran the brightness up the colors looked very good.The Datacolor S5X100 SpyderExpress definitely does the job and is in a price range that consumers can afford, so it is an excellent value. Just be prepared to wrestle a bit with the device and your monitor to get it to test properly. I gave it 4 stars only because I feel the mechanism by which the sensor stays on the screen could be improved. Otherwise, this would be a 5 star product all the way.

Anne of Green Gables is a classic everyone should read.  The story of the red-haired orphan in Avonlea will steal your heart.  I've read all of the "Anne" books many times and it never become old or boring.  The story is set on Prince Edward Island around the turn of the century.  They are still using oil lamps and horse and buggy but you can get ice cream in the city.  Anne is adopted, accidentally but a brother and sister and is a sensitive, imaginative child.  The books take you from her growing up years ("Anne of Green Gables"), to her teen years as a teacher in "Anne of Avonlea".  Her years in college ("Anne of the Island'), years as a high school teacher ("Anne of Windy Poplars"), early married life "Anne's House of  Dreams", Anne's life as a mother ("Anne of Ingleside")  her children's adventures ("Rainbow Valley") and finally the story of her youngest in "Rilla of Ingleside".As a young person, I remember searching every book store to find the next book in the series as they had gone out of print for several years.  To have all of them in one kindle book is a great deal and so much fun to read.

I wore this dress for Easter and got so many compliments.  I'm shaped more like a potato than anything else and the dress did nothing to give the illusion of a waist, but the addition of a long string of pearls and it looked great.  I suspect it will fit better for someone with a large bust.  There's plenty of room in that department.

I applaud Michael Regale for writing this book on such a controversial topic.  I know a lot of people won't even consider reading it because it challenges what we have been taught or what we want to believe.  He starts the book with his background, from his youth when he meets and marries his wife up through the present day when his daughter says she's gay.  He delves into the science of homosexuality and challenges our own interpretations of the Bible.  It is a difficult subject to cover and one I think he did an okay job doing.

This bug spray didn't leave a sticky feeling when I sprayed it on my ankles before a walk through a grassy field.  I didn't get any chigger bites and the mosquitoes left me alone.  The smell is not bad.  When you first spray it on, it is propelled in a liquid base but dries quickly.  I have always hated the sticky feeling other bug sprays leave behind and like that this one feels smooth once it dries.

This is a beautiful dress and the pictures don't do it justice.  It comes with a matching, sheer jacket that is perfect for those of us with "fluffy" arms.  The bodice is heavily sequined and well made.  For my small bust size (for a plus sized woman) the bodice is a little too big and gaps under the arms.  However, it fits well around the rib cages.  The skirt is solid brown with strips of sheer brown fabric with sequins hanging down.  It'll make a statement when dancing and my partner spins me.  If you want to see the photos of the models with the jacket, you'll have to go to the Roamans website.  However, buy the dress here as you get a better price and free shipping.

Beautiful dress for a great price.  I wore this dress last Sunday for Palm Sunday service and got a lot of compliments.  I am small busted for a plus sized lady and this dress fit me perfectly.  It hangs just below the knees with the tiers hiding all my imperfections.  The jacket has 3/4 length sleeves and is very sheer.  This is a dress that works for cocktail parties and church.

My husband is a couch potato with a bad heart so I bought this fitbit for him.  It tracks his steps, the flights of stairs he climbs and his sleep patterns as well as his heart rate.  While he claims that he's not going to change his exercise patterns because of this device, he still brags when he makes his step goal or exceeds the stairs from previous days.  He also loves the caller ID feature since he frequently can't hear his phone.  The buzz on his wrist gets his attention and answers his phone.  As with all fitbit devices, you have a app on your smart phone and you can link with your friends to create a little healthy competition.  When my fitbit flex dies, I'm getting the FitBit Charge HR for myself so I have all the same great features my husband is trying (unsuccessfully) to ignore.  The only down side is the band.  This FitBit is built directly into the band so there's no tiny device to lose.  It is a little awkward to plug it in to charge because of the bulky band.  You also have to buy the size that's right for your wrist and you don't have the options of designer bands like you do with the flex.  Still, I think the features outweigh this one little inconvenience.  Soon you'll see these on the wrists of Hollywood celebrities on the red carpet and black bands will become all the rage in the fashion world.

I love this stuff.  When my mother was a young woman living in France, she discovered Maggi and used in her cooking to make everything taste better.  In the US, she buys a liquid Maggi for Asian cooking and lasagna, among other things.  This beef base does not contain MSG which is a huge plus for my family.  It's a great substitute for bullion cubes when making broth for soups, pastas, etc.

I have tried several L'Occitane products and have really liked them.  This moisturizing cream is thick and has a slight powdery scent.  I've been using it on my neck and arms as they get very dry.  It is quickly absorbed and does not leave me feeling greasy.  For some reason, my arms and hands are very dry most of the time and this has soothed the itch and I see improvement.  My neck is showing fewer signs of aging as well.  I highly recommend this product and the other items (face wash, wrinkle serum) that I have tried.

It only took me 5 minutes and no tools to install this shower head in my shower.  The hardest part was removing the old shower head.  To install, you simply screw on the main head to the pipe coming out of the wall, attach the hose to the two parts and you're done.  The instructions suggested you might need a wrench and eye protection but I didn't need either.  It was nice to not have to fight with that silicon tape or any goo to stop leaks.  I hand tightened everything and turned on the water - no leaks anywhere.How did it work?  First, I have a LOT of water pressure.  So much, that it has broken plumbing fixtures in the past.  With this shower head, you have several spray options.  There is a lever on the back right of the main head to switch from a rain like spray from the large head, spray from the large head and the hand held or no spray from the main head.  The hand held head connects to the main head via a magnet and clip.  It looks pretty solid.  It too has a lever to adjust from massage, massage and outer or just outer.  There is a button to stop the flow all together.  When I set the shower head to put water through all the jets, I got a soft trickle out of some of them and a sprinkle from the outer head.  Turn off the massage on the handheld and I got a little better "shower".  Turn off the handheld all together and plenty of water goes through main head.  The jets are spaced pretty far apart but it's a nice "rain".  The handheld by itself was pretty nice.  It gave a good massaging spray when operated alone.  If you plan to run the massage while standing under the "rain", you aren't going to get much of a massage.All in all, it's a pretty nice shower head.  Very easy to install and lots of options in how the water comes out.

I enjoy a cup of tea from time to time and generally drink Earl Grey, Chamomile or Peppermint - either loose or in a bag.  I have found that most teas brewed in my Keurig come out very tanic, almost over brewed.  I was very pleased with the Numi Jasmine Green tea for the Keurig.  It was not over brewed and had a very pleasing scent and flavor.  It was neither too weak nor too strong.  The cup used is recyclable and the tea can go in your garden or compost pile.  Just peel the lid back and you have a soft filter with wet tea.  (Let it cool before doing this!)One thing to note - this is NOT labeled for Keurig 2.0 which is the brewer that I have.  I have a ring from the top of a used 2.0 K-cup that I taped to the top of the Numi tea and fooled my Keurig into brewing.  I am hopeful the company will update the label this isn't necessary.

Got it for a really low price, but would not purchase it again.  Requires too much tugging to ensure all eye make-up is removed.  It is not an oil based make-up remover, so its effectiveness is minimal.

I waited to review this product after a few months of usage to ensure it was as good as it initially seemed.  It is better.  One of the best facial cream products I have ever used and I've paid as much as $120 for 2.5 ounces of the "good" stuff.  I will never do that again, now that I've found this product.  My skin is brighter and tighter after 3 months of use.  Fine lines are gone or significantly diminished.  The very slight lines and inevitable neck sag that was just beginning, is now completely gone.  If I go a few days without using it, I can tell the difference.  Since using it, I have been told by several different people (strangers, work acquaintances, etc.) that I have my beautiful skin!  It has firmed up the skin around my eyes, and diminished all fine lines that were creeping up on me around my mouth.  I am 54, and while taking good care of my skin most of my life, I can say that this product has bought me several more years of healthy looking, more youthful skin.  I also use it on my decolletage, top of my hands and forearms, and elbows with equally great results.  I recommend it highly.... especially in conjunction with apple cider toner (2 parts apple cider to 1 part distilled water), and Earth Science cleansers and facial cream.  Light clean fragrance.

Eucerin is a wonderful product, and this formula for very dry skin is no exception.  If you find that you have dry, itchy skin or have a profession where you frequently wash your hands, this product is a must have.  It does have a slightly greasy feel upon initial application, but absorbs quickly and nearly waterproofs your skin for hours thereafter.  You can wash your hands after usage and your skin will still be protected.  Wonderful barrier and re-hydrating lotion that heals and protects very dry skin anywhere you may have it!  I keep it in my purse at all times and have given it as a gift to others I work with.  Small, compact bottle perfect for travel or in your desk drawer.
The best season of the series.  Hilarious play on the West Wing with a great season finale.  JLD knocks it out of the park with this one!  Enjoy...

This eyeliner goes on smoothly, and can be sharpened to a fine point without the entire tip falling out of the pencil.  Very easy to use and apply.  Stays on for hours and I have a very physical job.  I never need to reapply.  Easy to smudge or blend, equally easy to draw a thin line.  Comes off easily with make up remover or just soap and water, yet holds up against sweat and humidity just fine.  I would compare the quality of this eyeliner to that of Lancome at 1/6th the price!  You cannot go wrong with this purchase.  Black/Brown shade is true to its name with the color applied in between that of dark brown and rich black.
This woman is HILARIOUS!  Great comedy routine for all ages.  I laughed 'till I cried.  Definitely worth a watch.

Keeps your hair perfectly in place, controlling frizz and protection your style from humidity.  The extra firm strength is strong enough to keep you looking great without being too stiff or leaving a film (unlike the "superior strength" version of this brand).  Brushes out easily leaving your hair soft, yet your "do" still in shape.  Does not have added water as the initial ingredients which if you have curly hair like mine completely destroys your hair style; and is not like aerosol super glue you only use if you're getting your hair ready for Halloween.  Short of buying $15 salon hairspray, this stuff is fantastic at half the price!  And getting two of them for less was a great deal - thank you Amazon!

Unfortunately, despite the glowing review from another purchaser, this product (bought as a gift) was a bust.  The item itself is smaller than an actual ukulele and is more like a child's toy than a musical instrument.  Not suitable for an adult. Very cheaply made, poor finish, "tinny" and even at the low price offered not worth the purchase at half the price.  Impossible to keep in tune. Further, ours arrived with a broken fret.  Inferior product.  Pay a little more for a better product and you won't regret it, as we did this purchase.

These are so cute and are a slightly large, yet perfect size for little hands to grasp and stack.  They come nicely packed in their own carrying case, and are a favorite go-to toy for my 9-12mos old grandson, whether being stacked or sucked on. :)  I do recommend a good wash before giving them to baby, but these are a definite buy for any curious baby to toddler.

So sweet and so much fun for my 9-12mos old grandson to play with!  Durable, yet lightweight, large and colorful.  I did notice the same chemical smell/taste when they first arrived but a quick wash in the machine took care of that.  I might have washed them in the dishwasher instead as it seems our Kenmore "bent" them out of shape a little.  Otherwise, a great and timeless toy - decorates the nursery nicely too!
Purchased for my son for his room... he loves it.  It's small but holds enough for one person, or a six pack to share.  Stays super cold...all while looking super cool. :)
Ricky G makes me laugh.... love watching him in whatever he does, 99% of the time.  If you feel the same way, you'll like this series.  If you're not sure.... watch the trailer for season 1 first.

It's "Breaking Bad."  There is absolutely NOTHING bad to say.... watch it all, and be ever so grateful if this is your first time watching the entire series.  Stuff like this doesn't come along that often.
Oh snorrrrrrre.... such great actors... such mediocre performances and/or writing.  If you can watch it for free, okay.  If not, take a pass.
Totally great, entertaining, profound movie.  Love the dance sequence and it's profound message about love and just being true to ourselves.

How could one not love "James Herriot" or his real life protagonist?  His vivid life stories as a country Vet in Yorkshire will stay with you, soften you, and cause you to yearn to see Yorkshire for yourself .... and perhaps live such a bucolic, and purposeful life.  You'll certainly want to see the television series on Netflix or Amazon Prime. A worthy read.

Works as described and intended.  But as others have written, what the heck is the deal with the industrial strength sticker placed on the side of it that takes a dishwasher, Windex, and a good scrub to get rid of?  Other than this annoyance, this is a solid flour sifter. Hand wash & dry well to avoid rusting.

Hate that they duped me by splitting up the final season (the final FINAL season is in 2015).  But still the same quintessential 60's story of metamorphosis and redemption.  Plus, the sets are very cool. :)  You've got to find out what happens, right?  So watch.  It's entertaining, after all.
See my earlier review of the same series.  A+ = watch it!

Oh hell ya!  Resisted watching this for some reason... but of course William Macy is worth your time.  Don't always like the frenetic sex scenes (who the heave actually goes at it like that?  No one.)... or the campy music at times.  I guess that's their way to make it relevant to all generations.  But the acting is sublime, the story rings more true than most Americans want to believe, and you can't help admire their survival instincts.  Well written, well acted, well done.
This is a light hearted fun read. A little mystery, some sleuthing, some lighthearted banter and flirting. Nothing serious just a moment in time for a good hearted read.

Wow this was good. This plot was somewhat confusing it was like two master minds working the town and people. In the end no justice just questions. But story had full on excitement loads of twists and turns.  And in the last paragraph though no justice we find out who is giving the killer info. I want to add one thing. Because of the cliff hanger ending I went online to see if there is another book. Yes there is. But for only in paperback and $13.49 for 274 pages it is to high of a price. It is disappointing to not be able to continue with this new author to me and the series.

There was a lot of sadness in this book, the kind of things happening we see in real life people cannot get past. A wretched unhappy women who causes all the problems. But love wins the day. This was a good book and I recommend the series.

This book had just a little to much sex and four letter F words. I can't say it was bad it wasn't but from the first book it was lacking. It did have a interesting sub plot on a sexual deviant, not something you would expect.

This book cover some serious issues. It will tug at your heart, it will also bring out a protective streak. Justice will be served and it will be sweet. Do not hurt a loving mothers child, because the mother bear will get you.

This story is full of violence. I wanted to stop reading it over and over. But something compelled me to keep reading. The best thing about this story is in all avenues of evil, justice is served. Is there a happy ending, is their any good guys? Read and find out.
Often as Burke came in and out of other books I felt sorry for him. He was almost untouchable because of his sadness. This book was a eye opener for Burke and time to restart living. Very good.

Lots of twist and turns in this book. That silly second date is the start of a hunt for a killer and another dead body. Who is the killer? The leading suspect lives to close to Tiffany, so she has special incentive to find that killer. You don't see the killer till the very end or why.
There is this dry humor through out the whole book. You cannot help but just wait for the next shoe to drop. Though I sure am wondering when Stone is going to wake up and make a move.

This book is probably not meant to be funny, but there is a light humorist side to the book. I look forward to more books in this series. Tiffinie' s parents, grandmother and neighbor Glen are going to be fun to get to know.

On so many levels I loved this book. The characters, the plot, the history, the humor,  that the villain is defeated was a bonus and that love beats out evil was a giant bonus. If you have not read this author, I can only ask why not. Go to your favorite book source and start at the beginning of one of her book series. You are in for a treat. One of the extra things I loved, was this was a full book with all questions answered.  I do not like shorts or novellas, a full book that I can invest my time in beats out every time.

All three books are excellent. This author is more than knowledgeable about wild women and about Alaska. As she grew up in Alaska and still goes back to fish every summer. Each female and each male in each story have strong qualities and problems but love brings them together. I strongly recommend reading each and all of Tiffinies books.
This writing style has some dry humor to the plot. You have no clue who the bad guys are till the very end and why. Enjoyed the book, and look forward to more.
Now this really not a laugh out loud book. But even with murder after murder their is a underlying dark humor. The murderer is caught, the bad guys in jail and a little girl has the last laugh.

Pretty good mystery, steeped in history. A basic con from the past continuing from a dark mind into the present. I thought I had figured out the villain in one of two characters. The story goes along with a obvious bully.  But then things change and you just have to wonder. And wonder right to the end.

Little bit hard to read as do not know all the English/UK slang terms. But a pretty good plot, quiet the twist to the ending. Did miss knowing how parents were on getting baby back. Was pretty good and I will look forward to reading more from this author.

So much misunderstanding, manipulation, a total mental stalker. To many killer as no one got the rich spoiled boy help. Things go from misunderstood, to communication, misery and finally justice. Very good, I always enjoy more in this series.

Ok this book had lots of conniving manipulation done by people close to the Senator. But love wins in the end. To make the book perfect, leave off the graphic sex. The intreage of the book had much more excitement. There are user's in every walk of life and how we stand up to them is a testament to our selves. And the strength to do so. This book is a perfect example of family and strength.

This book in the series could have been great. Just too much sex. A would be great plot, tragedy, loss of a spouse, starting over, a shy teacher trying to find a connection. The sex felled the pages, the plot fell apart.
Lots of intreage, heart pounding wondering why this girl is on the run. Love and acceptance in a family. Pure love from a dog. All around a very good read.
This is the second book in the series. It has the feel of visiting friends. Very well written, great plot, humor, and lots of twist's and turns. Looking forward to more in the series.

This is surprisingly excellent. Some tough issues, like abuse and murder. But a douse of confusion, humor and bumbling investigation. Add in a Alcoholic struggling and a good heart. Well. It all comes together to make for a great read.

This is a slow almost dry story that at first you wonder why you are reading. And then when you have learned the characters, you think you have the plot figured out. The story has you. The story becomes one of intreage the book one you cannot put down. And in the end a book well worth reading.

This is a sweet story. Two sisters who can't let love in, they have, but have not faced their fears. As the story unfolds so does love. Julie and Cat find they are in love, the see love in there parents music and they face their fears. And then the magic begins.

I think I have read this in book form some years back. Is it worth reading a second time? Yes! Even though I knew what was happening I still loved the story. It is sad, funny, full of heartfelt love, lies, master manipulators but bottom line is love comes calling and saves the day.

Pretty funny, not a serious book, light fluff to make you smile. This was fun to meet mythical creatures from another era. Too many 4 letter "F" words, but going in you know Cynthia always has them. Light sexual scene, not graphic actually a bit funny. This was good.

Slow to catch my interest but when it did I could not put down. As the book passed a certain point I was positive of the killer but this author kept taking us some place else. In the end I was right, but the way the book is written the author takes you on a different path with no clue. After finishing the book, you think oh wait a minute. As there is a span of time missing and all makes perfect sense. Very good book and excellent writer.
Some serious issues in this story, but honestly more uncommitted laughter. Character are so sure of what they want you just have to laugh at them. Very good book, I like this series and recommend.
Really enjoyed the romantic plot, loved the competitiveness between the two main characters. There is laughter and sadness in the ending and a happy conclusion.

This is a great way to read a bit of new to to you, authors. My favorite in the series is Leslie Langtry. It was wonderful to re-visit the Bombay family. If you haven't read any of this series. Start at the beginning and prepare to laugh at a bunch of bumbling assassins. All good authors in this bunch of short story's.

The only aches and pains I ever have are in my lower back. I like the results of creams like this but HATE the smells. This one doesnt' have that overbearing strong smell that could burn your eyes for days.  It has a minty smell almost like pepto bismol.  It is a lotion consistency not a gel.  The bottle is not huge but it does not take a lot of product even on a large part of your body.  It absorbs quickly and is easy to wash off.  I felt like it did just as good as the gel/strong smelling ones I have tried from the drugstore without the annoying smell.  I use this before bed in the evening after a shower.  I have not had much trouble of it transferring onto my bed sheets and it has not stained or had any affect on my clothing. I felt it took affect quickly and lasted to help me rest easier.  I plan to continue using this instead of my others whenever I have any muscles aches. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This little pretend play makeup set is so much fun. My little girl loves watching me put my face on in the morning. We have bought her a little vanity with makeup brushes but she did not have pretend makeup.  She is only two so any of the little girl makeup sets are way too messy for her to play with.  This little set comes with everything she needs to pretend.  The powder, blush and eyeshadow compacts have textured material in them so they feel like makeup but do not have any mess what so ever.  They have the look of real makeup but never get used up. I love these because I have a way to let my little girl be girly and pretend without having to worry about her getting it on anything or all over herself.  The lipgloss has a roller ball but no liquid inside.  The brushes are soft and so is the powder puff. This does not look like the plastic hard pretend makeup kits that often come with pretend sets. These look really real which makes them even more fun to play with. She can pretend to do her dolls' makeup which is extra fun also. It comes in a little makeup bag that helps keep it all together. Would make a cute little gift or stocking stuffer for that little girly girl in your life. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This cotton candy is delicious. It is a flavor I had never really tried(or heard of), but I am loving it.  My daughter and I are big cotton candy lovers and love summer and fairs because of it!  It's hard as a mother of a toddler to give her something she loves knowing that it is full of preservative and harmful ingredients.  This organic cotton candy gives me a bit of a piece of mind giving her her favorite sweet treat. The container this comes in is great because it is a snap close top so your cotton candy stays fresh and does not go stale or get hard quickly like the bagged cotton candy.  From the container, the product and the presentation you can tell that this company puts a lot of effort into making a quality, organic product.  The flavor is amazing!  This is by far one of my favorites with this brand.  The cotton candy is fluffy and very tasty.  It is really packed into the tub so you get a lot of product for the price. This would be a great unique gift option for that sweets lover in your life also(I recommend the 4 pack, it's a great value).  I plan to be back as a return customer for my family & as gifts. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I'm usually not a huge fan of Banana, but this cotton candy is seriously so delicious. I am extremely impressed with the quality and presentation of this product.  The flavor is pure and extremely tasty.  My household are huge cotton candy fans and of course hit up all of the carnivals and festivals and come home with a big bag of it. It is hard for me as a mother to give that carnival cotton candy to my daughter because I know it is packed full of processed ingredients and chemicals.  This cotton candy is made with organic ingredients that I can feel better about giving my daughter.  The containers are great for storing it also.  The container is a thicker plastic with a snap lid that closes tightly so you can store the candy in the cupboard without it getting hard or going stale quickly.  The company logo is right on the container and you can tell that this company really puts a lot of thought and effort into making a delicious quality product that is much better for you.  I plan to be back as a regular customer and to purchase for gifts. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My little girl is obsessed with cotton candy and watermelon, so what a great mix. This company puts a fun remix to traditional cotton candy that is awesome!  The flavors are full of flavor without all of those nasty unknown ingredients. It has a very pure taste to it and the watermelon flavor isn't too overbearing so you can seriously sit and snack on this until it's gone!  The packaging is really unique.  The container is a thicker plastic and the snap top stays air tight so your cotton candy can be kept for a bit without it going stale or getting hard.  From the labels to the taste you can tell this company really cares about creating a quality product that is unique and much better for you than all of that processed stuff.When my daughter tried this she probably would have ate the whole container if I let her. It's extremely fluffy and you can tell it is made with quality ingredients. This company has awesome flavors that you don't usually find in traditional cotton candy.  All of the ones I have tried so far are extremely delicious!  These would even make a great gift for that cotton candy/sweets lover in your life. I highly recommend this company and this product. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I have always been a huge fan of cotton candy.  It is my highlight of the summer and I have passed that sugary trait on to my little girl.  Sometimes it is hard to let her have cotton candy because it is SO sugary, full of preservatives and who knows what they throw into it.This cotton candy is totally different. I have a bit of a piece of mind giving her this as a special treat with it's organic ingredients.  From the second you open the box you can tell this company puts hard work and heart into this product.  The tubs are a nice size and the containers are a nicer thicker plastic so can even be reused :).
